summary: 14 Hands Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

summary: 14 Hands Hot to Trot Red Blend 750 mL

summary: 14 Hands Merlot 750 mL

name: 1884 Reservado Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: 1884 Reservado Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml

name: 1884 Reservado Mendoza Malbec 750 mL
summary: A customer favorite and a great BBQ wine, this Malbec goes very well with red meats as may be expected from an Argentine red. Made from grapes grown in the Andes mountains the aroma and palate of this Malbec are a delicate blend of forest fruits, plum and cherry.
tasting_notes: A vibrant red with violet tones, the aroma and palate of this Malbec are a delicate blend of forest fruits, plum and cherry. Smooth and concentrated tannins in the mouth result in a long and firm finish with minor hints of oak.
food_pairings: Pairs well with BBQ meats, cecina tacos and stuffed cheese.

name: 1884 Reservado Syrah 750 mL
summary: 1884 Reservado Syrah 750 ml

name: 19 Crimes Shiraz, Durif 750ml
summary: 19 Crimes Shiraz, Durif 750ml

name: 19 Crimes Shiraz, Grenache & Mourvedre Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The 19 Crimes red blend bears the same traits as those banished to Australia. Defiant by nature, bold in character. Always uncompromising. It's a taste you'll never forget.
tasting_notes: The 19 Crimes red blend bears the same traits as those banished to Australia. Defiant by nature, bold in character. Always uncompromising. It's a taste you'll never forget.

name: 19 Crimes The Warden Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Don't let this masterful blend escape you. Each powerful note brings you one step closer to a night filled with mischief and fun. Brooding with dark cherry and blackberry it is mouth coating with lashings of criminally intense dark fruit. Great with a rack of lamb or a grilled portebello mushroom burger.
tasting_notes: The Warden is a Shiraz-based red blend with tons of richness and complexity. On the nose, there is ample plum, currant, and cherry intermixed with vanilla and cinnamon spice. The same flavor profile is evident in the mouth, picking up some licorice notes.
food_pairings: Superb with braised short ribs, Australian meat pies, rack of lamb or a grilled portebello mushroom burger.

name: 50th Parallel Estate Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: 50th Parallel Estate Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: 75 Wine Co. The Sum Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: The Sum Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: This amazingly well endowed profoundly rich red wine must be smelled and tasted to be believed. The color is a rich, deep purple garnet and gives but a small hint as to what’s inside. The nose gives off soaring and wonderfully focused aromas of ripe stone fruit, vanilla, cherries, cedar cigar box, blackberries and cinnamon. In the mouth, there are layers upon layers of broad, sweet opulent fruit balanced by firm tannins, great acidity and oak.

name: 8th Generation Vineyard Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
summary: 8th Generation Vineyard Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: Merlot - an Okanagan beauty combined with equally renowned Cabernet Sauvignon blends together into red wine heaven. The Cabernet Sauvignon provides the structure (dark flavour of black currant and ripe bell pepper) while the Merlot shows off the fatter, juicier (black cherry, cocoa) component.
food_pairings: So versatile when it comes to food pairing. This wine is made to complement your dishes, not to outdo them. You won’t get tired of this wine as it got a wonderful structure combined with soft tannins and fruit. Have it with roasts, BBQ steaks, heavy stews or just a book.

name: Aalto Ribera Del Duero Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: Aalto Tempranillo 750 mL
tasting_notes: Deep purple red colour, as corresponds to old Tempranillo grapes. On the nose we perceive good fruit intensity, a great deal of freshness and hints of well integrated wood. On the palate we find all the elements one can expect from a great vintage: complexity, tannic structure, intensity and elegance. The typical flavours of our grape and our region are evident with liquorice, black berries, coffee, tobacco and spice, always within the distinct style of AALTO. This wine can be enjoyed now but will benefit from a time in the bottle, and will improve and gain complexity over many years if properly cellared.

name: Adega De Borba  Red Blend 750ml
summary: Adega De Borba  Red Blend 750ml

name: Adega Estate Winery Merlot 750 mL
summary: Adega Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: This Fruit forward wine is loaded with aroma of blackberry, cherry and hints of plum with accompanying notes of vanilla and anise. The soft tannins and long linger fruit finish with the light accompanying notes of oak make this a well balanced wine in flavour and structure which makes this wine easily approachable.

name: Adelsheim  Elizabeth's Reserve Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Adelsheim Elizabeth's Reserve Willamette Valley Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Akarua Rua  Central Otago Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Akarua Rua Central Otago Pinot Noir 750ml

name: Albino Rocca Vigna Loreto Ovello Barbresco 750 mL
summary: Albino Rocca Vigna Loreto Ovello Barbresco 750 mL

name: Aldo Conterno 'Il Favot'  Nebbiolo 750 mL
summary: Aldo Conterno 'Il Favot'  Nebbiolo 750 mL

name: Alma Mora Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Alma Mora Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Alpha Box & Dice Blood of Jupiter Sangiovese/Cab Sauv 750 mL
summary: Alpha Box & Dice Blood of Jupiter Sangiovese/Cab Sauv 750 mL
tasting_notes: It might not be a technical DOC wine classification, but the Super Tuscan is a sight to behold and a joy to taste. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon, making peace between the Italians and French. A traditionally fruity and earthy wine like Sangiovese meeting the bold and tannic density of Cabernet – the marriage creates a well-rounded, full-bodied and full-flavoured ensemble. Flavours of Maraschino cherries, whiskey style oak, complex bitters, chewy tannins and black olives.

name: Alpha Box & Dice Kit & Kaboodle Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Alpha Box & Dice Kit & Kaboodle Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Black cherry leather, boysenberry, tobacco and peppercorns fill the voluminous palate of Kit & Kaboodle, a McLaren Vale and Langhorne Creek blend of montepulciano, cabernet sauvignon and barbera. An herbal mustard seed edge from first sniff weaves throughout the juicy acidity, framed by pencil shaving tannins. Bright and mouthwatering on the warming finish.
food_pairings: Pair with red meats such as lamb and goat to bring out the wild flavours of the wine.

name: Alpha Estate Hedgehog Vineyard Xinomavro 750 mL
summary: Alpha Estate Hedgehog Vineyard Xinomavro 750ml

name: Altesino Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL
summary: No stranger to these pages, Altesino’s gulpable, modern Brunello is getting as many raves for this 2013 victory lap as it did for the stellar 2012 vintage that warranted it. Bursting with cola, eucalypt and sage, swirling around pomegranate and happiness. One could well put this down for a decade’s nap, but I won’t do that and neither will you (if you still have some 2012, you are stronger than me). Altesino is racy, big and delicious in youth.
tasting_notes: Ruby red, tending to garnet red with aging. A broad, ethereal and compound smell with sweet red cherries, flowers, mint and spices just some of the aromas and flavors that emerge from this mid-weight, restrained Brunello. Altesino impresses for its balance, freshness and finessed tannins. It isn’t a blockbuster, but it will drink well with its dry, warm and velvety taste denoting a rich texture and fine breed.
food_pairings: Pairs exceedingly well with roasted red meat, noble game and medium aged cheese.

name: Altesino Rosso di Montalcino Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Altesino Rosso di Montalcino Red Blend 750 mL

name: Alto Moncayo Grenache 750 mL
summary: Alto Moncayo Grenache 750 mL

name: Altos las Hormigas Terroir Malbec 750 mL
summary: Altos las Hormigas Terroir Malbec 750 mL

name: Alvaro Palacios Vi de Villa Gratallops Priorat 750 mL
summary: Chateau Bel Orme Tronquoy de Lalande Red Blend 375 mL

name: Amalaya Malbec 750 mL
summary: Colome Amalaya Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: Brilliant ruby color with violet edges. Strawberries, raspberries and ripe fruit with touch of pepper and spices aromas. In mouth, flavors of red fruit, spice and hints of vanilla from aging in French oak. Round, soft tannins lead to a delicate, lingering finish.

name: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari Campo al Mare 2015 Rosso Bolgheri 750 mL
summary: Awarded 94 Points from James Suckling, the Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari Campo al Mare Rosso Bolgheri 2015 is a powerful blend which is built for aging making it perfect for the collector. With its flavours of dark fruit and licorice this is a great wine to pair with red meats such as braised shoulder of lamb.
tasting_notes: On the nose are intense aromas of red berries with the palate boasting flavours of dark fruit, licorice and notes of violet and balsamic. A powerful blend which is built for aging.
food_pairings: With its firm tannins and intense fruit flavours this is a wine that pairs well with red meats such as braised shoulder of lamb or a grilled beef tenderloin with blue cheese butter. Equally versatile with non-meat dishes however such as a barley risotto or some delicious fondue.

name: Anakena Birdman Series Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Anakena Birdman Series Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Anarchist Mountain Vineyards Mayhem 750 mL
summary: Anarchist Mountain Mayhem Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: Aromatically it shows blueberry, plum, cocoa, white pepper and smoked meat notes.

name: Anciano Gran Reserva Tempranillo Aged 10 Years 750 mL
summary: Anciano Gran Reserva Tempranillo Aged 10 Years 750 mL

name: Anciano Gran Reserva Tempranillo Aged 7 Years 750 mL
summary: Anciano Gran Reserva Tempranillo Aged 7 Years 750 mL

name: Angeline Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Angeline Pinot Noir 750ml

name: Angels & Cowboys Red Blend 750 mL
summary: California Red Angels & Cowboys 750ml

name: Angove Organic Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Certified organic, the Angove Cabernet Sauvignon is a delicious Australian red boasting fruity aromas of blackcurrant and cherry before a flavorful palate of red fruit and bell peppers. The perfect accompaniment to barbecued meats and grilled vegetables.
tasting_notes: Dark intense red with purple hues. Aromas of blackcurrant, cherry and chocolate. Bell peppers, blackcurrant, cigarbox and chocolate with soft oak flavours on the palate,  it has a long yet soft earthy finish.
food_pairings: Unsurprisingly for an Australian red this wine pairs well with barbecued meats such as a ribeye with grilled seasonal vegetables or vegan ravioli.

name: Angus The Bull Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Angus The Bull Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Antinori  Bolgheri Guado Al Tasso 2015 750 mL
summary: Antinori  Guado Al Tasso Bolgheri 750 mL
tasting_notes: Guado al Tasso is characterized by a rich and complex bouquet with notes of tobacco, toasted coffee, and leather which fuse with the aromas of ripe berry fruit. The palate is a vibrant one, with both tannins and freshness well present to give savor and persistence. The finish and aftertaste are spicy and fruity, complete and fragrant. It is a vintage which a very important aging potential.
food_pairings: This is a serious Bordeaux-styled red wine that needs a long decant, and should be served with grilled meats or sharp cheeses.

name: Antinori Peppoli Sangiovese 750 mL
summary: Antinori Peppoli Sanviovese 750 mL

name: Apothic  Crush Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Apothic Crush Red Blend 750ml

name: Apothic Dark Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Bottled as a limited edition, combining petite sirah, teroldego and cabernet sauvignon the Apothic dark red is a richer blend with less fruit and more tannins that combine to give you a lasting taste that remains with you for a while. It was clearly a successful experiment as the dark blend is one of our customer favourites.
tasting_notes: Dark fruit flavors of blueberry and blackberry with opulent notes of coffee and dark chocolate.

name: Apothic Inferno Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Aged in charred, white oak whiskey barrels for 60 days, Apothic Inferno blends the red and dark fruit flavors of its wine with hints of maple and spice, giving way to a long, clean finish. The result is a wine with rich flavor and distinctive attitude with a touch of whiskey.

name: Apothic Red Blend 3.0 L
summary: Apothic Red Blend 3.0 L

name: Apothic Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A customer favourite, this fruity red blend from Apothic creates layers of fruity flavours that are complimented by undertones of vanilla and mocha. Fantastic with a spicy firecracker bow-tie pasta with BBQ Chicken.
tasting_notes: The brambly spice of Zinfandel, dark fruit flavors of Syrah, the bold notes of Cabernet Sauvignon and the smooth elegance of Merlot unite to create this captivating red blend.    Apothic Red reveals intense fruit aromas and flavors of black cherry, vanilla and Mocha
food_pairings: A delicious wine for sipping. Also fantastic with everyday favourites - try a spicy firecracker bowtie pasta with BBQ chicken.

name: Aquinas  North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: This Aquinas Cabernet Sauvignon represents the quintessential elegance that is a well-balanced North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon. Exhibiting complex layers of flavour and a smoky finish this is a great wine to pair with a roast joint of meat.
tasting_notes: Exhibiting complex layers of cassis, black cherry, and tobacco leaf balanced with hints of graphite and bitter cocoa nibs that create the full body and smooth finish. The Petit Verdot added to the blend bolsters not only the colour and complexity of this wine, but also brings a light and fruity flavour to the table. The Malbec’s aroma of leather and tobacco as well as smoky finish help to balance out this Cabernet Sauvignon to a point of perfection.
food_pairings: Roasted lamb and rosemary fingerling potatoes, grilled cheese with gruyère cheese, thyme and shallots, and crème brûlée make the perfect mates to this luxurious wine.

name: Aquinas Napa Valley Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Named for a revolutionary philosopher of the13th century St.Thomas Aquinas, the estates aim is to produce quality wines that are accessible to all. This Pinot Noir with its intensely aromatic nose, blueberry and blackberry flavors and earthy tones certainly holds true to those ambitions. A great wine to enjoy on its own or with creamy mushroom risotto.
tasting_notes: Earthy tones are dominant with notes of black currant and toasted clove. A remarkably round wine with bright raspberry, blueberry and blackberry flavors reminiscent of a berry mélange. Napa Carneros fruit shines through with smoky flavors and a lingering, beautiful finish.
food_pairings: The earthiness of mushroom risotto will highlight the fruit characters of this wine, while the robust acidity and aromatic qualities are a perfect complement to white pizza with fresh herbs, we also recommend trying this with some oven baked BC salmon.

name: Araujo Estate Altagracia  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Araujo Estate Altagracia  Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: This wine reveals a spicy interplay of herbs and floral intrigue of lavender, violets and white flowers, with rich aromas of bittersweet chocolate and espresso bean, perfumed black fruits, graphite and cedar. In the mouth,at first focused and poised, it builds to a crescendo as it fans out in depth and breadth to the long mineral finish.

name: Arcanum Il Fauno di Arcanum Red Blend 750ml
summary: Arcanum Il Fauno di Arcanum Red Blend 750ml

summary: Argento Cabernet Franc Reserva 750 mL

name: Arrowleaf Cellars Pinot Noir  750 mL
summary: Arrowleaf  Pinot Noir  750 mL
tasting_notes: Rich cherry and raspberry aromas combine with subtle notes of vanilla, leather and earth. This Pinot Noir has a rich, silky texture and interesting complexity.
food_pairings: Recommended food pairings are chicken, duck, wild mushroom risotto or Gruyere cheese.

name: Arrowood Knight's Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Artezin Mendocino Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Hess Collection Artezin Zinfandel 750 mL

name: Art's de France Beaujolais 750 mL
summary: Arts de France Beaujolais offers intense aromas of red fruits with flavours of cherries, raspberries and blackcurrants on the palate. This wine, made from 100% Gamay has a soft texture with just a touch of acidity, making it fruity and fresh.
tasting_notes: Aromas of dark berries and flavours of raspberry and cherry. The soft tannins and fresh fruity flavours make this a fantastic red to enjoy by itself or with food.
food_pairings: Pair this wine with grilled pork chops, roasted chicken, quiche lorraine or a lyonnaise salad.

name: Atteca Old Vines  Garnacha 750 mL
summary: Atteca Old Vines  Garnacha 750 mL

name: Augey  Red Bordeaux 750ml
summary: Augey  Red Bordeaux 750ml

name: August Kessler Pfalz Pinot Noir N 750 mL
summary: August Kessler Pinot Noir N 750 mL

name: Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon has the telltale confected fruit of the Paso region on the nose, crushed cherry and dried cassis, but the story here is body and finish. Spicy chocolate and coffee notes with a finish of lavender, licorice and mint and power. Some tannin and acidity surround the commotion like rent-a-cops at a biker rally, but they aren’t in control. Saxum is making Paso wines this thick and loud, but they’re making them out of Rhone varieties and they cost a zillion dollars. This is an “it” wine, a true competitor to premium Napa, and it’s a steal, at least for right now.
tasting_notes: Deep ruby in color, the 2015 Austin Hope Cabernet Sauvignon expresses aromas of freshly picked black currants, ripe black cherries, and blackberries, with subtle notes of violets, mocha, and dried spices. On the palate, it’s a big, powerful, modern-styled wine layered with heaps of juicy blackberry and cherry fruit, while nuances of cedar, clove, nutmeg and vanilla bean round out the long smooth finish. It’s full-bodied and rich, balanced by fresh acidity and firm, polished tannins.

name: Avalon Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Avalon Winery Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Avignonesi Vino Nobile Di Montepulciano 2014 750 mL
summary: Avignonesi Vino Nobile Di Montepulciano 750 ml

name: B Cellars Ehrlich Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: B Cellars Elirich Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Bacalhoa JP Azeitao Castelao/Aragonez/Syrah 750 mL
summary: Bacalhoa JP Azeitao Castelao/Aragonez/Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: Fire up the BBQ for this brand new Portuguese blend! You'll love the big fruit aromas of juicy strawberries and spice.
food_pairings: Delicious and versatile with food! Best paired with light meat dishes and even salmon or cod. Toss this in the fridge ten minutes before serving for the best results.

name: Bacio Divino Cellars Vagabond 2008 Syrah/Cabernet 750 mL
summary: Bacio Divino Vagabond Syrah/Cabernet 750 mL
tasting_notes: Elements of black cherries, sweet oak, fresh herbs and earthy spices are combined in the aromas of this elegantly balanced Cabernet. The palate offers a focused, deep and refined character with notes of ripe cherries, leather and hints of cedar. It is fairly supple on entry with fine grained tannins showing on the latter palate. This wine will show best in four or five years, but does not need protracted aging.

name: Backyard Vineyards Gossip Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A meticulous blend of 56 % Merlot, 37% Cabernet Franc, 4% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Syrah results in this deep garnet wine. This rich robust wine blankets the mouth with seductive flavours of blackberries, raspberries, black liquorice, game meats, coffee and sweet oak spice. Complex, structured and fruit-driven, this vintage raises the bar.

name: Backyard Vineyards Nosey Neighbor Red Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Back Yard Nosey Neighbor Red 750 mL
tasting_notes: This wine is extremely approachable, rich and well rounded. The nose hints of vanilla, pomegranate, eucalyptus and chocolate. The palate is bright and fruit forward, displaying raspberries, strawberry jam and currants.
food_pairings: Pairs well with ribs, burgers and tomato based Italian dishes.

name: Baldes Clos Triguedina Cahors 2010 Malbec 750 mL
summary: Baldes Clos Triguedina Cahors Malbec 750 mL

name: Banfi Col di Sasso Red Blend 750 mL
summary: This wine has fresh aromas enriched with spicy notes along with flavours of raspberry and plum notes.
tasting_notes: This wine has fresh aromas enriched with spicy notes along with flavours of raspberry and plum notes. It's full and soft, balanced, and easy-to-drink.
food_pairings: It can excellently match important first courses, white meat and light main courses.

name: Banrock Station Shiraz 3L
summary: 3L format = 4 bottles of wine. Amazing value!
tasting_notes: A vibrant red wine with a rich berry fruit flavour. Soft vanillan oak and fine tannins create balance and length.
food_pairings: Great entertaining wine with BBQ fare, ribs and of course, grilled steak!

name: Barahonda Monastrell 750 mL
summary: Barahonda Monastrell 750 mL
tasting_notes: Made from 100% Monastrell grape variety, selected from our best vineyards. This wine shows mature fruity aromas, typical of the variety. It is a full and balanced wine with a fresh end. This young wine shows a brilliant cherry colour.
food_pairings: Best enjoyed between 14º/ 16 ºC. Pairing with cheese, all kind of meat, vegetables and rice.

name: Barbian  Vino Tinto 750ml
summary: Barbian  Vino Tinto 750ml
tasting_notes: Bright and dark cherry red wine with violet rims and fine tears. On the nose it is a very intense and fruity wine of red and black fruit with presence of toasted aromas. In the mouth it is a tasty and fruity wine with a smooth and long finish.
food_pairings: Pairs well with all kinds of meats, cheeses and legumes.

summary: Barefoot Merlot 750 ml

summary: Barefoot Pinot Noir 750 ml

name: Barilin  Barbera D' Alba 750ml
summary: Barilin  Barbera D' Alba 750ml
tasting_notes: Deep red, with purple reflections. Intense bouquet with ripe fruit notes, plums and cherries, hint of spices and vanilla. Full persistent taste, warm feeling and body, well balanced with soft tannins and acidity. Long finish with a marked blackberries jam.
food_pairings: Perfect with red meat dishes and medium to mature cheese

name: Baron de Ley Rioja Reserva 750 mL
summary: Baron de Ley Rioja Reserva 750 mL

name: Baron du Pin Bordeaux  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Baron du Pin is an elegant Bordeaux Red Blend. The predominance of Merlot is reflected by aromas of red fruit, blackcurrant, strawberry and ripe berries with subtle spicy notes. The ripe and fruit forward style make this a great choice for those of you looking to explore old world wines, but who may more regularly drink new world originating wines.
tasting_notes: With its ripe fruit forward style this wine offers aromas of ripe red berries and flavours of strawberry with notes of vanilla and spice.
food_pairings: Delicious enjoyed on its own or paired with some beef satay, blue cheese burgers, pork chops or a creamy mushroom risotto.

name: Barone Montalto Passivento Nero D'Avola 750 mL
summary: Barone Montalto Passivento Nero D'Avola 750 mL
tasting_notes: Red wine, dark and intense. Opulent nose of candied figs and ripe fruit, full bodied, balanced both in roundness and persistence.
food_pairings: It particularly suits fatty and tasty dishes. It goes well with foie gras patè , salami and delicatessen meats. It perfectly matches the typical oven baked baby pork.

name: Barone Ricasoli  Chianti 750ml
summary: Barone Ricasoli  Chianti 750ml

name: Beaulieu Vineyards Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary:
Aromatically vibrant with blackberry, black cherry, dark chocolate, smoke and wood spice. A fine core of fruit is set amid creamy and cinnamon-laced oak, firm but approachable tannin, good acidity and sufficient weight.
Great value in a plush and well structured Napa Cab that will match a range of grilled meat.

name: Beaulieu Vineyards Reserve Tapestry Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Beaulieu Vineyards Reserve Tapestry Red Blend 750ml

name: Bedrock Wine Co.  Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Bedrock Wine Co. Zinfandel 750ml

name: Beef Steak Club The Meaty Malbec 750 mL
summary: Beef Steak Club The Meaty Malbec 750 mL

name: Belle Glos  Dairyman Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Belle Glos  Dairyman Vineyards  Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Bright crimson red in color. Aromas of black cherry and ripe plums combine with subtle notes of dried herbs and smoke. The palate entry shows flavors of cranberry, fresh raspberry, and ripe cherry, complemented by hints of vanilla and baking spice. A balance of savory, cedar and cocoa powder, and sweet, fig jam and ripe blackberry, round out the mouth-feel. The overall impression is one of ripe red and black berry fruit flavors, great structure, smooth tannins and a lingering fresh finish.

name: Belle Grove  Shiraz 750 mL
summary:
Ripe Shiraz grapes from sun drenched traditional Spanish hillside vineyards, have been carefully fermented in their modern, temperature controlled tanks to produce a rich, fruity wine that is soft and drinkable at any occasion.
Pair well with richly flavoured red meats, beef stew and meat lover's pizza.

name: Ben Marco  Malbec 750 mL
summary: Ben Marco  Malbec 750 mL

name: Benanti Etna Rosso Nerello Mascalese 750 mL
summary: Benanti Etna Rosso Nerello Mascalese 750 mL

summary: Bench 1775 Groove Red Blend 750ml

name: Beni di Batasiolo Barolo Nebbiolo 750 mL
summary: Beni di Batasiolo Barolo Nebbiolo 750 mL

name: Beran Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Beran Zinfandel 750 mL
tasting_notes: Vibrant ruby red with a dark core and deep purple hues this classic Californian Zinfandel exudes aromas of sweet tobacco, blackcurrant, raspberry jam, cocoa powder and cigar box. On the palate you enjoy flavors of cherry, cranberry, raspberry tart and blackberry compote highlighted by notes of sweet cedar and baking spices. This is a well structured wine that is opulent and satisfying, a medium-weight wine that's balanced with bright acidity, integrated tannins and a lingering finish.
food_pairings: Grilled lamb or beef burgers, lasagna and other baked pasta dishes with red sauce, dried jack cheese, or aged gruyère.

name: Beringer  Founders' Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

tasting_notes: A smooth, full-flavoured wine with an abundance of sweet cherry, blueberry and spice aromas and flavours that embody the mystique of the Black Cellar.

name: Black Hills Winery Nota Bene Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Black Hills Winery Nota Bene, named for the Latin ‘take note' or 'well noted’ its certainly an adapt name for this fantastic red with luscious dark fruit, mocha, and baking spice flavours. Enjoy on its own or with braised lamb shoulder.
tasting_notes: Black Hills’ Nota Bene is an established B.C. icon, full of archetypal savoury/herbal character, with a graceful balance between fresh ripe fruit and signature bright Okanagan acidity. The wine is replete with luscious dark fruit, mocha, and baking spice exoticism, and smoothly polished tannins. Complex and savoury, Nota Bene has a long and satisfying finish that displays the dusty minerals of the Bench.
food_pairings: Pair with locally-pastured beef, braised lamb shoulder, or a fine B.C. aged cheddar.

name: Black Hills Winery Syrah 750 mL
summary: Black Hills Winery Syrah 750ml

name: Black Hills Winery Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: It may come as a surprise to many, but the cult winery Black Hills does, in fact, make wines that aren’t Nota Bene. Tempranillo isn’t widely planted outside of Spain and almost never planted in B.C., which is a shame because this is fab: a bright, ultra-present body of cherries and red apple, interwoven with a nose of roses, cinnamon and fine black pepper. A long hot finish and fine tannins – made for espelette-rubbed pork or chicken.

name: Black Sage Vineyard Cabernet Franc 750 mL
summary: Black Sage Vineyard Cabernet Franc 750ml
tasting_notes: Aromas of red cherry, green leafy notes, dried tea leaves and vanilla. Flavours of strawberry and red cherry burst on the palate, and are layered with earthy notes and vanilla undertones. The tannins are firm yet approachable, with a medium finish that lingers.
food_pairings: Pairs well with herb encrusted roasted pork with fingerling potatoes, BBQ steak, short ribs, pasta with tomato sauce, and charcuterie with gouda, gorgonzola or blue cheese.

name: Black Sage Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Black Sage Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Black Sage Vineyard Merlot 750 mL
summary:
Consistently this wine has shown well when looking at the 2011 reds that are out there now. Older vines and working with a tougher year have brought out the best here. Elegant and framed with fruit and impeccable balance, the wine is perfectly matched to site…and your glass. 
Try with grilled chops, roasted meats or steak frites

name: Black Stallion Limited Release Los Carneros Pinot Noir 2017 750 mL
summary: Located on the historic Silverado Trail in Napa Valley’s Oak Knoll District, Black Stallion Estate Winery pays homage to the rich history of the 32-acre estate which was once home to the Silverado Equestrian Center. The estate match the best sites with the best clones suited to those sites, and as such, their Pinot Noir is a combination of choice clones sourced from premier vineyards throughout Los Carneros.
tasting_notes: Lush red fruit aromas of strawberry and cherry with a hint of spice, the red fruit flavors are extended on the palate with strawberry, Bing cherry coupled with round black tea like tannins.
food_pairings: Los Carneros Pinot Noir is an ideal wine to savor on its own, as well as a perfect pairing for glazed duck breast, chicken Marsala or mild, creamy cheeses like brie and camembert.

name: Black Stallion Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2015 750 mL
summary: This highly acclaimed Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon is another great wine from the consistently high quality Black Stallion Winery. Their approach of carefully selecting grapes from some of the world’s most unique terroirs enables the winery to cultivate a rich palette of flavors and character in their wines. Full-bodied and balanced with vibrant aromas of blackberry, plum, vanilla and toasted oak this Cabernet Sauvignon pairs well flavourful dishes such as grilled tenderloin or strong blue cheeses.
tasting_notes: Black Stallions signature profile of a slightly softer, and approachable Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. This rich and refined wine doesn’t require years of further aging to achieve ideal balance and enjoy upon release. The full-bodied structure is a hallmark. The wine opens with stunning aromas of blackberry, black cherry and toasty scents; on the palate is concentrated with bold, velvety flavors of cassis, plum, blackberry and dried apple. Intense mouth filling fruit linger on the palate and end in a beautifully elegant finish.
food_pairings: This rich, fruit-forward wine calls for succulent, flavourful dishes such as grilled tenderloin with roasted shallots, and creamy bleu cheeses.

name: Blackstone Merlot 750 mL
summary: Blackstone Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: Medium ruby in colour; aromas of plum, cassis, vanilla and spice; dry and medium body with flavours of red and black plums, cherry, spice and oak smoke.

tasting_notes: An off-dry and medium ruby colour red blend with aromas reflecting the palate, comprising sweet black cherry, strawberry and candied fruit.

name: Bodega Alamos  Malbec 750 mL
summary: This Argentine Malbec is a customer favourite that is characterized by a dark purple, almost blackish colour, this wine has aromas of ripe black fruits, black pepper spice and floral notes.
tasting_notes: Characterized by a dark purple, almost blackish colour, this wine has aromas of ripe black fruits, black pepper spice and floral notes. On the pallet you will find that it is full yet soft and supple, with black raspberry and currant flavors interwoven with a touch of chocolate and sweet spice from light oak aging. The finish shows ripe, silky tannins.
food_pairings: Great with chicken, lamb, grilled vegetables and pastas.

name: Bodega Catena Zapata Catena High Mountain Vines Malbec 750 mL
summary: Bodega Catena Zapata Catena Malbec offers a rich and lush mouthfeel, with concentrated black cherry and red currant fruit flavors. The finish has exceptional length with crisp acidity and a flinty minerality.
tasting_notes: A dark violet color with deep bluish - black tones. The nose offers ripe, concentrated dark fruit aromas with delicate floral notes and traces of vanilla and mocha. The mouthfeel is rich and lush, with concentrated black cherry and red currant fruit flavors layered with sweet spices, tobacco and a touch of leather. The finish presents soft, supple tannins with bright, crisp acidity and a flinty minerality which gives the wine exceptional length.

name: Bodega Clarooscuro Malbec 750 mL
summary: Bodega Claro Oscuro Malbec 750ml

name: Bodega Colome Autentico  Malbec 750 mL
summary: Bodega Colome Autentico Malbec 2015. A tasty tipple from the top of the world. Many visitors get headaches when they visit Salta, whose highest vineyards sit at over 9000ft, due to the thin air and extreme conditions. The punishing, cold nights are tempered by latitude: Salta is closer to the Equator than any other wine region on earth. The region’s dynamism shines through Colomé’s wines, partly due to winemaker Thibaud Delamotte’s choice to age it in tank with no oak and let the grape speak freely. Violets, black cherries and figs dance above a uniquely intense body and frame, power and heft to match the nose, and finishes spicy and stony. Hoo boy. 93 points Robert Parker, #18, Wine Spectator Top 100 of 2017
tasting_notes: An intense inky colour with violet tones. Aromas of black fruit, cherries, white mulberry, figs and an elegant spiciness with a mineral touch. A robust and concentrated palate with crisp acidity. The tannins are ripe and fine-grained, giving structure and balance.

The nose is spicy with black and red fruits such as plum, cherry and strawberry, with a note of vanilla due to the oak. on the palate the wine is sweet with ripe tannins making for a nice smooth entry. Balanced acidity and long harmonious finish.

The juicy, jammy fruit is framed with spicy cedar and hints of pipe tobacco and cocoa as the American oak lingers through the aging of 12 long months. Luscious from start to finish, this wine is easy to drink, but impossible to forget.
food_pairings: This blend is a great wine pairing to barbecues - particuarly some juicy prime burgers, strong blue cheeses or a delicious selection of dark chocolate macarons.

Delicate hints of cedar and bay leaf balance the sweetness of the fruit, creating an enduring bouquet.  That luscious fruit bouquet continues onto the palate, where it’s joined by soft flavors of oak and savory notes. The rich mouthfeel is complemented by a long and beautifully smooth finish.

tasting_notes: Generous and ample. Notes of wild fruits and prunes are followed by toasted hints which marry harmoniously with fine tannins.
food_pairings: To be enjoyed with Serrrano ham, risotto with wild mushrooms, boar fricassee or dry goat cheeses.

name: Burning Cavalier  Merlot Cabernet 750 mL
summary: An earthy dark berry nose, this red features a full body of raspberry, cassis, oak and spice with a long, softly tannic finish. A bargain Bordeaux blend that's sure to leave you madly seeking more.
tasting_notes: Deep purple with a ruby rim and an earthy dark berry nose, this red features a full body of raspberry, cassis, oak, and spice, with a long, softly tannic ﬁnish. A bargain Bordeaux blend that’s sure to leave you madly seeking more!
food_pairings: A great wine to enjoy with grilled flat iron steak with blue cheese butter or some blackened beef. Prefer a non-meat option - charred peppers are an equally delicious pairing or a selection of aged cheeses.

name: Cafe Culture Pinotage 750 mL

food_pairings: Delicious and mouthwatering on its own but it pairs well with meat or pasta dishes. Also try alongside with chocolate or berry desserts to enhance the coffee and mocha flavours of the wine.

food_pairings: Cal y Canto is a great, easy sipper. Designed to be drank on its own, but it would still pair quite nicely with a meat, cheese and paté platter.

name: Canyon Road Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Canyon Road wines were inspired by the scenic roads that wander through California's stunning wine country. This Cabernet Sauvignon has a ripe raspberry flavour and a velvety smooth finish.
tasting_notes: Full of fresh dark fruit (blackberry, plum) layered with sweet aromatics of caramel. Hints of fresh green herbs, brown spice and lingering soft, plush tannin make for a well rounded Cabernet Sauvignon.
food_pairings: A great food wine that can be enjoyed with grilled red meats, mildly spicy dishes or a selection of hearty cheese.

name: Canyon Road Merlot 750 mL
summary: Canyon Road wines were inspired by the scenic roads that wander through California's stunning wine country. This Merlot is soft and elegant with deep flavours of rich cherries and jammy blackberries.
tasting_notes: Elegant and juicy on the palate with flavors of dark cherries, currants, blackberries, warm spice and vanilla with notes of cinnamon. This rich and smooth wine has soft tannins which makes the wine very accessible.
food_pairings: Enjoy this delicious Merlot on its own or pair it perfectly with roasted chicken, baked Salmon, grilled meats or tomato based pasta dishes.

name: Capeography Seascape Malbec 750 mL
summary:
Our seascape wines come from vineyards that can see and smell the sea, where the cooling coastal wind that blows off the cold Atlantic slow the ripening process, giving sun-loving grapes greater finesse and elegance.
Seascape Malbec is from the Coastal region, where the granite soils impart a textural minerality. The silky pulmminess and dark chocolate notes make this perfect with steak from the braai.

name: Capezzana Barco Reale di Carmignano Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Capezzana Barco Reale di Carmignano Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Good depth of ruby red colour, with intense, fruity perfumes of cherry and plum, given an extra dimension by a touch of oak. On the palate, it is rounded and ripe, with a lovely balanced fruit and tannin structure, and a long, elegant finish with a hint of spiced dark berry fruit.

summary: Carlo Rossi California Red 1.5L

name: Carnivor Zinfandel 750 mL

name: Casa Ferreirinha Papa Figos Tinto Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Named after the rare Douro golden oriole bird (which obviously likes to eat figs), this is a bright, fruity wine with light tannins that give it a delicious fresh, red fruit character. It has a smoky edge from wood aging, finely balanced and ready to drink now.
tasting_notes: This wine has a deep ruby color with violet nuances. It has a very intense aroma, dominated by floral notes of violet and rock rose, balsamic aromas of resin and cedar and well-ripened red and black fruit. On the palate, it has good volume, well-integrated acidity, high-quality tannins and black and red fruit notes. Its finish is elegant and harmonious.
food_pairings: A great wine to pair with all kinds of poultry and meat as well as a charcuterie platter.

The whole of the wine is balanced, rich, expressive and impressively complex. The backbone of fine tannin and sweet ripeness is a carry over from perfectly mature fruit.

summary: Caymus Vineyards Special Selection Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: A rich, dense ruby color, hints at the dark fruit nose of blackberry and currant that carries through to the palate, interwoven with complex aromas of black licorice, anise and crème de cassis. On the palate, the wine opens up to reveal an earthiness, with brown spice, cigar box and ripe dark fruits that linger throughout the extracted and long finish. The texture is opulent and rich, yet has a velvety quality with supple density. Rich, fine grained tannins are balanced with ripe fruit, acidity and oak.

summary: CC Jentsch Cellars Cabernet Merlot 750 mL

summary: CC Jentsch Cellars Syrah  750 mL
tasting_notes: Juicy, with aromas of blackberries, dark chocolate, toffee, smoked sandal wood and the sweet spiciness of clove, vanilla, pine wood, sage, black licorice and eucalyptus, This Syrah, having been barrel aged for 16 months overwhelms with its rich flavours on both the palate and nose, has great balance, velvety tannins and a long finish.
food_pairings: Great for pairing with grilled steak or scallops, cured meats and rich pasta meals.  Perfect with aged hard cheese.

name: CC Jentsch Cellars The Chase Red Blend 750 mL
summary: CC Jentsch Cellars The Chase Red Blend 2014 750 mL
tasting_notes: Deep ruby red in colour. Toasty vanilla oak intertwines with rich mocha, dark chocolate and ripe blackcurrants. It shows hints of Christmas cake and classic white pepper notes. Soft and supple, with a fine grained structure and excellent length. The toast and red/black fruits are very apparent on the mid palate.

name: Chateau Dauzac Aurore de Dauzac Margaux 750 mL
summary: "I picture wine from Margaux as a bouquet of lavender wrapped around a pencil, after that pencil has murdered a box of blueberries. Aurore is the Second Wine to the 5th Growth Chateau Dauzac, Cab dominant with just enough Merlot to fill all the holes. The Floral and fruit elements are here as well as tobacco and oaky vanillin – this is a ripe and quite drinkable Bordeaux but could still mellow out a smidge with time. Layered and exciting. Whereas many Second Wines are built from the passed-over barrels for the Gran Vin, Aurore is selected geologically, from grapes on mineral-rich deep gravel. Good structure and a generally good attitude, if you don’t drink Aurore you could hire it" - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Deep, dense red, on the nose the expression of red fruits is delicate and precise. The attack is smooth and velvety. The mid-palate unfolds gradually, highlighting the quality of the precise tannins.
food_pairings: Enjoy with roasted red meats and strong cheese.

name: Chateau de Beaucastel 2007 Chateauneuf-du-Pape Red Blend 750 mL

summary: Chateau du Moulin-A-Vent Moulin-A-Vent "La Rochelle" 750ml

name: Chateau Du Pin-Franc Bordeaux 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The subtle blend of three varietals, harvested at optimum ripeness, gives birth to an aromatic, rich and pleasant wine with good aging potential. This wine has an intense ruby color, enhanced by a beautiful shine. The nose is powerful, complex aromas combining ripe black fruit and roasted scents. The mouth is fleshy with a dense and tannic flavor which hints of red fruits and spices support this balance through the finish.
tasting_notes: Fine, juicy and refreshing with a subtle structure and easy charm, this is a typical Bordeaux style for all occasions.
food_pairings: Enjoy with red meats and hard cheeses.

name: Chateau Greysac Cru Bourgeois Medoc 2015 750 mL
summary: "For the French in Bordeaux, driving past a historical estate must be like driving past a barn in Chilliwack for us – you really don’t think much about who built it or when, and you only care if it grows something you want. Likewise, nobody cared about the 1700s-era Greysac estate until in 1974, Château Greysac was sold to Baron François de Gunzburg, who created a holding company with the Italian family Agnelli, owner of Ferrari and Fiat, modernized the facility and started to squeeze good juice. Situated near the top of the Médoc, Greysac is more influenced by the whims of the Atlantic so vintage variance is pronounced but this 2015 is way-fab. Nearly equal Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, a medium-to-full body with soft but pronounced tannins and baking spice" - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Deep ruby garnet with red berry flavors combined with notes of spice and bell pepper in the background. Pairs with all meats, poultry, wild mushrooms and strong cheeses.

name: Chateau Haut Brisson Saint Emilion Grand Cru 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: "An elegant, restrained Emillon with a medium body and good aging potential. Leathery raisins swirl around the nose with strawberries and sweet oak, creamy palate and lively finish. As such I was surprised to learn that winemaking consultant/arsonist Michel Rolland (Masseto, Oculus, Pedestal, land mines, booster rockets, etc.) was involved in this, the style is far more graceful than what he’s known for. Gorgeous and inviting, 90% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc" - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: A soft, immediately approachable classic Saint-Emilion. Notes of raspberries, strawberries, plums, balanced with gentle acidity and rounded off with sweet fine-grained oak. A perfect wine to drink with a special dinner.
food_pairings: For a typical pairing, try with duck confit or a game bird like squab with bacon and figs.

name: Chateau le Pey  Cru Bourgeois Medoc 2015 750 mL
summary: "Another Cru Bourgeois northern-Médoc 50/50 Cab/Merlot blend with great value from the Compagnet family – Father, Mother and both sons run nearly everything (not to be confused with the much larger, more commercial Ch. Pey La Tour). Ripe blue fruit dominates this 2015, with chocolate powder, plum, blackberry, firm tannins and a dusty finish. Everything is good to go but the finish, it’s still kind of angular and needs the soft rub of a couple years to smooth it out." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Appealing, deep garnet red in colour with a complex bouquet (ripe grapes, woods and spices). On the palate this is a full and well balanced wine.

name: Chateau L'Escart Red Blend 750 mL

name: Chateau Lilian Ladouys Saint-Estephe  Bordeaux 2015 750 mL
summary: "Consistently one of my favourite houses (within the realm of affordability) and a living example that you should always get your homework handed in on time. Just a few hundred metres from Lafite, the 19th century owners of this 16th century house failed, as legend has it, to get their certifications to the adjudicators in time to qualify for placement in the 1855 Bordeaux Classification. Now co-owned with Chateau Margaux by the Lorenzetti family, the 21st century has seen a renaissance in quality at Ladouys, and the Merlot-driven wines this Cru Bourgeois has offered in the last 2 decades have been at or above the quality level of Classified Growths (IMO), but without the accordant prices. As frame-forward as any St Estèphe, with deep mineral postholes and bright red fruits with white blossoms and toast. Tight now, Approachable in 5 years, singing in ten. Buy everything you can, this sleeper wakes up as a knight." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: This 2015 vintage shows a deep garnet color with magnificent purple tints. It reveals fresh aromas of peppermint along with sweet orange peels and cocoa notes. After aeration, fragrances of white flowers, blueberry, light vanilla and Mirabelle plum compote exhale. The ample and rich attack, develops raspberry and cedar aromas. A chalky tannin texture, given by our clay and limestone bedrocks where our merlots marvelously blossom is followed by a fresh and velvety finish.

name: Chateau Moulin De La Faye Bordeaux 2016 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau Moulin De La Faye Bordeaux 2016 Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: The nose is complex with red fruits notes (strawberry, blackberry). and we can find vanilla, toasted fresh bread and roasted coffee. On the palate, it is ample and voluptuous with tannins, mixed with red fruits notes. As there is no oak, the fruit flavours shine, yet careful handling in the winery means this has at least 5 years' cellar potential.
food_pairings: Perfect with red meat, grilled meat, game, duck breast and cheeses.

name: Chateau Pesquie Edition 1912M Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau Pesquie Edition 1912M, named for the elevation of Mount Ventoux, this cuvee is made from 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah. It demonstrates the freshness and vibrancy that Ventoux is capable of achieving.
tasting_notes: Wine with a purplish red color of good intensity. Nose powerful enough that opens with aromas of raspberry jam, violet and pepper. On the palate, it reveals an ample mouth that ends in a rather persistent finish.
food_pairings: Excellent with roast meats or in sauce, rack of lamb with bacon and thyme flowers, leg of kid with garlic juice. For dessert on a gratin of red fruits.

name: Chateau Pesquie Le Paradou  Grenache 750 mL
summary: Chateau Pesquie Le Paradou  Grenache 750 mL
tasting_notes: Limpid and dark ruby color. Nose of black and red berries with spicy notes. In the mouth, good concentration, roundness and freshness in the same time. Crunchiness of the grapes, cherry and blackcurrant aromas with hints of pepper. Very easy to drink!
food_pairings: Very easy to associate with many simple dishes: charcuterie, red snapper with Serrano ham, grilled white or red meats, pizzas... It can also be paired with more structured dishes (daube d’Avignon venison).

name: Chateau Pesquie Terrasses Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau Pesquie Terrasses Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Stunning dense bluish/purple color offers up notes of sweet blueberries, black cherry liqueur and licorice. The wine hits the palate with amazing texture, succulence, fabulous fruit intensity, vivid purity and a vigorous, long, fresh finish that goes on p

name: Chateau Pey La Tour Reserve du Chateau Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau Pey La Tour Reserve du Chateau Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Modern styled, but definitely rooted in Bordeaux, this rich and elegant red features cassis, ripe black cherry, cedar and vanilla stick flavours leading to a chewy and medium finish that suggests plenty of succulent sweet cassis. Primed for prime rib or b

name: Chateau Peyrabon  Cru Bourgeois Haut-Medoc 1.5 L
summary: "One of the few estates that straddles two Bordeaux appellations, Haut-Médoc and Pauillac. This Cru Bourgeois is from the Haut-Médoc side, a large plot of 40 hectares from where dark, plummy, spicy Cab-driven wines spring forth. One of the only houses to ever sue to get accepted into the 1855 Classification (the suit was filed in 1869, they were refused), Peyrabon smells like smarties (no kidding) and drinks like an excellent idea, soft and approachable even in youth, the fact that we’re selling this gulper in Magnums is deliciously frightening." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: With a bouquet of red berries. The tannins are relatively well concentrated which promises an important evolution and quality. The empyreumatic notes are present but do not stifle the generosity of the fruit. The soft attack brings a silky mouth.

name: Chateau Pigotte Terre-Feu  Medoc 2016 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau Pigotte Terre-Feu  Medoc 2016 Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: A bright ruby red in colour with notes of fresh redcurrants, plums and bramble fruits, a subtle mineral note combines with sweet spices and soft tannins on the finish.
food_pairings: Serve with roasted meats such as game birds or lamb.

name: Chateau Pitray Cotes de Castillon Red Blend 2015 750 mL
summary: "A robust, grippy affair, boasting a saline, almost sandy nose over lower notes of chocolate syrup and blackberry jam. Boasting a family history going back to the 1500s and an absolutely marvelous Chateau, the Pitray estate has been a getaway for the wealthy for centuries, wine until very recently was a secondary pursuit. 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc, the tannic finish is still a little out of step with everything else but this’ll all come together gloriously in 3-4 years." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Dark purplish crimson. Not much nose. But a very solid palate. Thick, marked tannins and no shortage of acidity but a slight shortage of fruit in the middle. Very edgy.

name: Chateau Saint-Antoine Bordeaux Superieur 750 mL
summary: Chateau Saint-Antoine Bordeaux Superieur 750 mL
tasting_notes: Under the ruby colour, the nose is medium and simple. Enjoy this dry, medium-bodied and woody red featuring refreshing acidity. On the palate, it showcases fleshy tannins and a broad mouthfeel that leads into a medium finish.

name: Chateau Segonzac Vieilles Vignes AOC Blaye - Cotes de Bordeaux 750 mL

name: Chateau St Jean  Cinq Cepages  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Chateau St Jean  Cinq Cepages Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: The aromas lead to a plush palate with depth of flavors including raspberry compote and dark chocolate. The full-bodied wine is rich and refined with well-integrated, ripe tannins giving good structure. In signature Cinq Cépages form, this wine combines the strength of the diverse Sonoma County region to create an approachable, well-balanced and elegant wine.

name: Chateau Tour Saint Christophe Saint Emilion Grand Cru 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: "Ok, here’s the bunker-buster Michel Rolland wine I was expecting (he consults on this also, he is busy), 80% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Franc and somehow 5% Napalm. This is the biggest boy in today’s sandbox, rich, textured and gloriously boozy; the nose is like a blueberry bagel and a slice of Christmas cake started playing leapfrog (that is a weird descriptor but try it and tell me I’m wrong). Although robust, the wine is mostly in balance with itself, the tannins are a tad pokey but with food you won’t mind. Will be spectacular in 5 years." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes:
Château Tour Saint Christophe 2015 has a deep red color nearly approaching the black. The first notes show minerality, sitting on very ripe red fruit. Then, spicy wood notes somewhat reminiscent of a cigar box / which are not unlike the nose of a box cigar. After airing the spicy part grows to almost camphorated notes. The fruit focuses on a black fruit jam.
On the palate, the attack is fruity with an evolution on roundness and the chalky side, typical of Tour Saint Christophe's terroir. Endowed with a nice balance and an impressive aromatic delicacy, the freshness and tension are there. The mid-palate has the same notes of the cigar box. The saline finish characteristic for Tour Saint Christophe, explodes with fruit.

name: Cherry Pie Vineyard Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir  750 mL
summary: Cherry Pie Vineyard Stanley Ranch Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Dense ruby in color, Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir first shows aromas of crushed berry, fresh lavender and rose with cola undertones. The palate is full-bodied in texture, showing bountiful notes of raspberry jam, baked strawberries and a hint of cherry cola atop cocoa flavors and powdered tannins. Laden with the same bold fruits as on the nose, the mid-palate shows layer upon layer of cranberry, dried rose petal and vanilla, carrying through the long finish.

name: Chopo Ecological Monastrell 750 mL
summary: From Owner and Export Director for Ego Bogedas and Finca Bacara, Ioana Paunescu. The quality of the Grapes used in the Chopo Ecological Monastrell give cleanliness and aromatic intensity highlighting notes of mature blueberries and plums. Generous amounts of fruity and spicy notes on the palate with a perfect balance of acidity.
tasting_notes: Fresh with clean, and fragrant spice aromas. the mouth is savory red fruit leading to soft and round tannins on the finish. Well-balanced acidity throughout.
food_pairings: Pairs wonderfully with fish and cheeses or pork shoulder and sausages.

name: Chopo Monastrell-Syrah 750 mL
summary: Blackberry galore! Followed by ample black pepper spice, compliments of the both the Syrah and Monastrel that make this delightful Spanish blend. A wine that is flavourful enough to be enjoyed on its own or paired with roasted lamb.
tasting_notes: Blackberry galore! Followed by ample black pepper spice, compliments of the both the Syrah and Monastrell.With more time, delicate purple florals show through. The acidity is slow to appear and lingers near the back of the tongue. The tannins are slick, with a bit of chewiness. Predominately black fruits, juicy blackberry and cherries, with more of the earthy, garrigue, forest notes that sit near the finish with a bit of tobacco leaf.
food_pairings: There is a touch of heat (light burn from the alcohol) that shows near the finish. With higher alcohol, avoid spicy dishes. Roasted lamb with Moroccan flavours and spices.

The palate layers mocha, carob, licorice and black fruit with saline and spice flavours. It is a succulent wine with a generous palate.

summary: A great value Tempranillo! Fresh and fruity with bright red fruit flavours and hints of vanilla and clove. Pair it with rich pasta dishes like lasagna or grilled red meats.
tasting_notes: A fresh and fruity tempranillo with aromas of ripe red fruit, flavours of raspberry and dark cherry with subtle notes of vanilla and clove.
food_pairings: A delightful accompaniment to tapas, lasagna, grilled red meats or a selection of hard cheeses.

name: Clos des Fous Caquenina  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Clos des Fous Caquenina Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Beautiful dark ruby-red color with violet highlights. Outstanding fruit, with a nose full of red berries, red currant, black cherry, blueberry. Spices like black pepper, tea leaves. Notes of graphite and hints of violets framed its great complexity. Those elements come through on the palate, with fresh black and red fruit, revealing a full-bodied wine. This wine opens generously, very silky and lush on the palate. In mid palate is round and velvety with very fine tannins and the excellent acidity enhance its liveliness and balance. Decanting is recommended.

name: Clos Dominic  Vinyes Altes Priorat 2009 750ml
summary: Clos Dominic "Vinyes Altes" Priorat Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: A powerful wine that fills the mouth. Its silky, round palate is full of notes of fruit and spices (its mellow notes of chocolate stand out) displayed on a nice mineral and toasted background. Balanced acidity, rounded by a balsamic touch that freshens the wine. Long and very persistent finish. A really pleasant wine. Enjoy it!

name: Clos du Soleil Celestiale Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Clos du Soleil Celestiale Cabernet Franc/Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: Célestiale is Clos du Soleil’s Bordeaux-style blend that is soft and full of fruit with an elegant and classic structure. On the palate the wine is remarkably rich and layered, with flavours of black cherries, ripe raspberries, plums and savoury grilled notes.
food_pairings: Elegant and perfectly balanced, with fresh acidity and fine lively tannins this is a perfect food wine.

summary: Collemattoni Vigna Fontelontano Riserva Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL
tasting_notes: An intense ruby red with brilliant burgundy reflections, the aroma is reminiscent of wild black fruits, vanilla and spices. The palate is dry, warm, austere but velvety.
food_pairings: The elegance of this wine, thanks also to its body and structure, makes it a wine for meditation. It matches all our best dishes of the Tuscan tradition: great with complex first courses (lasagne, pinci pasta with sauces made with game), second courses made with game, braised meat and ripe and spicy cheeses.

summary: Named after the Condor, an icon of the Andean Mountains where these grapes are grown this Malbec has an exquisite mouth complexity with sweet tannins and a nice silky finish. A superb food wine enjoy this great Argentine wine with a steak or tomato based pastas.
tasting_notes: The nose shows red fruit and vanilla aromas. It has an exquisite mouth complexity of red and black fruits, plums, chocolate, with sweet tannins and a nice silky finish.
food_pairings: As with most Malbecs, serve with red meats and cheeses as well as with spicy tomato based pasta dishes.

Dried fruit and the taste of chocolate-covered cherries come through on the palate, while a wisp of smokiness makes this wine – created from dark red varietals including Zinfandel and Petite Syrah. Tannins are rounded out by the ripeness of the berries for a texturous but smooth mouth feel.
food_pairings: The perfect complement to grilled meats and full-flavored dishes such as Mexican tacos, spaghetti bolognese or a mild curry.

food_pairings: Pairs well with chili, spicy sausage and hearty winter stews.

summary: Copper Moon Moonlight Harvest Shiraz 750ml
tasting_notes: On colour, this wine is a deep ruby red, and on the nose, you’ll certainly pick up blackberries, plum, and spice.  On the palate, the spice you pick up on the nose continues, but is also coupled with tastes of cherry, vanilla, and well balanced tannins, for a warm, mouth feel.
food_pairings: pastaPizzaBurgers                                                This is a wine which pairs well with pizza, pasta or burgers.

name: Costanti  Brunello di Montalcino Riserva 2012 750 mL
summary: Costanti Brunello di Montalcino 750ml

name: Costanti Brunello di Montalcino 2012 750 mL
summary: A short history lesson to introduce you to the Costanti Brunello di Montalcino 2012, courtesy of our vintage room expert Jordan Carrier: "Ever since the 2012 Brunellos jumped into the pool and displaced everybody’s tub toys, I’ve been eagerly waiting for this beast to emerge from its cave. The Costanti family dates back to the 15th century, and their contributions towards establishing the 1555 Republic of Siena gave them huge endowments of land around Montalcino, where the vineyards still lie today (amongst Etruscan archeological remains). Having traded politics for farming in the 1700s, the Costantis, along with Biondi Santi, shaped the emerging “Brunello” wines from oxidative house plonk towards cellar-worthy fine wines. As Costanti is widely considered to be second only to Biondi Santi in championing traditional Brunello, this 2012 needs a couple of years to learn who not to bite, but the ingredients for dynamite are all here. Cherries, cinnamon hearts and black Twizzlers beaten by stones and giant oranges". Also awarded 98 points from The Wine Enthusiast and ranked #1 of their top 100 wine list 2017.
tasting_notes: Bright ruby red in color, this wine has typical perfumes of Morello cherry, cinnamon and spice. On the palate, it has wonderful elegance and balance together with excellent concentration and silky tannins softened by cask and bottle ageing. Spiced red berry fruit characters are supported by an attractive savory character, with a hint of liquorice on the long finish.

name: Cote de Boeuf Red Blend 750 mL
summary: This French blend has a very intense bouquet and flavours of confit black fruits, blackcurrant, violet, vanilla, pastry cream and slightly toasted notes. Fruity and full-bodied with a sweet finish!
tasting_notes: Aromas of dark fruit and violets on the palate are flavours of blackcurrant and plum complimented with notes of vanilla and pastry cream.
food_pairings: Fruity and full bodied this wine can be enjoyed on its own or served with Mediterranean vegetables, a generous hunk of beef or dark chocolate.

name: Craggy Range  Te Kahu Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Craggy Range  Te Kahu Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Vibrant deep garnet colour. Enticing aromas of dark plums and cassis meld with those of nutmeg, tobacco and sandalwood in a classically composed nose. The palate is rich and yet quietly composed, with layers of flavour and tannin linked by fine acidity and the refined dusty tannins of the gravels. Finishes dry and long.
food_pairings: Pairs well with rich red meat dishes.

name: Crane Lake Malbec 750 mL
summary: Crane Lake Malbec is a great option if you are looking for something a little different from Argentine Malbecs. With its ripe fruity style this a delightful wine either on its own or to be enjoyed with roast beef.
tasting_notes: This dark full-bodied wine has aromas of plum and blackberry. There are flavors of raspberry and cherry with soft tannins providing a pleasant lingering finish.
food_pairings: A willing partner to a variety of foods – favorites include leg of lamb, sausage, duck, pasta in a red sauce, and grilled steak.

name: Credaro 5 Tales Shiraz 750 mL
summary: From the premium Margaret River wine region Credaro wines are making an impact. Credaro 5 Tales Shiraz 2015 is a red wine with intense berry flavour; soft and juicy tannins and finishing with the delicate floral and spice perfumes that cool climate Shiraz is known for. Oustanding value!
tasting_notes: The Credaro 5 Tales Shiraz is vibrant crimson red in colour with lifted mulberry fruit aromas on the nose with hints of mocha and sweet vanilla. The palate is soft and juicy with flavours of dark plum and cherry, finishing with fine tannins and subtle creamy oak.
food_pairings: An excellent food wine that pairs well with roasted lamb, pork tenderloins and soft cheeses.

name: Crios  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Crios  Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Jam-packed palate full of dark, juicy fruits, showing chocolate, black cherry & blueberry notes. It finishes with smooth, lush tannins & good length. If you're looking for a delicious Argentine red other than a Malbec, definitely give this one a try!

name: Crowded House Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Culmina Family Estate Winery Golden Mile Bench Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Culmina Family Estate Winery Golden Mile Bench Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Generous aromas of ripe blackberry and dried cherries are complemented by nutmeg and Bourbon vanilla bean. Dense and well structured, the palate has complex flavours of cassis, fresh tobacco leaf, and dark fruitcake. The finish is long and pronounced, with both elegance and power.
food_pairings: Smoked onion and gruyere Napoleon; classic steak tartare with quail egg, capers and dijon; grilled bone in porterhouse with crispy bone marrow; veal shank parmentier with roasted vegetables; blackberry glazed duck breast with Yukon gold potato pave; and hard aged cheeses such as Manchego or Comté.

name: Culmina Family Estate Winery Golden Mile Bench Hypothesis Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Culmina Family Estate Winery Golden Mile Bench Hypothesis Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Opulent cassis and freshly picked blackberry aromas are complemented by violets, cedar, and a pronounced minerality. The densely textured, savoury palate has lively acidity, succulent dark fruits, and polished, refined tannins. Combining generosity with elegance, the finish is long and persistent.
food_pairings: Brown butter and sage tossed gnocchi with wood roasted mushrooms; roasted pheasant with chestnut fennel fricassee; venison tourtière; charcoal grilled bone in ribeye with crispy bone marrow and firm cheeses such as Boerenkaas or Gorts Extra Aged Gouda.

name: Curious Incident Merlot 750 mL
summary: The Curious Incident Merlot is a great priced BC VQA! With its ripe notes of blueberry, juicy cherry and red currant mingle on the palate and lead to a smooth and velvety finish. Enjoy with grilled steak or lamb or even without food, as you ponder life's mysteries.
tasting_notes: With its' aromas of berries and spice this BC VQA Merlot boasts flavours of blueberry, cherry and red currant with notes of vanilla and chocolate. A juicy and smooth red with a smooth and velvety finish. A great Merlot at a great price.
food_pairings: Enjoy this wine with a range of meat dishes such as burgers, roast chicken or a moist Shepherds pie with plenty of gravy. If you prefer trying something other than meat though we highly recommend roasted tomatoes.

name: Diabolica Wines Red 750 mL
summary: This wine is big, yet approachable with flavour that explodes in your mouth from the very first sip but still has that definite structure and complexity. A customer favourite its not hard to see why once you have tried this fantastic blend from the Okanagan Valley. Flavours of red cherry and pomegranate welcome you upon your first taste promptly followed by black tea, boysenberry, and ripe plums all of which culminate in a smooth finish.
tasting_notes: This blend explodes with juice in your mouth but still has that definite structure and complexity familiar to those of you who enjoy wines from the Okanagan Valley. Red cherry, pomegranate and violet are on the nose and continue with your first lush sip. Flavours of red cherry and pomegranate initially burst upon your taste buds, promptly followed by black tea, boysenberry, and ripe plums all of which culminate in a smooth finish. This wine is big, yet approachable.
food_pairings: The strong and distinctive juicy flavours of this wine lend it to partner with a wide range of dishes, for a few ideas why not try the Diabolica Red with a stone baked pizza smothered in tomato sauce, a grilled steak with sautéed mushrooms or certain spicy foods, like an arrabiata sauce with pasta or meat rubs with a kick. If you would rather relax on the patio with a glass and some simple appetizers why not enjoy some assorted olives, kale chips, marinated artichokes or peppers?

name: Diabolica Wines Reincarnation Red Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Diabolica Reincarnation Red VQA 750 mL
tasting_notes: This blend explodes with juice in your mouth but still has that definite structure and complexity that comes from distinctive wines from the Okanagan Valley. It will not disappoint. Red cherry, pomegranate and violet are on the nose and continue with your first lush sip. A blend of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Shiraz and Cabernet, Diabolica Red Wine bursts with red cherry and pomegranate when you take your first lush sip, followed by flavours of black tea, boysenberry, and ripe plums that culminate in a smooth finish. This wine is big, yet approachable.
food_pairings: Stone baked pizza smothered in tomato sauce, a grilled steak with sautéed mushrooms, and certain spicy foods, like an arrabiata sauce with pasta or meat rubs with a kick. To keep it simple, our winemaker suggests adding freshly ground pepper on whatever you’re serving. And if you’re looking for something easy, appetizers like assorted olives, baked kale chips, or marinated artichokes and peppers work great.

tasting_notes: This Premier Cru is not the most characteristic of the Nuits Saint Georges appellation. As its name indicates, it presents great roundness and smoothness, reminiscent of wines closer to Vosne Romanée. It is characterized by a marked blackcurrant nose, which is fruity exuberant. Its suppleness does not prevent it from having great depth, it is in fact a powerful wine, with excellent aging potential.
food_pairings: It will pair nicely with roasted red meats, small game or good poultry such as a Bresse or free-range chicken. It will support the majority of cheeses, as long as they are not too pungent.

tasting_notes: This wine features delightful dark cherry and plum aromas integrated with some smoky vanilla and cinnamon from the oak influence. Smooth and full bodied with a hint of peppery spice.

The same cherry flavors first discovered in the nose are found on the palate, and linger through the long, pleasing finish.

name: Food Truck Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Food Truck Shiraz, this powerful but well balanced wine is very approachable with an expansive nose of blackberries, blood plums and chocolatey oak. A wine designed with food in mind enjoy this with a wood fired steak.
tasting_notes: Vivid red / purple in colour with an expansive nose of blackberries, blood plums and chocolatey oak. The palate is opulent and inviting with dark plum and blackcurrant fruit flavours matched by dried herbs, cloves and subtle spicy oak. Fine-grained savoury tannins provide definition to the impressively long finish. This powerful but well balanced wine is very approachable now but will gain character and complexity for up to ten years cellaring.

The Footprint Shiraz is bold and complex a a good pairing to roast beef or with strong blue veined cheeses. Delicious with a cheeseburger!
tasting_notes: Deep red with violet tints. Aroma of spicy berry fruit and black pepper. Well-structured palate with in-mouth flavours of ripe plums, black cherries and a touch of smokiness. Medium to full bodied with juicy tannins and elegant finish
food_pairings: Enjoy with roast beef, duck, venison dishes and blue veined cheese.

Well-managed tannins produce a long, silky finish with luscious black fruits to the end

summary: Fort Berens Meritage 750ml
tasting_notes: This deep red wine has the juicy aromas of jammy cherries and blueberries combined with fresh chocolate shavings, coffee and smokey bacon. On the palate, this full-bodied, smooth wine has layers of flavours of berries, oak and pepper tones.
food_pairings: Pair with BBQ beef or a hearty stew made with chicken, lamb or beef.

name: Fort Berens Estate Winery Red Gold Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Fort Berens Red Gold Reserve 750ml
tasting_notes: On the nose Red Gold offers aromas of intense blackberries and cherries combined with earthy leaves and a dry mossy forest. This beautifully balanced full-bodied wine explores all regions of the palate with lush fruit flavours, spicy oak and a lengthy, smooth finish.
food_pairings: Pair this wine with a sirloin steak with fois gras, rare beef tenderloin or a platter of aged cheeses and chutneys.

name: Fourmi Rouge Ventoux  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The archetypal pleasure wine, the Fourmi Rouge Ventoux red blend is authentic, genuine and tasty. On the nose are aromas of ripe fruit that is rich and spicy. On the palate are flavours of blackcurrant, blackberry and spice with a fresh finish. Try this red lightly chilled with grilled with chicken skewers!
tasting_notes: Beautiful intense red color, with purple highlights. The nose is greedy, with fresh notes of red and black fruits (strawberry, blackberry, currant berry) and sweet spices. On the palate, this wine is balanced, with soft and elegant tannins and a fruity and delicious finish.

Diamond Collection Cabernet Sauvignon is a blend of fruit from appellations as far north as El Dorado and as far south as Paso Robles. This soil diversity helps us produce a more complex wine. With supple tannins and good weight, this wine offers a velvety mouthfeel and flavors that are long lived on the finish.

name: Freemark Abbey  Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Let us raise a glass to Classic Napa, in both style and budget. Part of the Napa equivalent to the Original Six, Freemark was on Team USA at the Judgement in Paris 1976, but unlike its teammates (Stag’s Leap, Ridge) it hasn’t jacked up its price or ripeness much in the subsequent years. Harkening back to a time when Napa considered the Médoc as its guiding star, Freemark Abbey (founded in 1939) is full bodied but low-glycerine, favouring subtle structure and balanced fruit over whiz-bang-dynamite-anvils. Because of its non-flamboyancy, Freemark often occupies the “Friend Zone”, while wine drinkers fall for flashy fruit bombs with shiny sports cars, Freemark is just dependably there. Seriously, be honest: when’s the last time you tried Freemark Abbey? If there was ever a time to fall back in love with this wine, it’s with this offering – bucking the trend of the valley this is stronger here than the three previous ones, the texture is glorious and the dark fruits dance with spicy sticks of cedar and licorice.
tasting_notes: Opaque, dark ruby color introduces this wine that expresses dark fruit aroma and flavors. With spicy sweet oak complexity, the wine exudes dark fruit such as blackberry, black currant, blueberry and dark cherry. There are nuances of dark chocolate, chocolate berry truffle dusted with cocoa powder, cola, aromatic cedar, cinnamon, clove, graham crackers and a hint of tobacco. The body is very full with a soft entry, coupled with dark cherry/berry flavors that develop from start to finish. With great texture and mouth feel, this Cabernet is full-bodied, rich and opulent.

name: Graceland Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Graceland Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: This is an elegant Cabernet Sauvignon deep blackberry and plum fruit on the nose is complemented by vanillin oak sweetness. The palate has firm tannins with flavours of blackberry and tobacco. Matured for 18 months in 40% new French oak barrels, the balan
food_pairings: Enjoy with rib roast, venison stew or lamb chops with balsamic reduction.

name: Graffigna Centenario Reserve Malbec  750 mL
summary:
90 Points - Wine Advocate: "Opaque purple; spice box, incense, lavender, and black fruit aromas; underlying structure."

Complex aromas of berries are highlighted with delicate black pepper and toasted notes. Well-integrated tannins and a round velvety body give this award winning Argentine Malbec a long, persistent finish.
tasting_notes: Profound and fruit forward aromas, with ripe red berries, sweet spices and a hint of black pepper backed by toasted notes from its oak aging. Structured and balanced, with ripe tannins and fresh acidity that leads to toasted and vanilla hints on the finish.
food_pairings: Very versatile. It pairs well with lamb and grilled beef, spicy food and poultry.

name: Gran Appasso  Puglia Rosso Passito Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Gran Appasso  Puglia Rosso  Red Blend 750 mL

name: Gran Emotivo  Rosso Veneto 750 mL
summary: A rich, opulent, smooth red wine produced from “long hang” late harvested grapes from the private vineyards of Veneto. Late maturation gives the characteristic notes of ripe fruits with a tluch of of spice and short oak ageing.
tasting_notes: Flavours of ripe fruits, such as plums and raisins with pleasant notes of spices and vanilla. Rich and bold palate with very ripe, red fruit flavours. A solid structure and beautiful balance between soft tannins and lifted acidity.
food_pairings: This is a great wine for roasts, red meats and hard cheeses.

name: Grand Cape Shiraz 750 mL
summary: A fantastic red to pair with homemade burgers this weekend! A fresh, vibrant Shiraz that is bursting with cranberry fruit flavours and has a long, exquisite finish. This wine was made with the barbecue in mind and is a great partner to homemade burgers and sticky spare ribs.
tasting_notes: A ripe and juicy South African Shiraz packed with fresh, vibrant, black fruit flavours and positively thrumming with sappy wiry fruit with a bright mineral palate, cranberry fruit and a long, essential finish. Fairly full bodied and well rounded. Great value!
food_pairings: This wine was made with the barbecue in mind, a great partner to homemade burgers or sticky spare ribs.

name: Grand Vin de Reignac Bordeaux Superieur 2011 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A complex wine, the Grand Vin de Reignac Bordeaux Superieur 2011 scored 90 points from Robert Parkers Wine Advocate. Rich and full bodied this wine offers flavours of berries, leather and espresso and is the perfect accompaniment to thick beef stews or mushroom skewers.
tasting_notes: This incredible French Bordeaux bland, with its aromas of leather, spice and pencil shavings is rich and full bodied offering flavours of black currant and blackberry supported by notes of espresso and spice.
food_pairings: A very complex wine this can happily be enjoyed and savored by itself but will complement a number of dishes such as rich, tomato based pasta sauces, mushroom skewers, a thick beef stew or a cassoulet.

name: Grao Vasco Dao Red 750ml

An ,opulent  interpretation of Marlborough pinot layered with evocative fragrances of cloves, star anise, tea smoke and a hint of gaminess. The palate is generous with ripe fruit, fine tannins and a delicious spicy finish.
