tasting_notes: The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannin: tart red berried fruit, laced with tobacco and dried herbs on the dry, crisp finish. This is a superb classical Rioja Crianza.

summary: Hartford  Russian River Valley Pinot Noir 750ml
tasting_notes: Aromas of blackberries, blueberry, and nutmeg are followed by flavors of Bing cherries, wild raspberries, dark plum and allspice. The dense entry is followed by a sweet and juicy mouth feel, supported by acidity, silky tannins and a subtle earthy finish.

name: Hardy's The Riddle Shiraz Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: This blend uses fruit sourced mainly from Riverland and Murray-Darling. Fermented in stainless steel, the palate is a delicious coming together of the pepper, spice and raspberry flavours of the Shiraz with the blackcurrant and firm rich tannins of the Cabernet, finished off with a light touch of toasty-vanilla oak. Try it with BBQ’d pork loin!
tasting_notes: Deep crimson in colour with purple hues. This intense bouquet displays characters of blackberry and mulberry fruit over coffee and tobacco oak aromas with hints of aniseed, clove and cinnamon. Full bodied with intense plum and blackberry fruit accompanied by cloves, black pepper and aniseed spice. This wine has good fruit weight supported by a fine tannin structure. A wine displaying rich fruit characters with savoury tannins and a lingering blackberry finish.
food_pairings: A delicious wine to accompany a rack of Lamb or glazed Pork ribs. Equally at home with tomato based pasta dishes or a vegetarian chili.

summary: Haywire Winery CanyonView Vineyard Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Classic aromas of wild berries, barnyard, and herbs dominate this savoury yet fresh Pinot Noir. Concrete aging has added a lush texture of sweet red fruits balanced beautifully with juicy mouth-watering acidity. Pure Okanagan.

name: Haywire - Okanagan Crush Pad Winery White Label Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Haywire Winery Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: An entrancing burgundy colour and intense cherry aromas lead to a palate loaded with lively ripe red-berry fruits, exotic spice blends, and earthy characters.

name: Heist Shiraz 750 mL
summary: The Heist Shiraz is rich and spicy with aromas of dark berries and flavours licorice and vanilla on the palate. A great example of the Australian Shiraz style this is a wine which pairs well with food including meat dishes and burgers.
tasting_notes: Aromas of dark ripe berries with flavours of blackberry, licorice and vanilla on the palate. The finish has notes of black pepper and toasted oak.
food_pairings: Pair this rich and spicy Shiraz with an Aussie meat pie, gourmet burgers, sausage rolls or eggplant parmesan

name: Heitz Cellars  Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon  750 mL

name: Heritage Road Bloodstone Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Heritage Road Bloodstone Shiraz 750 mL
tasting_notes: Aromas of black pepper, blueberry and plum fill the glass.  Flavours of ripe fruit, mulberry and blackberry finished with spicy pepper and creamy vanilla oak characters.  This balanced shiraz shows rich fruit characters, a medium body and good persistence

name: Herman Story  Casual Encounters 2010 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Herman Story  Casual Encounters 2010 750 mL

name: Hesketh Art Series Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Benefiting from South Australia's incredible diversity in climate and geography Hesketh Art Series Shiraz showcases brilliant aromatic fruit notes balanced perfectly alongside soft vanilla hues. Fantastic with roast Lamb.
tasting_notes: Deep rich dark purple with bright red hues. On the nose dark fruits, spice, floral, sage, honey and shortbread. Strawberries, violets with some brooding, savoury, spice adding complexity. On the palate enjoy bright red fruits of strawberry and raspberry. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel. Fine acid gives finesse to the palate with some hints of tobacco and spice adding savoury flavours,
food_pairings: Delicious with roast lamb and other red meats.

name: Hesketh Porcupotamus Pinot Noir/Shiraz 750 mL
summary: The Porcupotamus was an awe-inspiring creature that was highly intelligent, aggressively territorial and a strict vegetarian. Blending makes more interesting creatures and it makes better wine!
tasting_notes: Dark red core with maroon hues and silver rims. The nose comprises spice, rhubarb, tobacco, red berry fruits and thyme. the palate is light and bouncy with fresh, soft red fruit flavours. A Pinot like mouthfeel with cherry and raspberry, nice acid lines and fine tannins on the finish.
food_pairings: Enjoy this quirky Australian wine with pan fried tofu, roasted root vegetables, braised red meats or game.

name: Hesketh Vulturedog Shiraz/Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: The rare and mystical Vulturedog shared high intelligence with its distant canine cousins, but proved a little harder to domesticate due to its ability to fly. Blending not only makes more interesting creatures, it also makes better wine.
tasting_notes: Deep purple, vibrant with red hues and a purple rim. Aromas are off plush fruits, cream, strawberries, raspberries, with some hints of spice and star anise. The oak is integrated nicely. The palate offers pepper, spice, fresh juicy red and purple fruits, tight structure and good length. Good weight on the mid palate.
food_pairings: The firm tannins make this a great wine to enjoy with Tapas, Paella, vegetable lasagna or tacos.

name: Hess Collection Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Hess Collection Allomi Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon offers distinct notes of vanilla and oak spice with classic red fruit flavors set off by currant and blackberry along with moderate, well-integrated tannins showing a round, plush mouthfeel.
food_pairings: Earthy flavors enhance the fruit flavors in this wine, especially with foods such as herb roasted chicken, grilled pork, caramelized onions, eggplant, sautéed greens, roasted potatoes or vegetables and aged Jack and Gouda cheese.

name: Hess Collection Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Hess Collection  Cabernet Sauvignon  750 mL

name: Hess Collection North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Hess Collection Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

summary: Hester Creek  Cabernet Merlot 3.0L

name: Hester Creek Cabernet Merlot 750 mL

name: Hester Creek The Judge Golden Mile Bench Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Hester Creek The Judge Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Heady aromas of leather, cassis, blackberry, vanilla and hints of tarragon lead to a palate filled with vibrant cherry, allspice, caramel and cigar box combining to create a soft round mid-palate. The wine finishes with long supple tannins making it approachable in its youth and at the same time showcasing its ability to age for 5-8 years.
food_pairings: This wine is easy to enjoy on its own and will pair well with a nice marbled ribeye, lamb chops or medium to strong cheeses. Try melting Stilton cheese and roasted garlic butter over your ribeye.

name: Hidden Bench  Felseck Vineyard Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: "The Pinot Noir from Beamsville’s Felseck vineyard is as close as Canada will come to Red Sancerre, the screaming minerality from the site (Felseck means “corner of the cliff”) props up the red cherry and raspberry under a veil of flowers and cast iron. Less bright than B.C. Pinot but runs several layers deeper" As reviewed by Everything Wine's Vintage Room consultant Jordan Carrier.
tasting_notes: This elegant vintage of Felseck Vineyard Pinot Noir shows floral aromas of violets and red fruit accompanied by earthy notes on the nose. The generous and youthful palate shows notes of cherries and raspberries along with typical Felseck ferrous minerality and pronounced, structured tannins gives the wine excellent ageing potential.

name: Hillside Winery Merlot 750 mL
summary: Hillside Estate Merlot 750 mL

name: Hillside Winery Merlot/Cabernet Franc Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Hillside Cabernet Merlot Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: A twist on the classic pairing, the bright cranberry aromas of Cabernet Franc highlight the deep plum and blackberry scents of merlot.  Its charming bouquet carries over, and flavours of red and black cherries linger on the palate.  This beautifully balanced wine has a lush tannin structure, and a seamless finish.

name: Honey Badger Sweet Red 750 mL

summary: Hugging Tree Moonchild Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: Lot’s of dark stone fruits on the palate of this Merlot. With minimal oak, the brightness of the fruit shines through. This is the ultimate curl-up-with-a-blanket-and-a-good-book glass of wine. With a bit of breathing time this wine sings!

name: If You See Kay Paso Robles Red Blend 750 mL
summary: If you see kay Lazio Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: The wine is dark purple to the rim, has massive ripe black fruit and rich spice aromas that hit you right away. Dense blackberry and mocha flavors dominate the palate, the mouth-filling texture is powerful, yet elegant and creamy all the way through. The finish goes on forever, with hints of smoke and grilled meat lingering at the end.
food_pairings: Kay is versatile with all kinds of foods, but pairs best with big, bold flavors.

name: Il Bastardo Red 750ml
summary: La Bastarda  750ml

name: Il Padrino Rosso 750 mL
summary: This wine is lovely, plush and full of gorgeously ripe,dark-berried fruit flavours almost like a soft, medium bodied Shiraz with an Italian accent! A fantastic entertaining wine!
tasting_notes: This medium bodied and fruity Sicilian red wine is the quintessential house wine and perfect for social gatherings. The flavour is of red fruits with a touch of spices and notes of pepper. the wine is well-balanced and with soft tannin
food_pairings: A great wine to pair with grilled meat dishes and cheeses.

summary: Inniskillin Okanagan Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Deep ruby red in colour with complex aromas of black currant and cherry on the nose. With flavours on the palate mirroring the nose, the Cabernet Sauvignon is a well balanced wine layered with toasty oak and soft tannins.
food_pairings: This wine would be wonderfully paired with a variety of meat dishes; due to softer tannins, try this with a grilled veal medallion, roast beef or pork tenderloin.

name: Irony  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Irony Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: Irony North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon opens with enticing aromas of boysenberry, black cherry and cassis, with a hint of cedar notes. This medium-bodied wine delivers dark berry flavors, mixed with layers of chocolate covered black cherries and baking spice.
food_pairings: Lush fruit, a balanced profile and bold, dusty tannins make this wine a perfect match for roast beef tenderloin, penne pasta with Italian sausage or even chocolate cake.

name: Island Nation Marlborough Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Island Nation Pinot Noir Marlborough 750 ml
tasting_notes: Complex, concentrated and intriguing, with fleshy blackberry and plum flavors at the core, showing highlights of black walnut, sandalwood, dried pine needle, black pepper and musky Darjeeling tea. The tannins are refined and plush, and the finish is epic.
food_pairings: ham                                                Charcuterie, ham and other cold meats. Patés and terrines. classic French dishes with light creamy sauces such as rabbit or kidneys with a mustard sauce. Goat cheese. Grilled asparagus. Spring vegetables such as peas

name: Ivory & Burt Lodi Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Concentrated aromas and flavours of rich cherry and lush blackberry!
tasting_notes: The Lodi Appellation had a near perfect growing season in 2012 with warm afternoons and cool evenings, leading to Zinfandel winegrapes with terrific quality - exactly what Lodi is known for. Concentrated aromas and flavours of rich cherry and lush blackberry are dominant throughout and come together with oak spice from new American oak aging. These prominent juicy fruit notes with the presence of oak make an enticing wine that is hard to set down.

name: J Drouhin Gamay 750 mL
summary: J Drouhin Gamay 750 mL
tasting_notes: A truly convivial wine. Owing to the careful blending of various terroirs, the result is a wine of great charm. It has a lovely raspberry colour and a brilliant hue.  The nose is both refined and intense, with notes of violet, peony and red fruit syrup. As you drink it, it feels fresh and silky. Both freshness and fruit remain for quite a long time on the palate.

name: J Lohr  Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Classic barrel-aged Cabernet with high-toned fruit and a lovely bouquet of hazelnut and toasted pastry and one of our customer favourites. Boasting layered fruit aromas of cherry and plum which are further accented by an authentic barrel bouquet of hazelnut, dark chocolate and toasted pastry. A great Cabernet Sauvignon to enjoy with friends or with bruchetta and barbequed meats.
tasting_notes: J. Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon is red-purple in color with a bright hue at release. Fruit aromas are black cherry, plum and blueberry accented with a barrel bouquet of toasted pastry, dark caramel and vanilla. Sturdy tannins strike the palate and finish with a high-toned fruit signature.
food_pairings: Pair with braised shortribs, a rich beef tenderloin with gorgonzola butter or spicy fajitas.

name: J Lohr  South Ridge  Syrah 750 mL
summary: J Lohr  South Ridge Syrah 750ml
tasting_notes: Varietal aromas of black tea and blueberry are lifted by barrel aging on the lees in a blend of American and French oak barrels. Smoky notes and vanilla are evident in this lean structured and spicy vintage of Syrah.  Black tea and blueberry aromas with a
food_pairings: A simple roasted duck with potatoes or rare sesame-crusted Ahi tuna. For casual fair, try a classic BLT.

food_pairings: Try it with steak, grilled meat, lamb, pasta with bolognese, cheese.

name: Jean-Michel Dupre Regnie Haut Ronze Vieille Vignes 2016 750 mL
summary: La Ronze is a little hill located in the Cru Regnie, which has the most presence of granite in its subsoil. A lot of the fruit profile in this wine is a result of the Gamay varietal and a nice minerality from the terroir.
tasting_notes: Each Beaujolais Cru has its own 'personality' and Regine has a beautifully balanced floral and elegant style with a hint of power and structure on the palate. Offering aromas of red berries and baking spice, flavours of black cherry and pomegranate with notes of roses and minerals.
food_pairings: Try it with summer salads, sea food and fishes, pasta, cheese or even grilled white or red meat.

name: John Quarisa 30 Mile  Shiraz 750ml
summary: John Quarisa 30 Mile  Shiraz 750ml
tasting_notes: Beautiful deep colour in the glass, with a swish, sweet nose of blackberry, vanilla and cinnamon. The mouthfeel is round and smooth, with gorgeous jammy flavours and hints of baking spice and chocolate. Very big and bold, with ripe, peppery tannins.
food_pairings: Drink on its own, with prime topside beef burger or with good farmhouse cheddar.

name: Jordan Winery Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013 750 mL
summary: Jordan Winery Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
tasting_notes: Intense aromas of cassis, black currants, blackberries and ripe cherries with a lovely floral note. The palate is rich and seductive, exuding blackberries and cassis interwoven seamlessly with fine tannins from new French oak barrels. Its masculine structure is harnessed by a beautiful balance of acidity and dark fruits with a long, cassis-laced finish.
food_pairings: Jordan Cabernet Sauvignon’s dark fruits, rich palate and fine tannin structure make it a versatile companion at the table. Though a natural pairing for a flavorful steak, this wine’s balance of fruit, tannin and acidity beautifully complement grilled or roasted dishes, such as herb-crusted lamb, pork belly or rosemary chicken.

name: Jose Maria da Fonseca  Periquita Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Jose Maria da Fonseca  Periquita Red Blend 750 mL

name: Jose Maria da Fonseca  Periquita Reserva Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Jose Maria da Fonseca  Periquita Reserva Red Blend 750 mL

name: Josep Foraster Seleccio 750ml
summary: Josep Foraster Seleccio 750ml

name: Joseph Drouhin  Vosne-Romanee 2013 750 ml
summary: Joseph Drouhin  Vosne-Romanee 2013 750 ml

name: Joseph Phelps Cabernet Sauvignon 2014 750 mL
summary: Joseph Phelps Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Beautiful aromatics of dark fruit, cigar box, dried herbs, graphite notes and pain grille. Expressive Bing cherry, licorice, blueberry and blackberry layer this silky smooth wine of great depth and personality. Richly nuanced with supple tannins and a lingering velvety finish.
food_pairings: Best served with classic meat dishes using such as roast chicken, ribs, hamburgers, barbecue, roasted or braised red meats. Joseph Phelps Vineyards is also good with Asian dishes, hearty fish courses like tuna, salmon, mushrooms and pasta.

name: Joseph Phelps Insignia 2014 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: "Joseph Phelps Insignia 2014, Napa Valley. One of Napa’s Crown Princes, from the middle of the region’s golden streak of vintages, ironically elevated by the long drought. I had the opportunity to taste this vintage alongside the previous 2013, and the differences are slight but noticeable. The ’13 has a more friendly fruit weight but the ’14 is structured, dense and timeless, perhaps due to the rare omission of Merlot in that year’s blend. As close as Insignia has come to the “classic Napa” style in some time, with chocolate and coffee notes bracing the “Night Of A Thousand Berries” nose that is so characteristically Phelps. 2014 is Motorhead compared with 2013’s Elton John, focused and hardcore, not really caring what you think of it… yet. Another Insignia for the ages" As described by our vintage room expert, Jordan Carrier.
tasting_notes: Opening with heady blackberry and plum aromatics laced with baking spices, cardamom and espresso. Focused and fresh, this exceptionally concentrated wine showcases elegant tannin structure and a silky mouthfeel layered with dark fruit, sweet vanilla bean, cracked black pepper and bittersweet chocolate.

name: Josh Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Josh Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Juan Gil  Blue Label 18 Meses Red Blend 750ml
summary: Juan Gil Jumilla red blend was recently highlighted by our Vintage room expert Jordan Carrier in a review of Spanish wine regions. "As a person of Scottish ethnicity with pale skin (you’d see through me if it weren’t for the beard) and an even paler tolerance for heat, I doubt I’d hang out in Jumilla very long but the wines are fab. Hot, dry and harsh, this elevated region east of Andalucía has embraced modernity by combining the traditional Monastrell grape with international Cabernet Sauvignon. This hyper-charged blend by the enterprising Gil family is back in all of its hedonistic glory, showing vanilla and coconut over black fruits and a blacker pigment, and drinks almost identically to the family’s famous Clio, but for $20 less a bottle."
tasting_notes: Purple/black in colour, it proffers a nose of pain grille, graphite, earth notes, spice box, black fruits, and a hint of balsamic. It opens in the glass to reveal excellent density, savory flavors, plenty of spice, and a lengthy, pure finis.
food_pairings: Rice, pasta (noodles, spaghetti, macaroni), vegetables, mushroom, stewed meat, sausage, pork, roast meat, red and/or white meat with sauces, grilled meat, short or medium-cured cheeses.

name: Juan Gil  Honoro Vera Organic Verdejo 750 mL
summary: Juan Gil  Honoro Vera Organic Verdejo 750ml
tasting_notes: Opens up a rich fresh aromas of white flowers and tropical fruits. Nice summary and the full flavor of fresh apples and pears.

name: Juan Gil  Monastrell 750ml
summary: Juan Gil 4 Meses Monastrell 750ml
tasting_notes: Intense deep red cherry colour. Powerful in nose, clean and complex. Very attractive fruity aromas, touch’s of ripe fruit and reminds of new wood. Well-balanced, soft tannins and very long finish.
food_pairings: A great food wine that partners with a wide range of cuisine such as rice, stews, legumes, mushrooms, stewed meat, cured meat, roasted meats, short or medium cheeses, grilled meat or with sauce.

name: Julia Kemper Wines Dao Reserve Red Blend 750ml
summary: Julia Kemper Wines Dao Reserve Red Blend 750ml

name: Justin  Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Justin Cabernet Sauvignon
tasting_notes: Dark purple ruby core, slightly lighter at the rim showing light staining on the glass. Aromatic with bright ripe black cherry and blackcurrant fruit, baking spice, savory dried autumn leaves, subtle violet floral notes with a hint of caramelized barrel sweetness. Dry, moderate plus bodied, with ripe red and black cherry, and blackcurrant fruit joined by vanilla and cinnamon spice notes on the entry. The mid-palate is fresh with sustained ripe fruit, toasty oak notes and softly textured tannins. The finish is moderately long with notes of cherry candy and blackcurrant fruit matched with subtle classic Cabernet savory elements.
food_pairings: JUSTIN Cabernet Sauvignon is a great all-around choice for a wide range of food pairings from a simple cheese and charcuterie plate or a burger to vegetable lasagna, or even a prime rib. If you are looking for a quality, all-purpose red wine, this is it!

name: Justin Monmousseau  Chinon Cabernet Franc 750 ml

summary: Kaesler Stonehorse  Shiraz/Grenache/Mouvedre 750 ml
tasting_notes: Black cherries, dark fruits and hints of spice on the nose. Dark cherry and chocolate linger on the palate.  This GSM is a full bodied wine with a velvety mouth feel.
food_pairings: A rich, ripe Australian blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre (GSM, as they call it), loaded with the toasty, vanilla-like flavors of new American oak. Oaky wines, in general, don’t pair well with food, because they can overwhelm most flavors. But this r

name: Kaiken Malbec 750 mL
summary: Kaiken Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: Of a deep violet color, warm in the nose, with notes of ripe fruit and traces of tobacco and butterscotch. In the mouth it displays intensity, with strong, fleshy tannins; while at the same time juicy and enveloping; with a long, persistent finish. A harmonious liaison with the oak barrels, makes of this wine a fine example of the Mendoza terroir.
food_pairings: Pair with meat-lovers' pizza or grilled lamb chops.

name: Kathryn Hall Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2012 750 mL
summary: Kathryn Hall Napa Valley 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: Exuding warmth and allure with enticing aromas of sweet dark plum, cocoa powder, and dusty earth are laced with a subtle note of dried mountain sage. The exquisitely seamless, supple, and opulent palate features decadent dark fruit, a savory umami character and sweet, rich, lengthy tannins on the finish. The layers of this powerful wine will unfold beautifully over time.

name: Kingston Estates Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Kingston Estates Shiraz 750 mL
tasting_notes: Brilliant crimson with purple hues the bouquet is of rich ripe plum fruits complemented by spicy pepper notes. Superbly full bodied with layers of lush dark berry and plum fruit that meld elegantly with spice. Hints of smoky oak balance well with soft tannins and a smooth finish.
food_pairings: Perfectly paired with barbecued foods, richly flavoured meats and game birds.

name: Kipu Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: A bright, fresh and fruity Cabernet Sauvignon from Chile! Aromas and flavours of raspberry and blueberry with notes of vanilla on the finish. Pair it with burgers and grilled red meats.
tasting_notes: Aromas of red berries, flavours of raspberry, blueberry and vanilla this is a medium bodied Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon with juicy fruit flavours and soft round tannins on the finish.
food_pairings: Perfect for everyday entertaining or to accompany a meal. Enjoy with grilled red meat or burgers outside in the sun, with a cheese and charcuterie platter or pasta based dishes with meat sauces.

name: La Devise De Lilian  Saint-Estephe 2014 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: "The Second Wine to the Lilian Ladouys, made about as soft and inviting as a St Estèphe can get, like dressing a wolverine in a Spongebob costume. Cabernet-driven and quite a bit more approachable than the Grand Vin, with generous black fruit and bits of smoky caramel leading the way, this is elegantly drinkable and more than a bit floral. Rich and delicious but it’s still a St. Estèphe and it still doesn’t trust you, so decant it long enough for it to get used to your scent." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Under the ruby colour, the nose is intense and complex. Enjoy this dry, full-bodied and woody red featuring refreshing acidity. On the palate, it showcases fleshy tannins and a broad mouthfeel that leads into a medium finish.
food_pairings: Fruity with a velvety structure, it pairs wonderfully with fresh cuisine such as white meat or fruity desserts.

name: La Piuma Chianti Sangiovese 750 mL
summary: A great value Italian red, the La Piuma Chianti Sangiovese offers savory notes and delicious flavours. Pair this with some classic Italian cuisine such as pastas in tomato based sauces or a thin crust pizza and you shall not be disappointed.
tasting_notes: A fantastic value Italian red filled with savoury notes and delicious aromas. Layers and layers of spicebox, blackberries and summer ripe strawberries.
food_pairings: Best paired with red meats, pastas and Italian style thin crust pizza or with a selection of mature cheese. A great everyday wine.

summary: La Stella Maestoso 2011 Merlot 750 ml

Petit Verdot adds more acidity and red fruit character while a small amount of Carmenère helps to round everything off. The wine is concentrated, fresh, well balanced and has a long finish.

name: Lake Sonoma Winery Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Lake Sonoma Winery Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: On the palate, this Cabernet expresses a dark chocolate, cassis, and cranberry entry that transforms into a ripe cherry, clove, and toasted oak flavors on the mid-palate, ending with fine, silky tannins that pleasingly linger in your mouth. This wine is a carefully crafted, delicious expression of Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon, not to be missed. It’s ready to drink now, or lay down for future enjoyment.

name: Lange Twins Winery Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Lange Twins Winery Lodi Estate Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Opens with dense cherry aromas that carry through to the palate.  Extended maceration adds richness and length to the wine while 16 months of aging in predominately French Oak barrels lend flavors of warm spice. This is a well-balanced wine that can be enjoyed now and for years to come.

name: Lange Twins Winery Moscato 750 mL
summary: Lange Twins Winery Moscato 750 mL
tasting_notes: Aromas and flavors of fresh white peach, apricot and orange blossom are balanced by a little sparkle giving the wine a light body and refreshing finish. It is a classic light Moscato with natural sweetness and crisp acidity.

name: Langhe Nascetta Terre Del Barolo 750ml
summary: Langhe Nascetta Terre Del Barolo 750ml

name: Langmeil  Valley Floor Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Langmeil  Valley Floor Shiraz 750 mL

name: Lapostolle Casa  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Lapostolle Casa  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Intense purple color. Expressive nose full of fresh red fruit along with tobacco, cedar and tea leaf towards the finish. On the palate, fresh attack and a medium body. Finishing with very juicy tannins.
food_pairings: The ideal companion for pastas, pork and grilled red meat.

name: Lariana Cellars Carmenere 750 mL
summary: Lariana Cellars Carmenere 750 mL
tasting_notes: The Carmenere by Lariana was primarily aged in French oak for 20 months, giving this wine a savoury quality that must be experienced. Pepper and earth aromas meet a palate of plum, black cherry, and prune flavours. Ripe tannins and a lasting, smooth finish.
food_pairings: The perfect wine for your summer Barbecues, this pairs fantastically with barbecued lamb.

name: Latido de Sara Navarra Wild Garnacha 2016 750 mL
summary: The producers, Sara Martinez-Lagos and Leon Florez, chose the name Latido de Sara - “Sara’s Heartbeat - in honour of Sara’s father who passed away a few years ago. With aromas of ripe fruits this wine is medium-bodied, dry, well balanced and with a long finish. Enjoy with grilled meat or earthy vegetarian dishes. Sara Martinez-Lagos: General Manager, Sarah Selections.
tasting_notes: Bright burgundy red colour, with ruby hues. Aromas and flavours of ripe, sweet fruits - cherry, strawberry, and raspberry - with sweet notes of vanilla, caramel, and balsamic/spices. Medium-bodied, dry, well balanced, with a long, finish.
food_pairings: Charcuterie, grilled meat dishes, earthy vegetarian dishes, and great for enjoying with barbecued/grilled meats with spicy/smoky sauces.

name: Laughing Bird  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Laughing Bird  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml
tasting_notes: Fully fruity with spice on top of vanilla undertones. Experience deep, savoury blackcurrant with smooth tannins and balanced oak.

name: Laughing Bird  Shiraz 750 ml
summary: Laughing Bird  Shiraz 750 ml
tasting_notes: Ripe and aromatic with notes of cherry, chocolate and vanilla to the fore. The palate continues the chocolate-cherry theme, with powder dry tannins and a fine, fresh acidity on the finish.
food_pairings: A great match for grilled red meats.

name: Laughing Stock  Blind Trust  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Laughing Stock  Blind Trust 2012 Red blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Opulent flavours including crisp dark black cherry and currant with a playful note of stewed strawberry and toasted vanilla bean. The depth of flavour is complimented by a touch of acid to refresh the palate and fine grained silty tannins provide the wine with extra muscle.

name: Laughing Stock Small Caps Program Syrah 750ml
summary: Laughing Stock Small Caps Program Syrah 750ml

name: Le Bessole Valpolicella Ripasso  Classico Superiore DOC 750 mL
summary: Le Bessole Valpolicella Ripasso  Classico Superiore DOC 750 mL

name: Le Bienfaisance de Chateau Sanctus Saint Emillon Grand Cru 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A particularly expressive wine is born, with a nose that exhales very ripe black fruits and a mouth that combines elegance, complexity, race and power . This Grand Cru, dominated by Merlot, is to drink young or after a few years of cellar, according to your desires

name: Le Clairon Des Anges Costieres De Nimes GSM 750 mL
summary: Le Clairon Des Anges Costieres De Nimes GSM 750 mL
tasting_notes: Distinctive balsamic aromas lead to a herbal palate. Notes of licquorice, sweet spices and dry leaves on the finish.
food_pairings: Perfect with hearty casseroles or try with cheeses.

name: Le Dauphin d'Olivier Pessac Leognan Red Blend 2015 750 mL
summary: "The Second Wine to Chateau Olivier, a Classified Growth of Graves (The wineries of Graves/Pessac, Bordeaux’s oldest growing region on the eastern side of the city, have their own classification system apart from/in tandem with the 1855 table. Don’t worry, it’ll all sort itself out). Nobody is entirely sure how old Olivier is, the running guess is that it dates back to the Plantagenets and has a credible claim to be the oldest wine estate in Bordeaux, and is also one of the few “Chateaux” that is, in fact, an actual castle (moat and drawbridge included). The estate itself is quite large, boasting forest, prairies and vineyards, and owned by the same family since the mid 1800s, making Merlot/Cabernet wines that teem with blackberries and raspberries locked in a cigar box. The Dauphin has always had a rep for being uncannily close to its bigger brother in quality. " - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage room consultant
tasting_notes: Ruby red in colour the wine combines aromatic and tannic richness. The nose initially smoked and mineral develops on aromas of red fruits and blackcurrants. The attack is precise and the mouth is long and intense.

name: Le Grand Noir Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Le Grand Noir Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: The blend of rich blackcurranty Cabernet and brambley, gently peppery Syrah makes this a very distinctive wine. The vanilla character of the oak is present but subtle, and the tannins are softer than in many Cabernets. A very luxurious drink; silky and satisfying.
food_pairings: Good with a range of red meat dishes, but its soft fruity character makes this an attractive wine to drink by itself.

name: Le Grand Roi  Chateauneuf Du Pape 2106 750 mL
summary: Le Grand Roi Chateauneuf-du-Pape is a masterfully complex wine. Though it is young, it has a mature development for those who wish to drink it now, or it can be saved for up to five years as a stunning cellar item. Produced by Marius Michaud, Le Grand Roi means “The Great King,” and celebrates the king’s forest and its majestic animals.
tasting_notes: This is a rare wine with qualities that you will remember throughout your lifetime. On the nose, you’ll find intense aromas of dark cherries, licorice, rich cocoa, and figs with superbly crafted smokiness and roasted flavours.
food_pairings: This deep, dark red is ideal for cool fall nights, buttery roasted duck, rich game meats, stews, or succulent steak.

name: Le Sentier dans Les Vignes Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A warming Rhône style blend of Grenache and Syrah with rich, spiced fruit aromas, ample round fruit on the palate and gentle tannins. Medium-bodied and with a long finish. Keep cool with a fresh ceviche and this summery white blend! Try it with grilled Lamb chops! Produced by Samantha Bailey: Winemaker, Boutinot France /  Boutinot Wine Ambassador and Master Blender
tasting_notes: A warming Rhône style red with rich spiced fruit aromas, ample round fruit on the palate and gentle tannins. Medium-bodied and very moreish!
food_pairings: Great with lamb chops cooked on a griddle pan until just pink. Also works well with salmon or tomato-based pasta dishes.

name: Lewis Cellars Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Lewis Cellars Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: A silky powerhouse of fruit at wide-open-throttle. Black currant, plum and juicy ripe berries rev freely on the palate with seductive oak spice, candle wax and semi-sweet chocolate aromas. Fine-tuned and polished, the wine is deceptively powerful with supple, sweeping tannins.

name: Leyda  Canelo Single Vineyard Syrah 750 mL
summary: Leyda  Canelo Single Vineyard Syrah 750 mL

name: Liberado Cabernet Sauvignon/Tempranillo 750ml
summary: Liberado Cabernet Sauvignon/Tempranillo 750ml

name: Liberty School  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: A customer favourite the Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon opens with classic aromas of black cherry, plum and violets before a complex mix of flavours and undertones add depth to the taste. This approachable fruit-driven Cabernet Sauvignon maintains velvety tannins and balancing acidity for a long, fruit driven finish.
tasting_notes: The Cabernet Sauvignon opens with classic aromas of black cherry, plum and violets, followed by subtle flavours of strawberry and allspice and undertones of charred sandalwood, black peppercorn, eucalyptus and a dash of cinnamon. Firm yet supple tannins finish off this approachable fruit-driven Cabernet Sauvignon, making it ideal for a variety of food.
food_pairings: A wonderful steak wine.  Enjoy this with grilled beef or duck.

name: Lindeman Gentleman's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
summary: Lindeman Gentleman's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

summary: Cecchetti Wine Company Line 39 Petite Sirah 750ml

name: Lingua Franca Avni Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Lingua Franca Avni Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: AVNI Pinot Noir reflects the complex flavor profile of Eola-Amity Hills fruit, born of rocky, volcanic soils on the hillside vineyards of the Willamette Valley. The wine is medium bodied but offers surprising depth and structure. Floral, smoky, mineral and red cherry, black plum fruit tones meld into a long silky finish.

name: Lini 910 Lambrusco Reggiano Frizzante 750ml
summary:
88 Points – Alison Napjus, Wine Spectator (Apr 30, 2016): “Graphite and spice notes lace flavors of steeped cherry and sweet brown bread in this fresh, distinctive Lambrusco. Lightly chewy on the finish. Drink now.”
Enjoy this dry Lambrusco chilled with rustic Italian food like: pizza, pasta, antipasti, & charcuterie

name: Lisini Brunello di Montalcino 2012/2013 750 mL
summary: Highly acclaimed from the stella 2012 vintage, the Lisini Brunello di Montalcino was awarded 94 points by Wine Enthusiast. Lisini concentrate on a traditional style in which ripe red and dark fruit with florals wrap around a sturdy structure and ripe, sturdy tannins. Great with red meats or enjoyed on its own.
tasting_notes: The 2012 vintage was superb for richness and texture though Lisini concentrate on a traditional style in which ripe red and dark fruit with florals and cured meat nuances wrap around a structure of fresh acid and ripe but sturdy tannins.
food_pairings: This highly acclaimed Brunello is wonderful to enjoy on its own, though if you wish to find the perfect dish to offset its deep fruit flavours we recommend a number of red meats such as game, pork and lamb or roasted vegetables

name: Little Engine Wines Gold Label Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Little Engine Reserve Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: This ruby coloured wine heralds Spring with characteristics of a fresh baked strawberry rhubarb pie, Rainier cherries and a hint of Rooibos tea leaves.
food_pairings: A pleasingly textured palate with firm acidity that is equally wonderful on its own or with a charcuterie platter.

name: Locatour Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: This bold Cabernet Sauvignon boasts concentrated black fruit flavours, luxurious toasted spice and a firm structure. Pair with savoury, meaty dishes like peppercorn ribeye or braised short ribs.
tasting_notes: This bold Cabernet Sauvignon boasts concentrated black fruit flavors, luxurious toasted spice and a firm structure.
food_pairings: Pair it with savory, meaty dishes like peppercorn ribeye or braised short ribs.

name: Lokoya Mount Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

summary: Long Shadows  Pedestal Merlot 2011 750 mL
tasting_notes: Created with consultation from Michel Rolland, the Bordeaux winemaker from Pomerol, who has consulted on Oculus, Ornellaia and Masseto, and is known as the King Of Merlot. It’s undeniably a Washington wine, however, showing creme de cassis, black raspberr
food_pairings: Serve with roasted or braised meats, or coq au vin.

summary: Longshot Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
food_pairings: If you're not using red wine to make your burgers yet, this daring flavor-bomb might just change your life. With big, lush waves of jammy fruit and black cherry, our Cab turns up the umami in sturdy mains like steaks, chops, shepherd's pie, and anything else you happen to sit down to.

name: Longshot Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Longshot Red Blend 750 mL
food_pairings: It’s tough to come up with a food this Red doesn’t like. It’s the perfect splash at smoky backyard BBQs, and it adds incredible flavor to every day occasions like “dinner” and “nighttime”.

name: Longview Yakka Shiraz 750 ml
summary: Longview Yakka Shiraz 750 ml

name: Louis Martini Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Louis Martini Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Louis Martini Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Luca  Alta de Mendoza  Malbec 2015 750 mL
summary: This gem displays a fragrant perfume of lavender, wood smoke, spice box, black cherry, and blackberry!
tasting_notes: This is a great example of Mendoza Malbec. Incredible deep purple red color. Loads of spice and black and red cherry aromas with notes of chocolate. The berry flavors really pop on the palate as the wine has both a full mid palate and lively acidity that leads to an incredibly long finish. A bottom note of freshly brewed espresso keeps the mouth watering too. This one is a teenager at the moment, and should age very well.
food_pairings: Pairs well with foods such as venison or wild game, steak, pork, quail, all types of lamb and medium-strong cheeses. A very flexible wine due to its concentration and balance.

name: Luca  Alta de Mendoza  Syrah 2015 750 mL
summary: Another fantastic vintage from a consistently superb estate, Lucas focus on producing quality over quantuty shines through in this Syrah, the nose is like walking into a gentlemen’s poker parlo, rich, lush, and mouthfilling on the palate. Superb with grilled red meats.
tasting_notes: Beautiful deep purple color, tilting the glass the shallows are a soft rose. The nose is like walking into a gentlemen’s poker parlor: aromas of cigar, leather, and smoked meat fill the nose with hints of toasty oak, forest floor and baking spice. Rich, lush, and mouthfilling on the palate. Well structured tannins support big fruit flavors of blackberry jam, black spiced cherries, ground black pepper and just a hint of rhubarb. Nice, long, lingering finish.
food_pairings: Pairs well with grilled or smoked meats such as beef, pork, and lamb, and dishes prepared with mild cheeses or wild mushrooms.

name: Luccarelli Folle Primitivo 750 mL
summary: Luccarelli Folle Primitivo 750ml

summary: Luccarelli Negroamaro 750ml

summary: Luccarelli Primitivo 750ml

summary: Luigi Bosca  Reserva Malbec 750 mL

name: Luigi Bosca De Sangre Cabernet/Merlot/Syrah 750 mL
summary: Luigi Bosca De Sangre Cabernet/Merlot/Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: Luigi Bosca De Sangre is a ruby red wine with garnet shades. It is intense in the nose, with aromas redolent of sweet spices, tobacco, white pepper, blackcurrant liquor and black fruit jam with toasty notes. It is tasty, juicy in the mouth, with long aromatic sweet tannins.
food_pairings: A perfect match for rich preparations such as lamb stew, spiced chicken and pasta with bolognese sauce.

name: Luis Segundo Correas Valle Las Acequias  Bonarda 750 mL
summary: Luis Segundo Correas Valle Las Acequias  Bonarda 750 mL

name: Lunaris San Juan Malbec 750 mL
summary:
Enticing aromas of cherry and plum with a background of warming spice. Well-structured with freshness to the finish and ripe fruit and spice again.
This is a pleasant, smooth wine that goes well with steak.

name: Lungarotti Montefalco Sagrantino 750 mL
summary: Lungarotti Montefalco Sagrantino 750 mL
tasting_notes: A red wine with great richness in polyphenols. Deep and intense purple-red colour with a complex bouquet of red fruits, marasca cherry, currant and raspberry, as well as delicate notes of sweet tobacco and cocoa, finishing off with hints of officinal herbs. The structure is dense with rich but harmonious tannins and wonderful complexity; the fruitiness is sustained by fresh acidity and the finish is long-lasting.
food_pairings: Perfect match with red meat roasts, suckling pig, game, dishes “alla ghiotta” guinea-hen in civet, stewed venison, sharp cheeses, Umbrian-style squab.

name: M. Chapoutier  Bila-Haut Red Blend 750 mL
summary: M. Chapoutier  Bila-Haut Red Blend 750 mL

summary: M. Chapoutier Domaine Tournon Mathilda Shiraz 750 mL

name: M. Chapoutier Occultum Lapidem Red Blend 750 mL
summary:
92 POINTS, THE WINE ADVOCATE - 2014 VINTAGE!
"The wine is scented with rosemary, sage, blackberry, mulberry, which are joined on a rich, expansive palate by marrow-rich meatiness and a striking, saline, iodine-tinged savor that I can only liken to shrimp shell reduction... The sense of clarity, brightness, and energy here is utterly infectious and the combination of pure dark fruits, invigoratingly pungent smokiness, and saliva-inducing salinity is bound to induce hunger - among other things for the next sip. Look for at least ten or a dozen years of stimulating acquaintance."

name: M. Chapoutier Rasteau Red Blend 750 mL
summary: M. Chapoutier Rasteau Red Blend 750 mL

name: Macchion dei Lupi Profeta Toscana 750 mL
summary: Macchion dei Lupi Profeta Toscana 750 mL
tasting_notes: Boasting a strawberry and raspberry nose, crystalline mouth feel with notes of resin and lightly smoked notes. Beautiful finish with great finesse.
food_pairings: Perfect with red meat dishes, stewed dishes, boiled meats, white meats, cheese selections, risottos and pasta dishes with elaborate sauces.

name: Maculan Fratta Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Maculan Fratta Red Blend 750 mL

name: Maggio Petite Sirah 750 mL
summary: Maggio Petite Sirah 750ml
tasting_notes: With hints of fig, fine cocoa, and licorice, this wine has a rich color with dark berry flavors and a lingering finish.
food_pairings: Enjoy with hearty foods and rich stews like beef stroganoff or venison stew.

name: Maison Chanson Le Bourgogne Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Maison Chanson Le Bourgogne Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Majella Wines The Musician Cabernet Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Majella Wines The Musician Cabernet Shiraz 750 mL
tasting_notes: The Musician is the epitomy of the rich, gorgeous Shiraz Cab blends that are characteristic of Australia. Featuring a spicy nose, followed by rich, soft black fruit, The Musician is arguably one of best values in the store - It's hard to keep The Musician

name: Mancura  Etnia  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Mancura Etnia Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Mancura  Etnia Merlot 750 mL
summary: Mancura Etnia Merlot is an inviting deep ruby-red and fantastic representation of the Merlot varietal character. Named for the Mancura, the Mythical Condor of the Andes Etnia series is a celebration of the rich ancestral heritage of the Chilean and south American peoples. Packed full of ripe blackberry and plum aromas this MErlot is succulent, soft and fruity. Great enjoyed with pasta and white meats.
tasting_notes: An inviting deep ruby-red in colour, this wine is packed full of ripe blackberry and plum aromas with delicate hints of spice and crushed black pepper. The palate is succulent, soft and fruity, beautifully balanced by velvet-textured tannins as the key to its charm.
food_pairings: Ideal to combine with pasta dishes and tomato based sauces or white meat such as a chicken or softer steamed fish.

name: Mandoleto Nero D'Avola 750 ml
summary: Mandoleto Nero D'Avola 750 ml

name: Marchesi di Barolo Barbera del Monferrato 750ml
summary: Marchesi di Barolo Barbera del Monferrato 750ml
tasting_notes: The color is a lively and brilliant dark ruby-red. The perfume is fresh and intense with clean scents of wild berries, currants and sour black cherry. A light hint of vanilla and toasted oak. The flavor is warm and robust, full-bodied, pleasant and balanced.
food_pairings: This Barbera's sensory attributes make it an outstanding accompaniment for imposing first courses and main-course, meats boiled or roasted.

name: Marchesi di Barolo Cannubi 2012 Barolo 750 mL
summary: Marchesi di Barolo Cannubi 2012 Barolo 750 mL

name: Marchesi Mazzei Fonterutoli  Chianti Classico 2008 750ml
summary: Marchesi Mazzei Fonterutoli  Chianti Classico 750ml
tasting_notes: Cherry-red in colour, this red boasts a medium nose exuding woody, spicy, floral and fruity aromas. Discover this medium-bodied wine expressing refreshing acidity and offering a broad texture and fleshy tannins. It also unveils a medium mouthfeel that leads into a medium finish.
food_pairings: Pair this with aged cold cuts, dark sauce pastas, and BBQ grilled meats with spicy sauces. Enjoy this now!  or - cellar away; this particular vintage has the aging potential of up to 10 years.

name: Marchesi Mazzei Fonterutoli 2013 Chianti Classico  750 mL
summary: The Marchesi Mazzei Fonterutoli 2013 Chianti Classico is well described by our vintage room consultant Jordan Carrier. "Simply stunning, your suspicions that you badly need this are correct. This drinks like timelessness. Sweet spices surround the mineral and cherry notes, leathery tobacco ties it all together, and the finish – with the perfect balance of acidity, fruit, glycerine and soft tannins – is elegant and bracing. There’s no bad time to open this, the structure allows a decade of aging but it’ll pair with just about anything you eat this season (save chocolates and candies)".
tasting_notes: A well proportioned, elegant body, dark berry, fresh spice flavors, intense, smooth taste.
food_pairings: Great ability to pair: dark sauce pastas, BBQ, boiled meats with spicy sauces, aged cold cuts.

name: Marcus James Malbec 750 mL
summary: Marcus James Malbec 750 mL

summary: Masciarelli  Montepulciano D' Abruzzo 750 ml
tasting_notes: Rich and ripe dark cherry fruit, along with attractive spicy, smoky notes. Fleshy and full, with surprising depth and length.

name: Mascota OPI Malbec 750 mL
summary: Mascota Vineyards OPI Malbec 750 mL

name: Masi  Campolongo di Torbe Amarone delle Valpolicella 750ml
summary: Masi  Campolongo di Torbe Amarone delle Valpolicella 750ml
tasting_notes: An opaque ruby red with intense and complex aromas of baked fruit and cinnamon. The palate is rich, full-bodied and well-balanced, with ripe cherry flavours (sweet and marasca), baked plums and bitter almonds.
food_pairings: Excellent as an after-dinner wine, or to go with red meat, game, quails and richly flavoured dishes. Very good with well-aged cheeses, such as parmesan, pecorino and gorgonzola.

name: Masi  Costasera 2012 Amarone delle Valpolicella 750 mL
summary: Masi  Costasera Amarone delle Valpolicella 750ml

name: Masi  Costasera Amarone delle Valpolicella 1.5L
summary: Masi Costasera Amarone delle Valpolicella 1.5L
tasting_notes: Very dark ruby red with a nose off baked fruit, plums and cherries. The palate offers fruity tastes with hints of coffee and cocoa. Very well balanced.
food_pairings: Excellent as an after-dinner wine, or to go with red meat, game, quails and richly flavoured dishes. Very good with well-aged cheeses, such as parmesan, pecorino and gorgonzola.

name: Masi  Modello delle Venezia Venezie Rosso 3 L
summary: Masi  Modello delle Venezia Venezie Rosso 3 L

name: Masi  Riserva Costasera 2008/09 Amarone delle Valpolicella 750ml
summary: Masi  Riserva Costasera  Amarone delle Valpolicella 750ml
tasting_notes: Opaque ruby red, aromas of plums and baked cherries, with hints of toasted coffee. The palateis majestic and elegant, cherries preserved in spirit, and bitter cocoa. Attractively long finish.
food_pairings: Ideal with red meat, game and mature cheeses. Fine after-dinner drink.

name: Masi Campofiorin Red Blend 375 mL
summary: Masi Campofiorin Red Blend 375 mL

name: Masi Campofiorin Red Blend 750 mL
summary: This is the original Supervenetian created by Masi in 1964, an internationally recognised of “stupendous body and complexity”. This red blend is full bodied, smooth and velvety, but approachable and versatile in its food pairings.
tasting_notes: Ruby red colour; dry with a complex nose of plums, prunes, leather, cinamon spice and violets; dry, medium-to full-bodied with generous fruit on the palate; a nice backbone of spice and tannins.
food_pairings: This is an exceptionally versatile red blend. The Masi Campofiorin pairs well with pasta dishes dressed with rich sauces based from meat or mushrooms; full-blooded grilled or roast red meat or the stronger flavours of game. This wine can also be an Ideal accompaniment to enjoy with well-aged cheese.

name: Masi Grandarella 750ml
summary: Masi Grandarella 750ml

name: Masi Mas'Est Conti Bossi Fedrigotti Teroldego 750 mL
summary: A native variety par excellence, the Teroldego grape that grows on the east-facing slopes in the Conti Bossi Fedrigotti estates offers an intense red with an aroma of fruits of the forest and vanilla. It is refined by light appassimento, an age-old technique that Masi has brought to Trentino from Valpolicella.
tasting_notes: An intense, lively ruby red in colour with a bouquet of ripe red fruit, florals and spicy notes of liquorice. The palate offers a lively acidity and soft, silky tannin prior to its pleasant and persistent finish.
food_pairings: Suited to grilled red meat but also game dishes or well-matured cheeses. It pairs perfectly with the traditional cuisine of the Dolomites.

name: Masi Possessioni Serego Alighieri Rosso del Veronese 750ml
summary: Masi Possessioni Serego Alighieri Rosso del Veronese 750ml

name: Masi Seregro Alighieri Anniversario Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Masi Seregro Alighieri Anniversario Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Very intense red colour, almost totally opaque. Rich and ample on the nose where there is a strong bouquet of baked cherries  and spicy hints of cinnamon and cloves. Firm and full-bodied on the palate as fresh acidity is blended with soft tannins.
food_pairings: This elegant red is perfect with grilled and roasted red meats.   Serve at 18°C (64° F.)

name: Masi Tupungato  Passo Doble Malbec Corvina 750 mL
summary: Masi Tupungato Passo Doble Malbec Corvina 750 mL
tasting_notes: Red with an unusual aromatic intensity; impressive for its fruity intensity and slight spiciness. The strength of the Malbec is softened by the lightly dried Corvina Veronese. An intense ruby red with aromas off ripe cherries and sweet spices. The palate is rich with intense flavours of cherry and fruits-of-the-forest; good length and soft tannins.
food_pairings: A versatile food wine that pairs with a number of dishes from grilled red meat or roasts to feathered game, or richly-flavoured and well-aged cheese.

name: Masi Valpolicella Bonacosta Red Blend 750ml
summary: Masi Valpolicella Bonacosta Red Blend 750ml

name: Masia F Vino Tinto Tempranillo 750ml
summary: Masia F Vino Tinto Tempranillo 750ml
tasting_notes: Aroma with over ripen fruit notes. In the mouth it is sweet, somewhat fresh with greasy tannins and balsamic hints.
food_pairings:
Full of dark summer fruit flavours and a wonderful partner with many meat dishes or on its own.
.

name: Masseria Altemura Sasseo Primitivo 750 ml
summary: Masseria Altemura Sasseo Primitivo 750 ml

name: Mateus  Rose 750ml
summary: Mateus  Rose 750ml

name: Matsu  El Picaro Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: Matsu  El Picaro Tempranillo 750 mL

name: Matteo Correggia  La Val Dei Preti Roero 750ml
summary: Matteo Correggia La Val Dei Pr750mL

name: Matteo Correggia Marun Barbera d'Alba 750 mL
summary: Matteo Correggia Marun Barbera d'Alba 750 mL

name: Matua Marlborough Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Matua Pinot Noir 750ml
tasting_notes: The vibrant crimson colour and aroma of sweet red cherry and strawberry hints at the layered, fresh and fruity flavours in this Pinot. Bright and energetic to taste, it is brimming with layers of red fruit and bramble, seasoned with a dash of spice and light toasted notes. For the finale comes a fresh, lingering finish that is simply moreish.
food_pairings: Pour yourself a glass of this Pinot, throw some lightly seasoned steak on the BBQ with some capsicum and flame to perfection. Sip, eat and repeat!

name: Maverick Estate Winery Rubeus Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Maverick Estate Winery Rubicon Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Intense dark colour, and typical for our blend, dense aroma of cranberries and fruitcake in a combination with more savory tones or tobacco and anise. A textured palate, layered with flavour. Intense but elegant with a fleshy mid-palate, surrounded by firm tannins and a lingering finish.

name: Maycas del Limari Sumaq Reserva Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Maycas del Limari Sumaq Reserva Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Maycas del Limari Sumaq Reserva Syrah 750 mL
summary: Maycas del Limari Sumaq Reserva Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: Bright ruby red with intense aromas of blackberries and blueberries, as well as toasted notes, chocolate and pepper. The palate is fresh, young, of medium density, crisp minerality and long finishing.
food_pairings: Pair this Syrah with red meat, duck and seasoned pastas.

name: Mayoral Reservado Red Blend 750 mL
summary: This blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot has intense and complex aromas of black fruits with hints of coffee. On the palate it is bold and luscious with round tannins and a long lasting finish.
tasting_notes: A very deep black cherry color with intense and complex aromas of black and stone fruits and with appealing coffee hints.On the palate it is bold, very tasty, luscious, with round sweet tannins and a long lasting finish.
food_pairings: A versatile wine which is great with barbecues and all red meat, as well as on its own. Try it with a piece of black chocolate.

name: Mazzei Poggio Badiola Sangiovese/Merlot 750 mL
summary: Mazzei Poggio Badiola Sangiovese/Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: The 2010 Poggio alla Badiola is a hugely delicious wine for the money. This Sangiovese/Merlot blend boasts gorgeous delineation in its fruit to match its harmonious personality. Crushed flowers, licorice and spices linger on the long, polished finish. Pog

name: McGuigan Black Label Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Aromas of cherry and blackberry underscored with just a hint of spice entice you into these medium-full bodied, rich and rounded flavours comprising ripe sweet berry fruit, hints of spice and a soft pleasant finish. Nicely balanced with great fruit charactersand a persistence of flavour.
tasting_notes: Black cherry red colour; aromas of jammy berry fruit aroma, touch of mint; dry, medium-full bodied, rich and rounded with ripe sweet berry fruit, hints of spice and a soft pleasant finish.
food_pairings: A highly versatile wine that's great for experimenting with on different dishes, for an especially rewarding pairing though try the Black Label Red with tomatoes based Italian meals, spicy Asian foods or a Pizza.

name: McGuigan Private Bin  Shiraz 750 mL
summary: From one of Australia's most renowned wineries the McGuigan Private Bin Shiraz  is smooth yet full bodied with a good mouth presence exhibiting both cherry and plum flavours as well as prominent toasty oak.
tasting_notes: This wine features delightful dark cherry and plum aromas integrated with some smoky vanilla characters and cinnamon from the oak influence. On the palate, the flavours that are suggested by the nose come to life along with some peppery spice.
food_pairings: Shiraz is a great accompaniment to succulent red meat dishes and tomato based pasta.

name: McPherson Family Vineyards Laneway Shiraz 750 mL
summary: McPherson Family Vineyards Laneway Shiraz 750 mL

name: McWilliams  Cabernet Sauvigon / Merlot 750ml
summary: McWilliams  Cabernet Sauvigon / Merlot 750ml

name: McWilliams Hanwood Estate  Shiraz 750ml
summary: McWilliams Hanwood Estate  Shiraz 750ml

name: Meiomi Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: A rich garnet color with a ruby edge, the wine opens to reveal lifted fruit aromas of bright strawberry and jammy fruit, mocha, and vanilla, along with toasty oak notes. expressive boysenberry, blackberry, dark cherry, juicy strawberry, and toasty mocha flavors lend complexity and depth on the palate.
tasting_notes: A rich garnet color with a ruby edge, the wine opens to reveal lifted fruit aromas of bright strawberry and jammy fruit, mocha, and vanilla, along with toasty oak notes. expressive boysenberry, blackberry, dark cherry, juicy strawberry, and toasty mocha flavors lend complexity and depth on the palate.
food_pairings: A consistent profile of supple tannins, silky texture, and balanced acidity that makes it the perfect wine to enjoy with a wide array of food. It pairs particularly well with tomato-based pasta dishes, thin-crust pizza, grilled lamb, and turkey.

name: Menage a Trois California Red Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Menage a Trois Red Blend 750 mL

name: Mendel Mendoza Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Mendel Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza 750 mL
tasting_notes: Mendel Cabernet Sauvignon is combined as a complex of ripe plums, black cherries, raspberries, cherries, cooler floral notes and those from the wood. It is a very elegant and harmonious wine in which acidity and freshness give it balance and long finish, ensuring an excellent aging in bottle.

name: Merryvale  Profile Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Merryvale Profile Red Blend 750 ml
tasting_notes: The level of intensity, color and flavor in the fruit from the Schlatter Family Estate Vineyard is truly exceptional. Aromas of licorice, blackberry, raspberry and plum are interwoven with dark chocolate and black olives and highlighted by balsamic notes. The rich, round entry is the perfect entrée to this wine of significant depth and length. The weight and concentration are balanced by flavors that are equally deep and elegant with leather notes and savory herbs (thyme) on the finish. The oak is well integrated featuring supple, very fine grain tannins. Decant this wine in its youth, it will reach a nice level of complexity 8-10 years from vintage, and with proper cellaring its depth and very fine tannins will continue to develop over the next 10+ years.

name: Merryvale Carneros Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Merryvale Carneros Pinot Noir 750ml

name: Merryvale Signature Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Merryvale Signature Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml
tasting_notes: Fresh berries are prominent on the nose: cherry, blueberry, raspberry. Vanilla, cinnamon, camphor, and mint add depth and complexity the the captivating aromas. The palate features vibrant acidity and an overall sense of balance that is often lacking in your typical high-octane Napa Cabernet. With proper cellaring, it will evolve for 10 to 15 years.

food_pairings: Pairs well with Italian dishes as you may imagine for an Italian red, It compliments pasta dishes particularly well however, why not try with your favorite ravioli blend?

food_pairings: Enjoy with steak and  lamb or brie and cheddar cheeses.

summary: Michel Torino Don David  Reserve Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: Plum jam and raisin combined with pipe tobacco, vanilla and toasted notes dominate the aroma.The palate is very well balanced together with sweat and soft tannins. Fruity, full of plumb and chocolate notes. Pleasant finish.

name: Michele Chiarlo Le Orme Barbera d'Asti 750 mL
summary: Michele Chiarlo Le Orme Barbera d'Asti 750 mL

name: Middle Sister Rebel Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Middle Sister Rebel Red Red Blend. If you drink what you like, and like what you drink try this wine with aromas of plums, blueberries, and blackberries with a dollop of crème de cassis.

summary: Miguel Torres Las Mulas Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml

name: Milestone Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: The ultimate BBQ steak or lamb wine pairing! Milestone produce their wines to be premium-quality, easy-drinking yet somewhat complex. This Cabernet Sauvignon is no exception with its luscious, jammy notes and hints of vanilla on the finish.
tasting_notes: Rich and velvety smooth, our Milestone Cabernet Sauvignon's luscious, jammy notes of blackberry and dark fruit are followed by subtle hints of vanilla and spice on the finish with a touch of sweetness.
food_pairings: BBQ pairing                                                A great wine to pair with burgers, barbecued lamb, a juicy peppered steak or on its own.

name: Miner Family Vineyards Gary's Vineyard Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Miner Family Vineyards Gary's Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Miraflores  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: The Miraflores Cabernet Sauvignon is aged in French and American oak with aromas of ripe red fruits with spicy notes. Good structure with silky, smooth tannins. A fantastic entertaining wine to enjoy today and exclusively available at Everything Wine!
tasting_notes: Intense, bright ruby red in colour, this wine has ripe red fruit aromas with spicy notes. It is medium-bodied with great structure with its silky ripe tannins & ends with a very persistent finish.
food_pairings: Best paired with pastas, red meats, pork, game & cheese!

name: Mirassou Winery Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Mirassou Pinot Noir 750ml

name: Mission Hill Family Estate Five Vineyards Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
summary: Mission Hill  Five Vineyards Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: A full-bodied wine, Merlot and Cabernet Franc provide backbone to Cabernet Sauvignon’s structure with a touch of Petit Verdot for extra body and tannins. Red cherry and cassis aromas are on the nose and extend through to the first sip. Sage, vanilla, lavender, and sandalwood notes intermingle.
food_pairings: This Cabernet Merlot blend is perfectly suited for hearty dishes, especially those with olives, mushrooms, or thyme. Enjoy with duck served over polenta, braised beef ribs, pasta with Bolognese sauce, Asiago cheese, or eggplant Parmesan

name: Mission Hill Family Estate Five Vineyards Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Mission Hill Family Estate Five Vineyards Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Aromas of wild strawberries, anise and black tea abound. On the palate, earthy tones, plums, and toasted almonds come through. There's a vibrant acidity with soft tannins making this medium-bodied wine elegant.
food_pairings: The array of zesty natural herb and spice flavours inherent in this wine allow you to play around with a variety of marinades or rubs. Delightful with grilled wild salmon, Portobello mushrooms, roasted duck or pork, olive bread, or toasted walnuts.

name: Mission Hill Family Estate Quatrain  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Mission Hill Family Estate Quatrain 2013 Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: The 2013 Quatrain offers generous notes of black currant, dark plum, cassis and dried herbs. This full-bodied red built around Merlot and Syrah, offers great concentration of fruit and spice with firm tannins and nice structure. It is very well balanced with a beautifully long finish

name: Mission Hill Family Estate Quatrain 2013 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Mission Hill Family Estate 2012 Quatrain Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: This vibrant red displays black cherry and licorice notes which are framed by hints of mint chocolate and orange peel. The 2012 Quatrain is a rich and dense red with a long savoury aftertaste that is reminiscent of mincemeat tarts. Balanced with a firm, earthy finish.

summary: Monasterio de las Vinas  Garnacha, Tempranillo, Carinena 750ml
tasting_notes: Soft purple red wine with a young intense feeling boasting a violet and blueberry nose. It is juicy and rich and fills the mouth with the flavors of forest fruits and spices.
food_pairings: Partners well with pizzas and Tex Mex

name: Monasterio de las Vinas  Gran Reserva Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Monasterio de las Vinas  Granc Reserva Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: A fine ruby red color that’s starting to display some garnet reflections. Elegant aromas of red currants, tobacco and eucalyptus pervade the nose. Full bodied and intense flavors of cherries, red currants and balsamic touches. The finish is long and enjoyable.
food_pairings: Pairs well with roasted meats and pasta dishes.

name: Mondavi/Rothschild Opus One  Overture 750 mL
summary: Mondavi/Rothschild Opus One  Overture 750 mL

name: Montalto Estate Mornington Peninsula Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Montalto Estate Mornington Peninsula Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Red and black cherry are the hallmark fruit qualities in the Montalto Estate Pinot Noir.  Combine this with notes of black tea, blood orange, florals, spice, earth, dried herbs and forest floor, with a lick of tiramisu trailing from the oak and the result is a formidable and complex aroma profile. Montalto Estate Pinot Noir floods the palate with plenty of juicy red and black cherry fruit together with crushed raspberry. The sweet fruit is harnessed by some serious structural ripe tannin which carries the length of the palate and is supported by bright natural acidity and a long and savoury finish.

name: Montalto Vineyard Pennon Hill Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Montalto Vineyard Pennon Hill Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Red and blue fruits including red currants, blueberry, sour cherry, cranberry and a hint of wild raspberry combine with florals, dried herb, spice, and earthy forest-floor qualities. On the palate, juicy red fruits meld with bramble and earth, whilst fresh acidity provides verve and a moreish drinkability to the wine. French oak plays a lovely supportive role adding to the structure and flavour profile by way of mocha notes. An approachable Pinot Noir with excellent varietal and regional expression.

name: Monte Antico Toscana 750 mL
summary: A fruit-packed wine with black cherry, blueberry and hints of pepper. Full and velvety with a long and delicious finish.
tasting_notes: A Tuscan classic! Deep ruby colour with garnet reflections, its elegant bouquet of leather, black cherries, liquorice and plums preludes a medium to full-bodied palate where ripe red fruit, goût de terroir, subtle notes of vanilla and violets harmonize an

name: Monte Carbonero Ucles Tempranillo/Syrah 750ml
summary: Monte Carbonero Ucles Tempranillo/Syrah 750ml

name: Monte Del Fra Corvina Veronese 750 mL
summary: Monte Del Fra Corvina Veronese 750 mL

name: Monte Rosso Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: With its vibrant fruit flavours of blackcurrant and cherry the Monte Rosso Tempranillo is great with barbecue foods but pairs equally well with a range of other foods and rice dishes. A lovely Spanish red and a great value.
tasting_notes: Dense purple colour, blackcurrant and cherry flavours are dominant and perfectly combined with balsamic and mineral notes. Soft and with agreeable tannins.
food_pairings: Excellent with all meats especially with poultry, cheeses, pastas and rice dishes.

name: Monte Rosso The Red Shiraz 750 mL
summary: The Red Shiraz is a great entertaining wine and the Monte Rosso range has been a firm customer favourite. Incredible value this Spanish Shiraz is rich and juicy with flavours of blackberry and plum. Superb wine to pair with hearty winter fare.
tasting_notes: The Monte Rosso is a rich and juicy red that exudes aromas of cherry and sweet spice, flavours of blackberry, raspberry and plum with notes of freshly cracked pepper.
food_pairings: Great with hearty winter dishes such as pastas with a rich and creamy sauce, thick cuts of Iberian ham or fruity enough to be enjoyed on its own while you shelter inside during those cold, dark winter nights.

name: Monteguelfo I Merli Toscana 750 mL
summary: Monteguelfo I Merli Toscana 750 mL
tasting_notes: The aroma of wine - a multilayered, harmonious, soft enthralling hints of raspberry and blackberry, and subtle mineral undertones. On the palate the wine is rich and deep flavor, generously drop accents of red fruits and wild berries on a background of soft texture. In the long, elegant finish felt nuances of minerals and light tannic touches.
food_pairings: This wine is recommended to serve with grilled meats, pates, vegetable stews and mature cheeses.

name: Montes  Alpha Carmenere  750 mL
summary: Montes Alpha Carmenere 750mL

name: Montes Alpha Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Montes Alpha Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml
tasting_notes: Medium-deep ruby colour with aromas of cassis, smoked meat, tilled earth, vanilla and dark chocolate. Dry with a generous fruit core and firm, wiry tannins. Medium-full bodied with a medium-long, poised finish. Give it 2-4 years in a cellar.
food_pairings: Enjoy it tonight with a slow-cooked roast beef and root vegetables, or herbed beef stew. Or, for a festive theme, savor alongside crown rib roast with stuffing and all the trimmings.

name: Montes Alpha Syrah 750 mL
summary: Montes Alpha Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: Of intense red ruby colour, it has enchanting floral aromas accompanied by tobacco and leathery notes. On the mouth, it is powerful and full bodied with soft and mature tannins and a very long elegant finish.  Can be enjoyed now or cellared for up to 10 y

name: Montes Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Montes Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml

name: Montes Purple Angel Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Montes Purple Angel Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Impressive deep purplish-red in color. The nose presents its habitual elegance with outstanding aromas of ripe red and black berries over a backdrop of sweet spices. Dark chocolate and mocha notes from aging in French oak combine very well with the variety’s characteristic fruity aromas, resulting in a wine with tremendous aromatic complexity that continues to open with layer after layer of new and delicious sensations. The palate is well structured with soft, ample tannins. Acidity from the Petit Verdot lends juiciness and central nerve, qualities that predict excellent evolution and exceptional aging potential. The remarkable finish is elegant and very much in accordance with the nose. This is clearly an ideal wine to enjoy now—or in years to come.
food_pairings: Highly recommended with red meats, lamb chops with rosemary, pork ribs, and cannelloni.

name: Montes Twins Red Blend  750ml
summary: Montes Twins Red Blend  750ml

name: Montico  The Italian Zinfandel 750 ml
summary: Montico  The Italian Zinfandel 750 ml

name: Moon Curser Vineyards Border Vines Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Moon Curser Vineyards Border Vines Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Dry, medium to full-bodied red wine with deep ruby colour.  The nose consists of cassis, blackberry and licorice.  The palate follows the nose with blueberry, some mint characteristics and a little spice.  The wine has good structure, soft ripe tannin, and a textured palate weight creating an elegant mouthfeel.

name: Moon Curser Vineyards Dead Of Night Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Moon Curser Vineyards Dead Of Night 750ml
tasting_notes: A dry, full-bodied red wine with a colour of deep ruby with a touch of purple. The nose consists of dark plum, blackberry, leather and cedar. The palate follows the nose with dark cherry and some earthiness. The wine has good structure; it’s bold yet has an elegance and silky tannins which one might not expect to see in a Tannat blend. The wine comes through with a smooth texture, toasty notes (due to the Hungarian barrels used on the Syrah) and a long finish.

name: Morande Adventure Series Malmau Malbec 750 mL
summary: Morande Adventure Malbec 750 ml

name: Morande Adventure Series Tirazis Syrah 750 mL
summary: Tirazis means Shyraz, the name of the old Persian city believed to be the origin of the Syrah grape variety. Elegant and complex this is a rare and limited Chilean gem.
tasting_notes: Aromas of dark fruit and spice leading to flavours of plum and white pepper with notes of cinnamon and herbs on the elegant and complex palate.
food_pairings: Superb when enjoyed on its own or with lean cuts of red meat, fatty fish, aged cheese or game meats.

name: Morande Adventure Series Vigno Carignan 750 mL
summary: Vigno Carignan 750ml

name: Morande Reserva 2015 Malbec 750 mL
summary: Fresh, juicy and full of fruit with a great balance of acidity, density and tannins. Flavours of red fruit, perfectly reflecting the bright aromas. An elegant body, with firm and yet delicate structure and a long finish.
tasting_notes: A deep red with touches of purple. The aromas are of fresh red fruits such as cherries and raspberries, notes of white pepper and cedar. On the palate the cool climate is perceptible in its fruit, with its tense acidity and great juiciness. Medium-bodied, with elegant tannins and great freshness.
food_pairings: Ideal to accompany white cheeses, pastas with tomato-based sauces and stewed or casseroled meat.

summary: Muga Rioja Reserva Tempranillo 750 mL
tasting_notes: Powerful, intense and very lively, anxious to please from the start. Almost perfect mingling of red-berry fruit and toasted oak aromas on the nose, with the fruit coming to the fore in the mouth and rounding off a supple, balanced overall effect.
