name: Nativa  Growers  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary:
The nose contains aromas of ripe red fruit, cassis, black chocolate and sweet spices such as vanilla and cinnamon, complemented by cedar and tobacco notes. The palate is oily with firm tannins, having an extraordinary balance that is prolonged and persistent.
Ideal for accompanying cheeses, red meats and pasta with heavy sauces.
tasting_notes: The nose on the Nativa Cabernet Sauvignon contains aromas of ripe red fruit, cassis, black chocolate and sweet spices such as vanilla and cinnamon, complemented by cedar and tobacco notes. The palate is oily with firm tannins, having an extraordinary balance that is prolonged and persistent.
food_pairings: Ideal for accompanying cheeses, red meats and pasta with heavy sauces.

name: Neal Family Vineyards Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2011 750 mL
summary: Neal Family Vineyards Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: A structure-led, “serious” Cabernet Sauvignon from high altitude vineyards, this wine will happily age for 15+ years in the cellar. Neal is committed to organically farmed, small production winemaking since 1994. Look for dark cherry, spices and vanilla o
food_pairings: Drink with grilled meats with lots of pepper.

name: Nederburg 56Hundred  Cabernet Shiraz blend 750 mL
summary: Nederburg 56Hundred  Cabernet Shiraz blend 750 mL

name: Nederburg The Winemaster's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Nederburg The Winemaster's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Nederburg The Winemaster's Reserve Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Nederburg The Winemaster's Reserve Shiraz 750 mL

name: Nichol Vineyard Old Vines Syrah 750 mL
summary: Nichol Vineyard Old Vines Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: A very open, almost soft, Old Vines Syrah. On the richer, fatter and more opulent side look for dark black fruits, licorice, the typical game and leather notes all wrapped in a touch of black pepper.

name: Nichol Vineyard Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Nichol Vineyard Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: Matte, dark ruby. Sweet herbs, soil, leather and red tree fruit dominate the nose. Medium bodied with savoury red fruits and herbs on the palate. Grippy tannins and fresh acidity inform the savoury finish.

name: Nicolas Jay Willamette Valley Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: "When Burgundian winemakers produce Oregon Pinots we expect them to make Burgundy, as if they brought all their dirt and climate with them in a magic bag, and we’re always so surprised when the Pinots they make are fruit-driven and clean. Perhaps that’s why this start-up winery downplays the fact that its co-founder and winemaker is none other than Jean-Nicolas Meo of Domaine Meo-Camuzet, a Côte d’Or winemaking family that dates back to the 1600s. This Willamette Pinot uses every AVA in that valley, fruit from such famous crus as Momtazi and Nysa contribute to the blend. Gosh this is pretty. Violet, raspberries, jasmine tea and crushed rocks, the one-third new oak adds some wood tannin to the finish but this Pinot is good to go, supple and delicious." Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage Room consultant.
tasting_notes: The wines show an incredible density and concentration, with brilliant red and black fruit and impressive tannins. The Nicolas Jay Willamette Valley is a focused wine, revealing a darker nose than the previous vintage, with black cherry and plum accented by hints of violet, dried herb and bay laurel. The palate is supported by a backbone of racy acidity which lingers long into the finish, and offers bright red fruit along with savory herbs, olive, and a saline edge.

name: Nicolas Perrin Ermitage 750ml
summary: Nicolas Perrin Ermitage 750ml

name: Nicosia  Sicilia Nero d'Avola 750 mL
summary: Nicosia  Sicilia Nero d'Avola 750 mL

name: Niepoort Vertente Red Blend 750ml
summary: Niepoort Vertente Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: A beautiful, deep ruby colour matches the wine’s expressive aromatics characterised by minerality as well as dark chocolate and fruits of the forest notes. The wood is well-integrated, providing some hints of smokiness and spice. Tightly structured, profound, with a good backbone, this wine is elegant and fine on the palate, with well-integrated tannins, balanced acidity and a long finish.

name: Nine North  Chasing Lions Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Nine North  Chasing Lions Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: Chasing Lions Cabernet Sauvignon is bright with ripe red cherries leaping out of the glass, complementing aromas of boysenberry and spicy red plum in the mouth. This juicy and inviting wine shows flavors of milk chocolate, sweet red berries and a slight oaky smokiness, all harmoniously blended in a matrix of soft and supple tannins. The delicate vanilla finish lingers long after the last sip is gone.
food_pairings: Enjoy this crowd pleasing wine with grilled hanger steak served with rosemary roasted potatoes and garlicky broccoli rabe.

name: Nine North Hullabaloo Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Nine North Hullabaloo Zinfandel 750ml
tasting_notes: The Hullabaloo displays classic Zinfandel characteristics of fresh cracked pepper, raspberries, black cherries and briery fruit. Full-bodied with plush textures and good acidity as well as a nice mouthfeel, this classic well structured Zinfandel will drin
food_pairings: We love this zinfandel with a pan-seared duck breast with red wine demi glace.... Mm!

name: Nk'Mip Cellars Merlot 750 mL
summary: Nk'Mip Cellars Merlot 750ml

name: Nk'Mip Cellars Talon Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Nk'Mip Cellars Talon Red Blend 750ml

name: Noble Vines 181 Merlot 750 mL
summary: 181 Wine Cellars Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: It opens with aromas of black cherry, vanilla and toasty spice. Fresh fruit flavors of currant and cherry mingle gently with spicy cedar and vanilla. The wine is supple in texture, full bodied, long and well-balanced on the palate, with a lingering finish.
food_pairings: With a gentle balance of tannins and acidity, it is the perfect companion to pasta with sausage and roasted peppers or a pan seared steak with mushrooms and parsley.

name: Noble Vines 242  Sauvignon Blanc 750 mL
summary: Noble Vines 242 Wine Cellars Sauvignon Blanc 750 mL

name: Noble Vines 337 Wine Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: 337 Wine Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Noble Vines 667 Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Delicato  667 Monterey Pinot Noir 750ml
tasting_notes: Elegance of French and the ripe fruit characters of a California Pinot!  This Pinot Noir offers a modern expression of the classic French style: the smooth, rich mouthfeel is framed with gentle tannins and luscious cherry, black pepper and floral notes.
food_pairings: Enjoy with grilled salmon, hearty French beef stew or soft cheeses.

name: Norton Reserva  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Norton Reserva  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Norton Reserva  Malbec 750 mL
summary: Norton Reserva  Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: This has a silky mouthfeel, with rich, plush flavors of boysenberry, dark currant and black olive that carry plenty of creamy accents. Features dark chocolate and Asian spice details on the finely textured finish.

name: Nugan Estate Alfredo Dried Grape Shiraz 750ml
summary: Nugan Estate Alfredo Dried Grape Shiraz 750ml

name: Nugan Estate Stomper's Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
summary: Nugan Estate Stomper's Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Oak Ridge Winery  OZV Old Vine Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Oak Ridge Winery  OZV Old Vine Zinfandel 750ml

name: Obikwa  Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Obikwa  Shiraz 750 mL

name: Obikwa Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Obikwa Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: This Cabernet Sauvignon is a full-bodied, ruby coloured wine. Very fruit-forward and filled with red berries and cherries on the palate.
food_pairings: This red gem is one you'll want to enjoy with poultry, veal and any other red meat dish. Drink it around a dinner table or on a date - it's a wine for all occasions!

name: Ochoa Calendas Tinto Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Ochoa Calendas Tinto Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: Vivid and slightly purplish in colour, reflecting its youth. The nose combines the red berry aromas of the Grenache with the tannic structure of the Tempranillo. Fruity flavours of strawberry and raspberry thanks to the outstanding ripeness of the grapes.
food_pairings: Great wine to enjoy with meat, fish in sauce or cold meats and cheeses.

name: Open Wines Cabernet Merlot 750 mL

name: Open Wines Smooth Red Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Open Smooth Red 750 mL
tasting_notes: Medium ruby; bright aromas of crushed red berry fruit, plum and wood spice; the palate shows some sweetness and a medium body, powered by juicier red fruit, hints of spice and vanilla and soft tannins.

name: Opera Prima Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: A great wine, expressing many varietal characteristics for a Cabernet Sauvignon. With its intense aromas of balsamic and spice with flavours of bright red fruit on the palate. Fruity and smooth! Enjoy this Spanish red on its own with red meat or rich pasta dishes.
tasting_notes: On the nose it has an intense fruity aroma, red berries and currants, characteristic of the variety which combines with spice nuances. On the mouth shows an adequate balanced between alcohol, acidity and sugar, which it emphasizes with notes of balsamic on the finish. This Cabernet Sauvignon is medium bodied with bright fruity flavours.
food_pairings: Try this bright and fruity red with red meat, rich pasta dishes, charcuterie or just enjoy it on its own.

name: Orin Swift  Locations CA Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift  Locations CA Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Opaque with ruby accents, the wine is intensely perfumed with aromas of vivid berry, warm spice, plum, kirsch, lavender and subtle oak nuances.  The entry is juicy and penetrating with rich flavors of ripe blackberry, racy currant and blueberry that generously coat the palate.  Easy drinking, the finish is long and clean with just the right amount of polished tannins to keep the fruit in focus.  Extremely well-balanced, this delicious red is ready to open and drink now.

name: Orin Swift  Locations I Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift  Locations I Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: A vast array of aromas escape the glass - black cherry, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cured meat which are complemented by shades of sandalwood, vanilla, balsa and evergreen. The entry is silky smooth with a textured mid-palate of velvety fig, blueberry jam and soft oak. A hint of sea salt on the finish is rounded out with a mouthfeel that fades slowly.

name: Orin Swift  Machete Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift  Machete Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Violet ink in the glass, a nose of black plums, cassis, and cacao engage. The robust entry consists of a progressing palate of blackberry and boysenberry compote, a reduction of dark plum and ripe figs, and pure Amarena cherry. Flashes of vanilla and traces of minerality evolve into chalky tannins and a smooth lingering finish.

name: Orin Swift  Slander  Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift  Slander  Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: An elegant nose presents, with complex aromatics of ripe cherries and dried rose petals, a touch of white pepper and a hint of alpine forest. Balanced and integrated, the palate comprises of sweet strawberries, cranberries, and traces of rhubarb. The wine closes at length with a finish of toasted brioche, a dash of caramel and fresh raspberries.

name: Orin Swift Abstract Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift Abstract 750ml
tasting_notes: Expansive aromas of ripe red fruits, raspberries, bing cherries and strawberries, and a touch of Boysen and huckleberries open the nose. The aromas continue on to the palate with added layers of charred meat, rhubarb and thyme, surrounding a dark fruit core. Smooth, enveloping and lasting, the wine finishes with a pleasing Maraschino cherry note.

name: Orin Swift Palermo Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift  Palermo Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

name: Orin Swift Papillon Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift Papillon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Dark garnet in the glass, this wine is highly aromatic with notes of ripe black cherry, anise, licorice, shaved dark chocolate, rosemary and charred meat. The entry is immense with bright raspberries and fresh cherries, transitioning to a mid-palate of amaretto, sandalwood and hints of high mountain forest and coastal scrub. Textured tannins and notes of toasted coconut round out the palate as the wine finishes with lingering sweet oak.

name: Orofino Winery Red Bridge Red  750 mL
summary: Orofino Red Bridge Red 750mL

Intense fruit, bright acid and sturdy tannins promise resilience and longevity.

Bright acidity provides an energetic note that supports the rich flavors while adding length and focus to the finish.

name: Penfolds  Grange 10/11 Bin 95 Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Penfolds  Grange 09/10 Bin 95 Shiraz 750 mL
tasting_notes:
The nose on the Penfolds Grange is Intense. With an immediate barrel-ferment propulsion – sweet and candied, with a peaty, iodine, green olive base. Beneath this, a barely-concealed swirl of Vegemite/yeast extract/concentrated salt-paste - laced with paprika, oregano flower and thyme. A slurry of cocoa powder, a scented waft of black pudding, and a splash of nori-roll/sea-spray temporarily balance this aromatic equation
With a dense, paste-like texture and weight the Palate unleashes a balsamic liveliness, tannins focus on the roof of the mouth, laden with an additional film of (85% cacao) dark chocolate, mocha. A mix of quince and sesame-paste laden with basted meats and saturated stewed plum, boysenberry, blueberry. Tightly bound – wait for decompression! Complete, Confident, Convincing.

name: Penfolds  Max's  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml

name: Penfolds 11/12 RWT  Shiraz 750 mL
summary: "What if we made Grange with French oak instead of American oak”, was the question. “Let’s test it out” said John Duval, the Chief Winemaker at Penfolds in 1995. Thus was born “Red Wine Trial”, which Penfolds decided was far too romantic and shortened to RWT when the first vintage was released in 2000. RWT is like Christian Slater in Heathers, not easy to make friends with initially but things get real interesting if you actually do. Bordeaux is clearly the guiding light here, structure currently holds sway over fruit (and may always), but the muscle and timeless frame are bulletproof and the spicy vanilla, cherry notes over earthen game almost trick you into thinking this is going to be subtle. It ain’t. Of all 3 vintages the 2011 is the most Bordelais, elegant and drinkable, the 2013 carries the most bullets. - Jordan Carrier, Vintage Room Consultant.
tasting_notes:
Ascending florals, primarily violet (laced with pepper) harmoniously project alongside wafts of white chocolate/cocoa powder. Fruitfully aromatic – easily identifiable red-currant and satsuma plum, with fleshy harder-to-reveal cranberry/elderberry/mulberry. Scents of cedary French oak and pink peppercorn/spice artefact aligned with pan scrapings/balsamic – such a ‘glaze’ possibly derived from its Penfolds élevage/racking regimen?
No overt barrel-ferment characters apparent.  Perhaps swamped by depth of fruit (black cherry), mocha, chestnut, aniseed and other derivatives? A spoil of charcuterie delights, primarily cold meats (‘raw’/carpaccio), shadow the more reticent panforte and cola notes that ever so slowly appear with aeration. A textural leaning towards velour/satin – a veneered smoothness, rather than a plush or penetrating mouthfeel – allied by velvety, rather than grainy tannins.

summary: Penfolds Bin 389  Cabernet Shiraz  750 ml
tasting_notes: An instant allure, an inviting and tempting aromatic advance. Firstly, scents of freshly baked bread and dressed Black Forest Cake, replete with dark chocolate and assorted berries, cherries. Then aromas of bread and butter pudding/nut loaf, adorned with
food_pairings: Ideal with hearty meat dishes like Agrentinean style beef or a rare roasted rack of lamb with garlic, rosemary and sea salt.

name: Powell & Son Barossa & Eden Valleys Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Our Vintage room consultant Jordan Carrier was fortunate enough to have the opportunity to speak with the producers about this fantastic Australian Shiraz. "To hear Dave Powell explain how he was kicked out of Torbreck, the winery he founded, is to experience a masterclass in Australian profanity, after our meeting I had to check our building’s foundations for fissures. At Torbreck, Dave made Australia’s first 100pt Parker wine, but since he owned no land, he built handshake relationships with all of Barossa’s Old Vine growers to build his reputation. I’m not sure what Torbreck makes wine from now, because all of those growers (and their fruit) followed Dave to his new winery he founded with his son Callum (who works half the year in Hermitage with J.L. Chave). This blend of ripe Barossa fruit contained by the fresh brightness of Eden valley is stunning, deep spicy dark fruits with Earl Grey and crushed rocks and herbs – a hauntingly pretty nose – followed by a rolling body and a finish that is both intense and almost weightless (the younger Powell’s Rhone influences show here)."
tasting_notes: The Powell & Son Barossa & Eden Valley Shiraz is a wine which displays an intense perfume of black fruits, anise and violets, preceding a dense, seductive palate of dark fruits and smoked meats backed by firm tannins and an assertive acid structure.

name: Primi Soli Sangiovese 750 mL
summary: The Sangiovese grape has a long and noble tradition in Italian wine making. This wine is fresh and vibrant with a subtly spicy palate and notes of fresh strawberry on the long finish.
tasting_notes: A fresh and vibrant wine, on the nose are aromas of red berries leading to flavours of strawberry and red currant with underlying notes of spice.
food_pairings: A great entertaining wine that is the perfect partner to some thin crust Italian Pizza, tomato based pasta dishes, roast chicken or a platter of hard cheeses.

name: Primordial Soup Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A rich and bloody bouillabaisse of the Western Cape’s classical cultivars, packed with juicy life, red in tooth and claw. A great food wine that compliments a wide range of foods including steak and chips or bangers and mash.
tasting_notes: A rich and bloody bouillabaisse of the Western Cape’s classical cultivars, packed with juicy life, red in tooth and claw. It has a nose of creamy summer pudding and a palate of crushed cherries with a cranberry tang and texture. It’s the Natural Selection.
food_pairings: A fantastic match to a huge variety of dishes from steak and chips, bangers and mash, juicy pink sunday roast, to beef stirfry.

summary: Pulpoloco Sangria 250 mL

name: Punti Ferrer The Winemaker's Secret Barrels Red Blend 1.0 L
summary: Punti Ferrer The Winemaker's Secret Barrels Red Blend 1.0 L
tasting_notes: Intense and clean brilliant red color with ruby highlights. Lively red fruit notes of berries, cherry and red plums that blend perfectly with the oaky notes from the barrels. In a very subtle and balanced manner, the toffee and vanilla blend beautifully with the red fruit jam character. It is a wine of soft and round tannins, very fruit forward with a good balance with the oak, juicy with a long, soft and balanced finish.
food_pairings: Pairs superbly with red meats, pasta dishes and all types of cheese.

tasting_notes: A classic Malbec, but undoubtedly Layer Cake. Big, brooding, black fruit, then rich earth, truffles and dark cocoa are at the front. The Sea of Stones vineyard is at its core, always evident with the thread of minerality that the deep alluvial cobblestone
food_pairings: Just sip this. If you must pair it, it's definitely waiting for a well-marbled steak!

name: Pure Love Wines  Layer Cake Primitivo 750 mL

name: Purple Cowboy  Tenacious Red Cabernet/Syrah 750 mL
summary: Purple Cowboy Tenacious Red Cabernet/Syrah 750 mL
tasting_notes: Teeth-staining dark red with hints of purple. Vibrant aromas of crushed red berries and cherries, notes of cola and cinnamon, and a hint of earthiness. Berry flavors explode in the mouth with cinnamon and cassis in the mid-palate leading to slight cocoa powder tannins on the finish. A very rich, full-bodied style.
food_pairings: A cowboy wine for cowboy fare! Enjoy with the traditional cowboy dish of Paso Robles is Tri-Tip of beef, grilled over a red oak fire, and served with baked beans, garlic bread and a green salad.

name: Quilceda Creek  Columbia Valley  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Quilceda Creek  Columbia Valley  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: An absolutely amazing wine. Packed to the brim with floral aromas and flavors of blackberry, blueberry, black cherry and plum fruit intertwine with nuances of cacao nib, anise, soy, forest floor and minerals. Incredibly pure and complex, this richly textured wine is totally seamless in all of its parts, allowing for its silky texture to shine through on the palate with a finish that last for minutes.

name: Quinta do Crasto  Douro Superior Red blend 750 mL
summary: Quinta do Crasto  Douro Superior Red blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Bright purple in colour, with attractive aromas of fresh wild berry fruit and elegant notes of spices. Balanced on the palate, evolving into a wine with a serious backbone, excellent volume and a fine texture made of velvety tannins. This is a captivating wine, with a fresh and lingering finish.

name: R Wines  Skulls Shiraz 750 mL
summary: R Wines  Skulls Shiraz 750 mL
tasting_notes: A deeply coloured, monster of a wine packed with bold red and black fruit aromas with a touch of licorice and vanilla. The palate is dense with floral, smoky oak, vanilla and spice with firm tannins.  If you like huge, concentrated, heat-packing reds, this could be up your alley.

name: Ravenswood  Vintners Blend Zinfandel 750 mL

This dry, full-bodied and woody red displays a complex and intense nose. 
On the palate, its refreshing acidity, fleshy tannins, and full-bodied texture precede a long finish.

name: Raymond Generations 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Raymond Generations Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Raymond Napa Valley Generations Cabernet Sauvignon is a striking dark ruby color in the glass and opens with intriguing aromas of blackberry and mocha that are interlaced with coffee and mineral notes. This is a classically dry wine that displays flavors of blackberry and both red and black currants that are enhanced by a touch of black cherry, ripe tannins and a long, lingering finish. Enjoy this wine over the next 5 to 10 years.

name: Raymond R Collection  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Raymond R Collection is an elegant Cabernet Sauvignon, not overly rich or full bodied but wit beautiful, ripe and juicy fruit flavours. A great wine to pair with food why not try it with penne pasta with feta. This wine involved a number of great women, Stephanie Putnam: Director of Winemaking, Raymond Vineyards. Sophie Drucker, Vineyard Manager, Raymond Vineyards and Kathy George: Assistant Winemaker, Raymond Vineyards
tasting_notes: R Collection Cabernet Sauvignon opens with striking aromas of bright red fruits and cloves complimented with subtle notes of blueberry and white pepper. Flavors of rhubarb, plum, and raspberry are highlighted with a touch of vanilla and cocoa on the finish.
food_pairings: Beautifully balanced, the R Collection Cabernet Sauvignon displays well-integrated tannins and pairs perfectly with pork tenderloin or filet mignon.

name: Red Rooster Winery Merlot 750 mL
summary: Red Rooster Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: This Rooster is sleek, suave and seductive, with an easygoing youthful approach.  His aromatic presence reveals black cherry, smoke, charred oak barrel, leather and sweet spice.  This dry, medium-bodied Merlot has soft tannins and flavours of juicy black cherry, plum and currant.  Plenty of ripe red and black fruit notes with a dash of spice linger through on the drying finish.
food_pairings: Excellent with grilled steak and sautéed mushrooms; duck breast in a red wine reduction; pheasant; beef tenderloin; prime rib; two year old Canadian cheddar with walnut breads.

Concentrated flavors of brambly red raspberry, dried cranberry and dusty cocoa followed by hints of black tea and dark cherry. Round on the palate, the tannins are well polished with a silky mouthfeel and beautifully framed by the wine’s natural acidity and juiciness.

tasting_notes: Rich, complex and persistent nose. Hints of dried plumes, dark chocolate and Mediterranean herbs. Opulent mouth feel yet very elegant. Great ageing potential.
food_pairings: This is a wine for those who love that concentrated luscious style and it's flavour intensity makes it an ideal partner to serve with mamma's spicy pasta with meatballs or a hearty lasagna.

name: San Gregorio  Serpico  Red Blend 750 mL
summary:
Serpico is the critically acclaimed signature wine of Feudi Di San Gregorio. Sorbo Serpico is about an hour’s drive from Naples and Mount Vesuvius. It’s the unique volcanic, sandstone and marly soil of this area that lends the wines their tell-tale aromas of cherry, cinnamon and aniseed. It’s a complex wine bursting with cherry jam, sweet spices, liquorice, coffee and cocoa notes balanced with a beautiful spicy minerality
.
tasting_notes: Intense, persistent bouquet of rich wild cherries, toasted oak and warm vanilla and cocoa. The palate is soft, dense and well balanced. The finish is long and pleasant, with flavours of red berries against a smooth background of toast and spice.
food_pairings: Well-matched with roasted meat, game and aged cheeses.

name: Sandpoint Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Velvety molasses-rich California Cabernet brimming with blackcurrant aromas and classic smoky cedar and plum flavours!
tasting_notes: Velvety molasses-rich California Cabernet brimming with blackcurrant aromas and classic smoky cedar and plum flavours. Complex, concentrated and delicious, this is a lingering, fruity red, with a bite of acidity and tantalising hints of chocolate.
food_pairings: Its rugged smoky nuances will taste fabulous with gamey pheasant, grouse and even venison casseroles!

name: Sandpoint Merlot 750 mL
summary: This Merlot is an approachable wine opening with fresh picked cherry notes and a hint of spice.
tasting_notes: This Merlot is an approachable wine opening with fresh picked cherry notes and a hint of spice. Dominant flavours of bright cherry and vibrant raspberry come together with toasty oak and light chocolate to create a juicy, plush wine with soft tannins. It is a true fruit driven wine that is straightforward and easy to enjoy.

summary: Santa Carolina Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Full bodied and concentrated, bursting with blackcurrant fruit flavours, cassis and hints of cedar wood on the long velvety finish.
food_pairings: This wine is a good match with tomato based pasta sauces, especially Bolognese and red meat dishes.

name: Santa Ema Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Lovely aromas of currants, wild blueberries, both just on the point of ripeness, similar to that perfect piece of fruit!
tasting_notes: Deep violet to ruby-red in colour, this Cabernet Sauvignon is elegant, sophisticated, and complex with fruity notes that blend cherries, prunes, tobacco, and roasted coffee. Santa Ema Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is well-rounded and very well structured with ripe tannins and plenty of texture. It has a long finish.

name: Santa Margherita Chianti Classico 750 mL
summary: Elegant and complex, Santa Margherita Chianti Classico Riserva has fruit and spice flavors that follow through to darker fruits and mellow herbal notes, great to pair with a beef roast.
tasting_notes: The aromas of this complex red wine range from cherries and plums to gladiolus flowers and earthy flint. The tannic, oak-aged flavors are bright and round, with a dry, warm, earthy finish.
food_pairings: Best enjoyed with very flavorful dishes, such as tomato-based sauces, mushroom ravioli, beef or pork roasts, and game meats from venison to pheasant. It is also excellent with mature cheeses.

name: Santa Rita   Medalla Real  Carmenere 750 mL
summary: This wine offers the nose and palate an array of blueberry, plum and oak-softened cassis fruit, accented with intriguing coffee and dark chocolate aromas.
tasting_notes: Plush and full bodied, this wine offers the nose and palate an array of blueberry, plum and oak-softened cassis fruit, accented with intriguing coffee and dark chocolate aromas.
food_pairings: Will stand up well to steaks, as well as something a little gamier, such as pot roasted rabbit or duck.

name: Santa Rita  120 Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Part of the popular 120 range from Santa Rita winery which are named after the historic event in which 120 soldiers took refuge in Santa Rita’s cellars in 1814 during the fight for Chile’s independence. This is fabulous Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon and one of our customer favourites, red and black fruit are dominant with a touch of spice distinctive of this variety intermingled with aromas of vanilla and clove. Try it with red meat or spicy sausage.
tasting_notes: An intensive red violet wine, on the nose red and black fruit are dominant with a touch of spice distinctive of this variety which is intermingled with aromas of vanilla, clove and tobacco from the wood used in the production process. On the palate this Cabernet Sauvignon is well-rounded, with sweet, elegant tannins that remain strong providing a juicy, fresh and lingering finish.
food_pairings: A wonderful wine to accompany red meat, pork, spicy sausage or cheese soufflés.

name: Santa Rita  120 Merlot 750 mL
summary: Santa Rita 120 Merlot 750 ml

name: Santa Rita  Heroes Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: This medium bodied Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of ripe red berries and notes of wild herbs and tomato leaf. On the palate it is fruity and fresh with flavours of cherry and raspberry.
tasting_notes: A deep and intense violet-red in color. Notes of red and black fruits predominate on the nose with the touch of spice that is typical in Cabernet, plus the aromas of vanilla, cloves, and tobacco that come from the oak. Sweet, elegant, and smooth tannins lend depth to the well-rounded palate and lead to a fresh, fruity, and juicy finish.
food_pairings: A fresh and fruity wine that the perfect partner to beef tenderloin with chimichurri sauce, a duck cassoulet, some vegetarian chili or grilled and herbed bell peppers!

name: Secret Indulgence American Vintage 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: From renowned winemaker Katie Carter for the Boisset Collection. Secret Indulgence American Vintage Red Blend is aged for 16 months in French, Hungarian and American Oak, this wine bursts with of flavours of dark berries. A beautiful balance of Zinfandel ripeness and Petite Sirah depth.
tasting_notes: This rich, dark, dense wine presents as dark purple-red in the glass. The bold, jammy, ripeness of the Zinfandel is well balanced with the blue-black notes of the Petite Sirah. On the nose, you are greeted with the essence of blackberry pie, black cherry, graphite and a hint of herbaceousness. On the palate, this wine is inky and thick while maintaining brightness and balance. Notes of marionberry, bramble and a hint of black pepper coat your mouth in an assertive, rich and lingering way.
food_pairings: Pairs well with smoked barbeque ribs or frog legs vol au vent.

name: Secret Indulgence Chronology 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Secret Indulgence Chronology Red is a beautiful blend of Bordeaux and Rhône varietals, this wine features rich notes of black currant and cacao. Aged for 21 months in stainless steel and barrels.
tasting_notes: Chronology Red Wine is a unique union of Bordeaux and Rhône varietals, kissed by Angelica. Deep burgundy in color, you are greeted on the nose with notes of plum skin, strawberry and a hint of cinnamon. From the first sip, you find notes of black currant, strawberry, black tea and cacao nibs. Your palate will delight in the wide, rich texture of the Chronology.
food_pairings: Pairs well with cassoulet or BBQ short ribs.

name: See Ya Later Ranch  Major's Block Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Named in honor of the wineries outgoing and colourful founder, See Ya Later Ranch's Major's Block Red Blend enjoys full aromas of dark cherry, and stewed plums and luscious flavours of ripe raspberry and fresh cherry. Pairs perfectly with peppercorn steak or a prime rib.
tasting_notes: Full aromas of dark cherry, some stewed plums, vanilla spice, and mocha undertones. Luscious flavours of ripe raspberry, fresh cherry, baking spices, and vanilla. Soft tannins and gentle acidity with a medium to long finish.
food_pairings: Major's Block pairs perfectly with peppercorn steak, prime rib, rare to medium-rare barbecued meats, lamb, venison and aged cheese.

name: See Ya Later Ranch  Rover Shiraz/Viognier 750 mL
summary: The See Ya Later Ranch Rover Shiraz Viognier, with its pleasant aromas of perfumy flowers and delicate spice, earthy and fruity flavours is a great wine from the Okanagan Valley and compliments a range of foods such as Italian cuisine or a chunky pulled pork sandwich.
tasting_notes: Pleasant aromas of perfumy flowers intermingled with spiced ripe cherries - there is a slightly peppery note to the nose that sits over the dark chocolate and vanilla notes. The palate shows delicate spice and earthiness entwined with ripe red fruits. Medium tannins and medium acidity with a relatively long finish.
food_pairings: Slow-cooked beef roasts, Spanish tapas, Italian cuisine, pulled pork sandwiches with peach barbecue sauce and fresh slaw, lamb with apricot and walnut stuffing, and braised short ribs.

name: See Ya Later Ranch Ping Meritage Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A great red blend from one of British Columbia's cracking Okanagan Valley estates, the See Ya Later Ranch Ping Red Blend has aromas of cassis, cherry, red plum, smokey oak, some vanilla and mocha notes and pairs beautifully with red meat such as roast beef or a t-bone steak.
tasting_notes: Aromas of cassis, cherry, red plum, smokey oak, some vanilla and mocha notes.  Flavours of red fruits with a hint of earthiness and vanilla.  Semi firm tannins which feel luscious on the palate. Medium acidity to balance the fruit shows up on the long finish.
food_pairings: Pair with roast beef, T-bone steak, grilled lamb, meatball pasta and bold cheese such as sharp cheddar, parmesano reggiano, and asiago.

name: See Ya Later Ranch Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: This lovely Pinot Noir from the See Ya Later ranch in British Columbia's Okanagan Valley is as full of character as the estate that produced it. With lots of ripe strawberry and red cherry on the nose this is a well integrated wine with a medium finish, great with some BC Salmon or a mushroom risotto.
tasting_notes: Lots of ripe strawberry and red cherry on the nose with a hint of mocha and baking spice. The palate is full of the same ripe strawberries and cherries, and there is also a hint of confectionery flavours as well. The tannins are well integrated with a soft acidity, and the medium finish has flavours that linger.
food_pairings: Lemon-herbed salmon fillet grilled on a cedar plank, rosemary lamb chops, peppered pork ribs, BBQ vegetable or shrimp skewers, and wild mushroom risotto.

summary: Seven Directions Bottega Merlot 750 mL

summary: Shafer Vineyards One Point Five 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
tasting_notes: Bright, energetic aromas and flavors of fresh black cherry, black plum right from the tree, pomegranate, wet slate, peppercorn, lavender, and savory herbs. The flavors have long, beautiful length in the mouth and the wine’s classic Stags Leap District tannins offer structure and promise for delicious things to come in the cellar.

summary: Shot in the Dark  Shiraz, Petite Sirah 750ml
tasting_notes: A glassful of rich, smoky, ripe fruit flavours.  It's round, warm, glossy and a touch on the sweet New World side.
food_pairings: Delicious with game-y meats and an ol fashioned seared peppercorn new york strip!

name: Sierra Cantabria Rioja Crainza 750 mL
summary: Sierra Cantabria Rioja Crainza 750 mL
tasting_notes: 100% Tempranillo, this chewy red has firm tannins and toasty, smoky oak flavors, which overshadow modest black cherry and blackberry notes. A leafy note keeps the finish fresh. Drink now through 2013.

name: Silk & Spice Red Blend 2016 750 mL
summary: Created from a blend of grapes across multiple Protuguese wine regions, this full bodied wine has been specifically crafted  for the North American market with its big, rich and fruit forward style.
tasting_notes: A Intense ruby colored red wine blend, characterized by intense aromas of ripe red and black fruit, such as blackberries and ripe plum. The spicy character if this wine comes from the vanilla, black pepper and pink peppercorn, combined with hints mocha. A full-bodied wine with a balanced taste, very soft tannins and a long and balanced finish.
food_pairings: Silk&Spice it’s a perfect pairing for meat dishes such as barbecued or roasted lamb rack and pork ribs. Spicy dishes like curry will enhance the character of this intense wine.

name: Silver Heights The Last Warrior Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Silver Heights The Last Warrior Red Blend 750 mL

name: Silver Oak  Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Silver Oak Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml

name: Silver Oak Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Silver Oak Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 750 ml
tasting_notes: Displaying an opaque garnet color and bouquet driven by fruity aromas of blackberry liqueur and hoisin sauce the Silver Oak Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon also offers the savory components of sage and molasses. These complex aromatics are complemented by sandalwood and nutmeg characteristics indicative of American oak aging. A truly well-structured wine with a compact and rich mid-palate that is buttressed by silky tannins and generous acidity. Given proper cellaring, this wine will provide drinking pleasure through 2037.
food_pairings: With a focus on producing food friendly wines there is an extensive range of meals that would pair perfectly with this wine, to highlight just a few recommended by Silver Oaks own chefs for the Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon why not try it with Bistecca alla Fiorentina, some buttermilk fried quail, cherry BBQ ribs or cirtus-brined pork chops.

name: Silver Palm  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Silver Sage Winery Merlot 750 mL
summary: Hot days and warm  nights at Silver Sage yield rich, intensely flavourful fruit. A medium-bodied red wine with blackberry characteristics and a soft, dry finish. Minimum oak extraction makes this wine an excellent companion for red meat dishes or pasta, and very pleasing on its own. Rich, smooth, velvety

name: Silver Sage Winery The Passion Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Unique in style and complexity, medium-bodied, oak-aged with a good fruit balance. Silver Sage Wineries The Passion Pinot Noir has a wild cherry aroma and is a must alongside a prime rib dinner.

tasting_notes: This Merlot exhibits classic raspberry and cherry characters with a touch of vanilla and toast on the smooth finish.
food_pairings: This lush, pleasurable Merlot pairs perfectly with grilled salmon or a flavorful pasta.

name: Stimson Estate Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Stimson Estate Cellars by Chateau Ste Michelle  Cabernet Sauvignon 750mL
tasting_notes: This enjoyable Cabernet showcases aromas of red fruits and toast with a hint of sweet spice. The wine is soft and balanced with flavors of cherries, blueberries and toast.
food_pairings: Enjoy this Cabernet with meatloaf or a grilled sirloin burger.

tasting_notes: The Monument Ridge conveys aromas and flavours of dried blackberry leaves, juniper, cardamom, wild red berries, black pepper, and wet, black slate. The mouthfeel is defined by firm and elegant tannins with a distinct concentration, dark chocolate finish a
food_pairings: This Cab is grown in the higher hills and as a result, is a much lighter California cab than you might think. It carries enough weight to pair with any lighter meats off of the grill, such as chicken or pork, and would be outstanding with a little dark ch

name: Straccali DOCG  Chianti 750ml
summary: Straccali DOCG  Chianti 750ml

name: Sumac Ridge  Private Reserve Cabernet Merlot 750 mL
summary: Sumac Ridge Private Reserve Cab Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: Look for black and red fruit notes, hints of sage and a lovely, grapey quality that doesn't quit. A good wine to have on hand for burger night or casual dining.

name: Sumac Ridge  Private Reserve Merlot 750 mL
summary: Sumac Ridge Private Reserve Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: Abundant aromas of dark plum and blackberry with some subtle oak and vanilla spice. Flavours of dark, rich fruits and baking spices with a finish of smooth milk chocolate. The tannins are very approachable and the acidity is well-balanced, with a medium-length finish.
food_pairings: Pairing suggestions include grilled lamb, barbecue ribs, thick cut ribeye steak and hearty pastas. Create a tasty cheese plate with Canadian Swiss, Havarti and Smoked Cheddar.

name: Sumac Ridge Private Reserve Ridge Red 750 mL
summary: Sumac Ridge Ridge Red Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: Rich and medium bodied, this wine has red berry aromas and hints of vanilla, spice and floral notes on the palate.  Balanced by the soft tannins, the residual sweetness on the finish ties it all together.
food_pairings: From enjoying a picnic lunch on the patio to barbecuing steaks and burgers, Ridge Red is perfect for any occasion

name: Summerhill Estate Winery Organic Pinot Noir  750 mL
summary: Summerhill Estate Winery Organic Pinot Noir 2010 750ml
food_pairings: Very versatlle.Pairs especially well with grilled foods: white and red meats, salmon, and veggies.

summary: Summerhill Estate Winery Spadefoot Toad Syrah 750ml

name: Synchromesh Wines  Turtle Rock Farms Tertre Rouge 750 mL
summary: Synchromesh Wines Inc. Tertre Rouge 750 mL
tasting_notes: Brooding dark fruit complexity with brambly sarsaparilla and sweet pea and a fine grained long finish.

name: Tablas Creek Vineyard Esprit de Tablas 2015 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The Tablas Creek Vineyard Esprit de Tablas is a blend of four estate-grown varietals, propagated from budwood cuttings from the Château de Beaucastel estate. The wine is based on the dark red fruit, earth, spice and mid-palate richness of Mourvèdre, with additions of Grenache for forward fruit, approachability and lushness, Syrah for mineral, aromatics, and back-palate tannins, and Counoise for brambly spice and acidity.
tasting_notes: The Esprit de Tablas has an inviting nose of warm berry compote, given complexity by sun-drenched bay leaf and newly turned earth: Mourvedre at its most appealing. The mouth is lush and dense, with big but refined tannins, and flavors of licorice, blackberry, and cedar. Mourvedre's characteristic meatiness is in the background at this point, but just waiting for a few years in bottle to emerge. Alternatingly bright and deep on the finish, with lingering flavors of wood smoke, plum skin and spice.

name: Table Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: This medium boded red has lovely cherry and plum aromas. The delicate tannin structure makes it smooth on the palate with hints of berries and ripe dark fruit flavours. Serve with Roasted beef or try it with a meat lover’s pizza!
tasting_notes: Deep red  ripe berry aromas with a hint of vanilla. The fruit flavours follow through on the palate, creating a smooth, perfectly balanced wine.
food_pairings: Great accompaniment to poultry, veal and red meat dishes.

name: Tait Ball Buster  Red 750 mL
summary: Tait Ball Buster  Red 750 mL
tasting_notes: Opaque purple-coloured, it offers up a fragrant perfume of pencil lead, licorice, spice box, blueberry, and blackberry liqueur. Layered, savory, and long on the palate, this well-balanced, pleasure-bent effort will drink well for another 4-6 years.

name: Tanguero  Malbec 750 mL
summary: Sourced in Argentina from the Barrancas region in southern Maipú, Mendoza, Tanguero Malbec boasts aromas of fresh red fruits and a hint of oak. On the palate it is a typical varietal flavours with a long finish. Great with roasted lamb.
tasting_notes: This wine is a Deep ruby red with violet hues with aromas of fresh red fruits - plums and cherries - and a hint of oak. On the palate it is a typical varietal flavours of red fruits and vanilla with some floral notes and ripe tannins. The finish is long,
food_pairings: Pair this Malbec with roasted lamb, BBQ duck or beef stew. Great party, BBQ or Wedding Wine.

name: Tedeschi  Amarone Della Valpolicella 2012 750 mL
summary: Tedeschi  Amarone Della Valpolicella 2009 750 ml
tasting_notes: Toasty, spicy and rich, this dark coloured Amarone shows notes of cinnamon and worn wood, leading to a huge body and a powerful finish.
food_pairings: Pairs with beef, veal and spicy sausage, as well as blue cheese or cheddar. Needs decanting.

name: Tenuta di Arceno  Valdorna Toscana 750 mL
summary: Tenuta di Arceno  Valdorna Toscana 750ml
tasting_notes: Valadorna shows a dark core of ruby color with a very thin ruby meniscus. On the nose, concentrated and condensed smells of black cherry liquor, ripe black & red plum, and dried cranberry mark this wine as a ripe expression of Toscana IGT, while non-fruits of dried herbs, camphor, rose petal, and toasted baking spices add an aromatic lift. Each of these flavors is confirmed on the palate, with additional nuances of melted cocoa, toasted bread, and subtle quinine. Though driven with opulent fruit, the wine’s texture is balanced by firm Tuscan acidity, and bitter tannins, which are in control of the overall picture. The finish is balanced and mouth watering, with wet clay minerality.

name: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Il Bruciato  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Tenuta Guado Al Tasso Il Bruciato  Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: A blend of Cabernet, Merlot and Syrah by famous Italian winery Antinori. This Bolgheri DOC wine brings a tremendous nose with barnyard and dark red fruit in compote.  The medium-plus body reveals high acidity which is balanced by an impressive array of fl

name: The Crusher  Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml
summary:
This Cabernet Sauvignon is vibrant, juicy and smoky, aromas of wild strawberry, dark cherry and a hint of teriyaki intermingle to produce a sweet and savory character. Expressive on the palate with flavours of maraschino cherry, toffee and black walnut.
Pair with a grilled porterhouse and mashed potatoes, tomato and mozzarella bruschetta or simply your favourite barbeque recipe.

food_pairings: If it was perfectly okay to drink wine at Breakfast so as to substitute your coffee, this would be it!  So we'll pair this up with brunch or serve this as a late night sipper to go with some cheeses as a dessert.

name: The Hatch Screaming Frenzy Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: The Hatch Screaming Frenzy Pinot Noir 750 mL
tasting_notes: A racy, sexy, seductive BC pinot noir with aromas of fleshy ripe cherry, dark spice and smoke. Medium- to almost full-bodied with a satin-smooth texture.

name: The Hatch Talking Stories Red Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The Hatch Talking Stories Red 750ml
tasting_notes: A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this wine is big and delicious.

name: The Milkwood Shiraz Viognier 750 mL
summary: The Milkwood Shiraz Viognier 750 mL

name: The Path Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Aromas include blackberry, currants, dried herbs, forest floor, vanilla and cocoa. Focused juicy cherry fruit flavors complemented by red currant and toasted cedar notes. This medium-bodied wine packs a lot of flavour while showing superb clarity and an incredibly long finish. A great food wine with is core, food friendly acidity.
tasting_notes: Features aromas of dark raspberry, cranberry along with savory herbs and finishes of vanilla. Framed by French Oak, on the palate are flavours of tart cherry, fresh raspberry and pomegranate.
food_pairings: Medium-bodied, supported by a core of food friendly acidity, food pairings are a breeze. Pair with an appetizer of slow cooker kielbasa bites, mozzarella mushroom burgers or panko herb topped pork chops.

name: The Prisoner Wine Co. Saldo Zinfandel 750 mL
summary: Orin Swift Saldo Zinfandel 750 ml
tasting_notes: The 2010 Saldo has a dark ruby colour & intense aromas of dark cherry, cocoa powder & baking spice. The entry is rich & full, & leads into a broad mid palate with concentration & density, backed by lively acidity. The texture is soft & the tannins are pol

name: The Prisoner Wine Co. The Prisoner Red Blend 750 mL
summary: The Prisoner Wine Co. The Prisoner Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: A proprietary blend of Zinfandel, Petit Sirah and many more, Orin Swift’s iconic Prisoner is a big, sexy fruit bomb, with smoky licorice, blackberry cobbler and cracked pepper leading towards a big body and long finish.
food_pairings: Pairs with hamburgers, steaks and hard cheeses.

name: The Prisoner Wine Co. Thorn Merlot 750 mL
summary: The Prisoner Wine Co. Thorn Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: Earthy aromas open up into cocoa, blackberry, cedar, and anise. It’s smooth with flavors of cherry, chocolate, vanilla, and a mild toastiness. The finish is long with balanced acidity.

name: The Show Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: The Show Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: The Show Malbec 750 mL
summary: The Show Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: The Show Malbec is a delicious wine with flavors of blackberry, cranberry, white pepper and spice, with toasty vanilla and violets. The wine has smooth tannins, a velvety texture and a long, lingering finish.
food_pairings: Great with wood fired pizza and just about anything beefy and grilled on the BBQ!  Spectacular with smoked gouda and artisan French bread.

name: The Shy Pig Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Exclusive to Everything wine the Shy Pig Shiraz is a great value Australian red. With its flavours of dark fruit, plum and black pepper this is a great wine to pair with red meats and BBQ's or fruity enough to enjoy on its own.
tasting_notes: Fruit aromas of plum and blackberry are complemented by peppery spice and cinnamon undertones. The well balanced flavours flow through to the palate and come to life as the peppery spice is combined with the smooth plum and blackberry flavours. The firm tannins and influence of oak create good depth and great intensity of flavour.
food_pairings: Meat                                                A juicy Aussie Shiraz that pairs perfectly with barbequed or roasted red meat dishes.

name: The Walking Dead  Blood Red Blend 750 mL
summary: A wine to sink your teeth into, our Blood Red Blend drips with intense, bold flavor. Robust with unyielding character, notes of ripe raspberry, cranberry and cherry flesh out the structured tannins.

name: The Walking Dead  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: The Walking Dead  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Therapy Vineyards Freud's Ego  Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Therapy Vineyards Freud's Ego Red Blend 750ml

name: Thr3 Monkeys Fruity Red Tempranillo 750 mL
summary: Thr3 Monkeys Fruity Red Tempranillo 750 mL
tasting_notes: Thr3 Monkeys Fresh and fruity red wine is packed with a taste of red dark berries.
food_pairings: Pop the bottle open to the barbie, pizza or why not a grilled banana!

name: Three Saints Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: Three Saints Pinot Noir 750 mL

name: Three Thieves Pinot Noir 750 mL
summary: The perfect food-wine to pair with Beef Wellington, roast pork with herbs and fennel or hot turkey sandwiches.
tasting_notes: The Thieves believe that a great Pinot Noir is a reward unto itself. To craft a wine that showcases the varietal’s most beautiful qualities, the wine is gently fermented and infused with a touch of French and American oak to lend body and support to the bright cherry and berry flavours. For additional structure, a small amount of Syrah and Petite Sirah were included in the blend.
food_pairings: Chicken Pairingseafood-2                                                Good pairings: Roast chicken or guineafowl (even with lots of garlic as this post illustrates. Pigeon. Rack of lamb, served pink. Rare fillet steak and carpaccio. Beef Wellington. Roast pork with herbs and fennel. Chicken or turkey sandwiches. Calves liver, sweetbreads. Dishes with morels and other wild mushrooms. Mushroom risotto. Roast or grillled lobster

name: Tilia Bonarda 750 mL
summary: Tilia Bonarda 750 mL

name: Tilimuqui Organic Cabernet Sauvignon Bonarda 750 mL
summary: Suitable for vegetarians and vegans, this is a perfect choice for special get-togethers or just a cozy night in.
tasting_notes: Smooth with a medium bodied taste, this wine is made with hand-picked, organic grapes grown at high altitude. It is a delicious oak-aged blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (70%) and Bonarda (30%) and is bursting with juicy red berry and ripe plum flavours.

name: Timbuktu McLaren Vale Shiraz Cabernet 750 mL
summary: Timbuktu McLaren Vale Shiraz Cabernet 750 mL

name: Time Estate Winery  Merlot 750 mL
summary: Time Estate Winery  Merlot 750ml
tasting_notes: This wine is robust with classic aromas of plum, cherry, and blueberry. The palate is lush and rich, with a lengthy finish. Firm yet approachable tannins makes this an age-worthy wine.

name: Time Estate Winery HMC McWatters Collection Meritage 750 mL
summary: Harry McWatters Collection Meritage 750 mL

name: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards  Merlot 750 mL
summary: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards  Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: Opaque dark purplish red hue. Nose is rich with chocolate covered cherries, blueberries, leather and vanilla bean. Palate is dense with lots of fresh fruit, sweet oak that builds up the tannins and gives the wine great texture. Smooth and powerful.

name: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards  Merlot 750 mL
summary: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards  Merlot 750 mL
tasting_notes: Opaque dark purplish red hue. Nose is rich with chocolate covered cherries, blueberries, leather and vanilla bean. Palate is dense with lots of fresh fruit, sweet oak that builds up the tannins and gives the wine great texture. Smooth and powerful.

name: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc 750 mL
summary: Tinhorn Creek Cabernet Franc 750 mL
tasting_notes: Dark purple in the glass reveals a young wine with plenty of structure and deep colour. Elevated nose with black fruit, sage, soy and cedar. Vibrant palate with sweet fresh cherries, red and black berries, and mocha. Great balance of freshness and power, with a long warm finish.

name: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards Oldfield Series Syrah 750 mL
summary: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards Oldfield Series Syrah 750 mL

name: Tinhorn Creek Vineyards The Creek Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Tinhorn Creek The Creek 750 mL
tasting_notes: Beautiful garnet red colour showing barrel ageing to perfection, with a youthful appearance. Nose opens with chocolate and black currant, cassis liqueur and blueberry pie. The wine has a wonderful balance of power and elegance, with layers of chocolate and fresh red and black fruits. The finish is long and supple making this wine approachable now, but the acidity and tannin to go the distance and will reward with significant cellaring.

name: TintoNegro Limestone Block Malbec 750 mL
summary: TintoNegra Limestone Block Malbec 750ml
tasting_notes: Purplish red in colour, this red boasts a intense nose exuding woody, empyreumatic, spicy, floral and fruity aromas. Discover this full-bodied wine expressing lively acidity and offering a broad texture and fleshy tannins. It also unveils a intense mouthfeel that leads into a long finish.
food_pairings: Pair this with roasted game meats or a pepper-encrusted sirloin steak.

name: TintoNegro Mendoza Malbec 750 mL
summary: TintoNegro Mendoza Malbec
tasting_notes: A rich and round textured Malbec with loads of chocolate, dried berry and hints of vanilla character. Full and flavorful.

name: TintoNegro Uco Valley Malbec 750 mL
summary: TintoNegra Uco Valley Malbec 750ml

name: Tisdale Vineyards Merlot 750 mL
summary: One of our top sellers and a staff favorite, this Californian Merlot from Tisdale is great value and delicious. Medium bodied with flavours of black cherry enjoy this with grilled meats and salads - great for a summer barbecue.
tasting_notes: This Merlot offers a smooth, full-flavoured profile with medium body. Flavours of black cherry & mixed berries are complemented by spicy oak aromas creating a balanced & distinctive wine.
food_pairings: Meatstew                                                Perfectly paired with your favourite pasta, stew or grilled meat dishes. We invite you to enjoy Tisdale Merlot and share in life's endless possibilities.

name: Toil and Tears Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Toil and Tears Red Blend is a fruity Californian red with flavours of ripe berries, plum and subtle notes of peppercorn. Fresh and lively it can be enjoyed on its own or with flame grilled burgers or a tomato based pasta.
tasting_notes: Fruit driven and lively, this delicious red blend has flavours of ripe berries, black cherry, raspberry, plum and subtle notes of peppercorn. The palate is medium bodied and velvety with an intense fruity finish.
food_pairings: Fruity enough to enjoy on its own or pairs equally well with foods such as ribs glazed in a sweet or spicy barbecue sauce, flame grilled burgers, tomato based pasta dishes.

name: Tolten by Carmen Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: A dry and full bodied Cabernet Sauvignon from Carmen, Chile's first and oldest winery. Deep purple colour; aromas of vanilla, mint, black currant and cherry fruit, well balanced with ripe tannins and spicy, cedary, cassis flavours; medium finish.
tasting_notes: Dark red in color. The nose recalls a combination of red fruits, red bell pepper, and aromatic herbs. The palate features sweet tannins and tremendous personality.
food_pairings: Meatpasta                                                Try it with a charred burger with aged white cheddar, mushroom pizza, or marinated ribeye steak.

name: Tom Gore Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Dark red color with faint translucence; cherry candy, red currant, mocha on the nose; vivid red cherry initial attack, chocolate and assertive sweet, juicy red fruits, plum, bit of blackberry on the palate.

name: Tommasi  Amarone della Valpolicella  750 mL
summary: Tommasi  Amarone della Valpolicella  2011 750ml
tasting_notes: A full bodied and smooth Amarone that really showcases its dried fruit origins on the nose, with notes of prunes and tobacco towards a balanced finish.
food_pairings: Made in a more traditional style, this wine loves steaks and roasts, but is just as happy with some Pecorino or Parmesan cheese before dinner!

name: Tommasi  Le Prunee  Merlot 750ml
summary: Tommasi  Le Prunee  Merlot 750ml

name: Tommasi  Poggio al Tufo Rompicollo 750ml
summary: Tommasi  Poggio al Tufo Rompicollo 750ml

name: Tommasi Ca' Florian  Riserva Amarone 750 mL
summary: Tommasi Ca' Florian Riserva Amarone delle Valpolicella
tasting_notes: A structured red wine with a remarkable personality and a bright, deep ruby color. Complex and elegant on the nose, with a rich bouquet of black fruits like plums, cherries and blackberries. Red fruits scents, balsamic and spicy nuances with a hint of dark chocolate. Full body with a great elegance. The alcohol is perfectly integrated with the silky tannins, giving the wine a pleasant long finish.
food_pairings: Perfect with braised meats, stews, game. Ideal with grilled red meat and cheese. An excellent meditation wine.

name: Tommasi Casisano Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL
summary: Tommasi Casisano Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL

name: Tommasi Il Sestante Ripasso Valpolicella Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Tommasi Il Sestante Ripasso Valpolicella Red Blend 750 mL
tasting_notes: This wine spent 15 months in oak. This wine has a rich spicy black pepper nose with a hint of truffle followed by an intense, spicy, sweet cherry palate. Well balanced and full of flavors with a long finish.
food_pairings: White and red meat,  game, fresh and aged cheeses.

name: Tons De Duorum Red Blend 750ml
summary: Tons De Duorum Red Blend 750ml

name: Torre del Falasco  Valpolicella Ripasso Red Blend 750ml
summary: Torre del Falasco  Valpolicella Ripasso Red Blend 750ml
tasting_notes: The wine is a charming bright ruby colour and the nose is classic cherry and almond with the palate being more dark cherry with soft, mouth-watering plum and berry flavours.
food_pairings: Pairs well with filet mignon, gnocchi, chipotle chili, and rib roast.

name: Torres Coronas Tempranillo 750ml
summary: Torres Coronas Catalunya Tempranillo 750ml

name: Torres Ibericos Rioja Crianza 750ml
summary: Torres Ibericos Rioja Crianza 750ml
tasting_notes: Opaque cherry red. Rich fruit aromas (cherry, black plum jam) with spicy (green peppercorn) and smoky notes. Intense, warm, with firm tannins nicely structured by oak aging and a backbone of subtle fruit acidity.
food_pairings: Designed to pair perfectly with new trends in avant-garde cuisine. Excellent with all kinds of tapas prepared with fresh ingredients; red meat, oil-rich fish and cheeses. Equally exquisite with cured Ibérico pork. Serve at 14–16°C.

name: Torres Mas La Plana  Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Torres Mas La Plana Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Intense aroma showing all the classic characteristics of the native land of Mas La Plana, together with notes of truffle, toast and wild red berry conserve. Great body and breadth on the palate, with juicy tannins that become balanced and elegant.
food_pairings: This wine's noble and healthy tannins will complement the best meat and game dishes.

food_pairings: Ideal to serve with grilled red meats, stews, pasta with mushroom sauce, and cheeses.

name: Two Hands  Angels' Share  Shiraz 750 mL
summary: Two Hands  Angels' Share  Shiraz 750ml
tasting_notes: Deep dark red with purple core the aromas offer lifted notes of red jellies, blueberry, lavender & gentle accents of pepper with an intriging overlay of Morrocan Spice Temple. The palate is medium to full bodied in nature, gleaming with bright primary fruits of red berry & blueberry accents.Acid is bright and frames the fruit nicely giving good share and vibrancy to the palate. Floral accents of lavender and freshly cut flowers gives good palate complexity.Tannis are chalky in nature and provide great texture to frame the wine. The palate is very boyant with great length and persistence in flavour.

summary: Undurraga Sibaris Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: An intense ruby color and presents fresh, fruity aromas such as raspberries, black currants, ripe cherries as well as subtle notes of spice and chocolate. On the palate is refreshing and displays delicate herbal tones. This is a well balanced wine with expressive tannins, which enhance the complexity and the oak is perfectly integrated and doesn’t override the fruit.
food_pairings: This wine pairs well with beef, game, lamb, pork and mature cheese.

tasting_notes:
This is a fresh, complex wine with a deep violet-red colour. The nose reveals intense aromas of forest fruits and cherries, as well as floral and herbal notes and some subtle hints of earth.
Red fruit and spicy notes are apparent in the mouth. This is a very concentrated and vibrant wine which captivates the palate powerfully and with elegance. Plenty of well-structured, rounded and mature tannins.

name: Veeda Tinto Douro 750ml
summary: Veeda Tinto Douro 750ml
tasting_notes: Deep purple core; aromas and flavours include plum, blackcurrant, cherry, notes of sweet spice and some earthy character; full body, dry.

name: Vega Badenes Tempranillo/Merlot/Syrah 750 mL
summary: Vega Badenes is a unique Spanish blend of Tempranillo, Merlot and Syrah. a highly quaffable light red wine that is the perfect accompaniment to red meats and mature cheeses. Try this at your next gathering with friends and neither you nor your guests shall be disappointed.
tasting_notes: This unique blend from Vega Badenes works extremely well and here they have produced a light red, full of red berry character that is an admirable quaffing wine. The aromas are bright and fruity, the palate soft, well fruited and chewy with light, inobtrusive tannins. It lasts well in the finish and leaves a pleasant, fruity aftertaste.
food_pairings: Ideal for parties, barbecues and just about any accasion as an accompaniment to all kinds of meats, paté or mature cheese.

name: Veramonte Blend 750 ml
summary: Veramonte Blend 750 ml
tasting_notes: A velvety blend with captivating ripe fig and blackberry aromas that mesh exquisitely with notes of nutmeg, vanilla and pepper.
food_pairings: This delicious wine provides the perfect excuse for gathering with friends and enjoying barbecue ribs or grilled meats in general.

name: Veramonte Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL

name: Verite  La Muse Merlot 750 mL
summary:
100 POINTS - Robert Parker, Wine Advocate 2011, 2008 Vintage
"“Still young and unformed, it exhibits phenomenal richness and equilibrium as well as a finish that lasts nearly a minute. Its dense plum/purple color is accompanied by notions of black fruits, forest floor, truffles and spring flowers. It should age for 25-30+ years
tasting_notes: Very beautiful color of black cherries with a bouquet of spices, mustard seed, cloves and a hint of toasty oak. The complex palate opens with spices in harmony with the toastyness; the elegant oak will soften over time. There is a long finish with very fine tannins.

name: Vicente Faria Gloria Reserva Douro Red Blend 750 mL
summary:
A full and vibrant wine, it had plenty of black fruit aromas and flavours, toasty notes and excellent structure along with a pleasing mineral note which wafted up from the glass. It reminded me of standing on the banks of, well on the banks of the Douro, which I have visited in the past. The tannins were fairly muscular and firm but that is what you need when you’re tackling 250 grams of rib-eye steak. A delicious, elegant wine!
If you’re looking for red wines with well balanced structure and fruit, give this Portuguese wine a try, you won’t be disappointed!

name: Vietti Lazzarito Barolo  750 mL
summary: Vietti Lazarito Barolo 2008 750ml
tasting_notes: Deep garnet red in color. Richly rounded with a robust and velvety texture; intensely aromatic with hints of figs and plums. Elegant with soft and sweet tannins, followed by a long finish.
food_pairings: Enjoy this incredible wine with game, red meats or cheeses.

name: Vietti Ravera Barolo  750ml
summary: Vietti Ravera Barolo  750ml

name: Vieux Clocher Cotes du Rhone 750 mL
summary: Vieux Clocher Cotes du Rhone 750 mL

name: Vigna Veja Elio Filippino Barbera D'Alba 750ml
summary: Vigna Veja Barbera D'Alba 750ml
tasting_notes: From the Piedmontese dialect meaning “old vines”, an intense and pervasive fruity bouquet with scents of wood and vanilla.  Full and spicy on the palate, with good body. Ideal serving temperature is 18°C.
food_pairings: Especially suitable for savory first courses, roasted or braised meats, and traditional, fully ripe cheeses.

name: Vigneti del Sole Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Pasqua 750ml
summary: Vigneti del Sole Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Pasqua
tasting_notes: Juicy, full-bodied, with gentle tannins displays cherries, strawberries, and sweet spice. This wine was fermented in stainless steel rather than oak in order to preserve the freshness of the Montepulciano fruit that we all love. Juicy, full-bodied, with gentle tannins, this fantastic bang-for-the-buck displays cherries, strawberries and sweet spice on the palate. Bright, mouthwatering acidity makes it especially food friendly.
food_pairings: Black bean burgers, tomato jam and caramelized onions with some light cheddar. We think the freshness of the wine will play well with sweet jam and onions.

name: Vilain  Syrah Grenache 750 mL
summary: Vilain means "ugly" or "Naughty" in French - such nonsense, this wily cat just wants to play! This blend features aromatic lift with flavours of black cherry, plum, smoked meat and spice with a few creamy nuances.
tasting_notes: Vilain's Syrah/Grenache combo features plenty of aromatic lift and force on the palate. Expect black cherry, plum, smoked meat and spice with a few creamy nuances. Spicy, meaty and fruity components are joined by some ﬁrm tannin on the long ﬁnish.
food_pairings: Rich and smooth this wine is a good accompaniment to Olive tapenade, french onion soup, duck cassoulet or a hearty beef stew.

name: Villa Antinori Rosso Sangiovese 750 mL
summary: Villa Antinori Rosso Sangiovese 750 mL

name: Villa I Cipressi Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL
summary: Villa I Cipressi Brunello di Montalcino 750 mL
tasting_notes: A lively garnet color and with an intense, persistent, full and earthy aroma. Scents of brush lands, aromatic wood, a light trace of vanilla and a blend of fruit flavors can all be found in this wine.

name: Villa Medoro  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 750ml
summary: Villa Medoro  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 750ml
tasting_notes: A lively and bright ruby red color with black cherry, red fruit and spices on the nose. Medium to full bodied the palate possesses a generous almost joosy like flavour profile of ripe dark cherries and dark plum with some leathery overtones and a spicy back palate. Very fine grained tannins. Good depth with medium to long ripe dark cherry, earthy leather and spice aftertaste.

name: Villa Poggio  Salvi Rosso Di Montalcino 750ml
summary: Villa Poggio  Salvi Rosso Di Montalcino 750ml

tasting_notes: This is a savoury wine with red fruit, brown spice, roasted herbs, bittersweet chocolate and coffee flavours. It has a medium weight and good acidity.
food_pairings: Delicious with meat and tomato-based pastas or grilled beef.

tasting_notes: A brilliant shade garnet, lined with deep blackberry and blackcurrant aromas. Fresh and intense on the palate, with fruity Cabernet Sauvignon typicity backed by mocha, black pepper and bittersweet chocolate notes. The lengthy finish delivers a subtle, cle
food_pairings: Like any good Cabernet, this wine pairs very well with grilled steak or other beef dishes. It also goes nicely with aged cheeses.

name: Vina Cobos Felino Malbec 750 mL
summary: Vina Cobos Felino Malbec 750 mL
tasting_notes: A deep red colour with intense violet shades introduces aromas of red berries, floral notes and spices leading to pure, fresh flavours of raspberries and ripe plums. Velvety and refreshing, this wine shows a touch of complexity given by the oak as well as rounded tannins that create a very pleasant finish.

name: Vina Koyle  Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
summary: Vina Koyle  Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 750 mL
tasting_notes: Dark ruby, ripe and pure, with a great presence of blackberry and blueberry fruit, this Cabernet bring bitter chocolate, cedar, tobacco, coffee and spicy notes from the Maipo area. Tannins are well-formed, and come together beautifully, with a silky and b
food_pairings: This wine definitley calls for a big, BBQ steak with a baked potato and all the fixings.

tasting_notes: This typical Cabernet Sauvignon from the Maipo Valley, with notes of ripe red fruits, black pepper, vanilla, dried fruit and a classic touch of herbal aromas. The mouth feel is creamy and concentrated with rounded tannins, a wine that transmits the terroi

name: Vina Vasta Tempranillo Merlot Syrah 750 mL
summary: A juicy blend of Tempranillo, Merlot and Syrah from central Spain that is perfect for everyday sipping! Fresh red fruit flavours of strawberry, raspberry and cherry.
tasting_notes: A medium bodied and smooth Spanish red blend, the Vina Vista Tinto offers aromas of juicy red berries and flavours of strawberry, raspberry and notes of cranberry and cherry.
food_pairings: Enjoy on its own or with Charcuterie, a good thick Pâté, rich red meat dishes or a selection of mature cheeses.

name: Vina Ventisquero Root: 1 Heritage Red 750 mL
summary: Vina Ventisquero Root: 1 Heritage Red 750 mL
tasting_notes: This wine shows a deep ruby red color, completmented by aromas of cherries, blueberries, blackberries, black pepper and delicate notes of cassis, toffee and dark chocolate. The palate opens with abundant fruit-filled flavours including cherries and black fruits. Its silky tannins and good structure create a perfectly-balanced framework for this full-bodied wine with its elegant finish of chocolate covered fruits.
food_pairings: Root: 1 Heritage Red pairs well with barbequed steak, spicy shrimp, or a colorful, fresh stir-fry.

name: Vinha da Urze Douro Red Blend 750 mL
summary: Vinha da Urze Douro Red Blend is an elegant and easy drinking red blend from Portugal's Douro Valley. Made from three classic Portuguese grape varietals you can imagine yourself on a terrace overlooking the Douro Valley from your very first sip! With flavours of blackberry and plum accented by notes of vanilla and spice this wine pairs perfectly with barbecued pork.
tasting_notes: An elegant red blend offering aromas of dark fruit to tempt you in to the fruity and smooth palate, loaded with flavours of blackberry, plum and notes of vanilla and spice.
food_pairings: A great food wine, pair this barbecued pork, teriyaki chicken, black olive tapenade or a selection of grilled vegetables.

name: Wakefield Shiraz Clare Valley 750ml
summary: Wakefield Shiraz Clare Valley 750ml
tasting_notes: The palate is plump & generous with ripe fruit characters of plum and blackberry. Mocha coffee and subtle spice from oak maturation balance the fruit flavours. The wine is medium to full-bodied with a fleshy mid-palate and supple tannin structure. It is a well balanced wine with great texture, good length and enjoyable fruit on the finish.
food_pairings: Enjoy this simple, quick and very flavoursome dish of Kangaroo meatballs in a rich tomato basil sauce. Serve on a bed of spaghetti and with a sprig of fresh basil and some shaved aged parmesan.

summary: Pair with a Vietnamese style salad of seared scallops, chilli, mint and pomelo.
tasting_notes:
A medium-deep red with purple hues, this is an expressive wine. The scent
is invigorating in its vibrancy - earthy and herbal with bright sunny cherries.
To taste, the wine is restrained in its focus, complexly spiced with a wild
cherry spin. It radiates red fruit purity. The tannins are fine with a cool granite
characteristic hovering just under the surface.
food_pairings:
Pair with a Vietnamese style

name: Yarra Yering Dry Red #2 Red Blend 750 mL
summary: "2018’s Australian Winemaker of the Year Sarah Crowe returns with another whizz-bang Shiraz from the cool(er) climate of Yarra Valley, near Melbourne. Hard to describe Yarra wines except by discounting what they aren’t: they don’t have the confected fruit compote of McLaren Vale, they don’t have the black pepper of Barossa, nor are they as light footed as Norther Rhône Syrahs or rigidly structured like Margaret River wines. What they do have is a friendly, comfort-food exterior that can somewhat belie enormous reservoirs of thermo-nuclear inner strength.  Often called an “iron fist in a velvet glove”, Dry Red No 2 is teeming with white pepper, red Nibs and baking chocolate, the body is plenty full but can still do pull-ups, the finish – and it’s famous for this – peers into the portal to forever. Outstanding vintage for a wine notorious for its vintage variation." - Jordan Carrier, Everything Wine Vintage Room Consultant.
tasting_notes: Dry Red Wine No. 2 reveals a medium-deep garnet-purple color and fragrant notes of mulberries, spiced blackberries and black cherries with nuances of violets, peach blossoms and incense. Full-bodied and opulently fruited in the mouth, it has a firm level of velvety tannins, refreshing acid and a very long, spicy finish.

food_pairings: Enjoy with a juicy peppered steak - perfect for barbecue season!

tasting_notes: While you savor this wine you will be enticed by the intense aromas of cherry, vanilla and toasted oak. Flavours of raspberry jam and strawberry with notes of mocha and caramel give this wine a rich and juicy taste.

name: Zenato  Amarone della Valpolicella  Classico 2013 750 mL
summary: Zenato 2010 Amarone della Valpolicella  Classico  750 ml
tasting_notes: Alberto Zenato continues to amaze Amarone lovers with a huge, rich red wine that shows value well beyond its price. Spiced plum, cinnamon and dried berries are just some of the notes on this complex, deep nose, which leads into a 2 minute long finish.
food_pairings: Pairs with most meats and cheeses, but drinks very well on its own.

summary: Zenato  Valpolicella  Classico Superiore 750 ml

name: Zenato  Valpolicella Ripassa Superiore 750 mL
summary: Zenato  Valpolicella Ripassa Superiore 750ml
tasting_notes: Ripasso wines are fondly referred to as 'baby Amarone' by some. Zenato's baby is bigger and richer than most, with a deep ruby-red in color, this wine shows intense aromas of blackberries and black currants underscored by aromas of spice pepper, and a hint of leather. On the palate, it is smooth and viscous with well-balanced acidity and alcohol.
food_pairings: Excellent companion to game dishes, grilled meat and roasts, salami and aged cheeses.
